loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Siena is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Siena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Siena requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Siena has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Siena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall

loans.name: Reisly

texts.en:
Reisly is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Reisly is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Reisly has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Reisly requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Reisly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Reisly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
William es un hombre de 55 años que se dedica a la venta de carne, residente de Chinu, una zona de pobreza pero que gracias a la buena disponibilidad. Al trabajo duro y tener habitantes luchadores, pujantes, con ganas de progreso ha ido mejorando poco a poco.

William es padre de 5 hijos 4 de ellos adolescentes y uno menor de edad, que a pesar de las necesidades y dificultades que se presentan cuentan con un padre que los ama y les lleva el alimento a la mesa diariamente.

William quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 5 cerdos, espera lograr un excelente beneficio que apoye su labor diaria de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
William, age 55, sells meat.  He lives in Chinu, a poor area.  However, thanks to the way the inhabitants are prepared to work hard and the way they are tenacious and vigorous with the desire to make progress, the area has been improving little by little.

William has five children.  Four of them are adolescents, and one is younger.  In spite of the needs and difficulties they face, they have a father who loves them and brings food to the table every day.

William wants to request a loan to buy five pigs.  He hopes to manage an excellent profit to support his daily work of improving the condition of his house.

loans.use: to buy five pigs.

loans.name: Karugutu Orphans S& C Group

texts.en:
Latiff is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is hard working operating a butcher shop on a busy street in town and at the same time a farmer growing bananas,coffee and cassava that add him more income. He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital that hinder progress of his business. However, he has hopes of building a permanent house for his family. 

Latiff has asked for a loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell. He is a member of Karugutu Orphans S& C where members guarantee one another to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy cows to provide a good supply of meat for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is from Goris town, where she lives with her husband and two children. With the help of her husband, Saida runs a farm. 
They work hard in order to support themselves financially and provide living for their children. The farm includes three cows, calves, sheep and hens. near the house, in family's own land, Said and her husband also cultivate wheat, haricot and potato.  Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, and Saida's husband helps her to raise the cattle, and she also sell the gathered milk and meat.
 
Saida is now asking this loan to purchase 30 sheep to enlarge her flock and provide income for the family. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Saida get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Saida hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 30 sheep to enlarge her flock and provide an income for her family

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón, de 45 años de edad, es viudo, es viudo, su esposa falleció hace mucho tiempo y él tuvo que cuidar a sus 6 hijos con mucho esfuerzo, ahora son jóvenes de bien.

Simón, es agricultor desde los 12 años de edad, su abuelo y su padre lo llevaron a la milpa para trabajar duro y desde ese momento está trabajando junto a sus hijos más grandes, para llevar a casa el sustento diario.

Simón, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar cerdos para criarlos y destazarlos.

Simón, sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, además desea que sus hijos se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Simón, who is 45 years old, is a widower. His wife died a long time ago and he had a lot of hard work looking after their 6 children. Now they are all decent young people. 

Simón has been a farmer since he was 12 years old. His father and grandfather took him to the cornfield to work hard and he has worked since then. Along with his oldest children he has worked to put food on the table every day.

Simón needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies and to buy pigs to raise and butcher. He dreams of improving his family's living conditions and also wants his children to have an education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to buy pigs to raise and butcher.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 32-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family which consists of five children. Her husband has been running a crockery pot shop for the last 40 years. He provides different crockery products to the people for reasonable prices. His business is situated in the main market. 

He needs some crockery and utensils to develop his business. In this regard, Bushra made contact to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC issued a loan to Bushra for the development of her husband's business.
 
Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy utensils and crockery for her husband's crockery pot shop.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 22-year-old, single lady she lives in Al Salt with her parents and her four siblings.  Her father is working as a bus driver with a low income and her mother does not work. 

Alaa is studying for her bachelor degree, majoring in nursing. Alaa’s future plan is to take her bachelor degree and work in that field. Alaa is applying for a loan to help her to cover her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her university fees in Nursing

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her firewood business, which sells firewood. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wood for sale, and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and sustain her family. Doreen hopes that in the future she will be able to provide a sustainable wood and charcoal store. 

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Doreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru: Эту женщину на фотографии зовут Ойша. Ей 52 года. Ойша вместе с мужем, невесткой и внуком живут в городке под названием Худжанд. Худжанд еще называют северной столицей. Ойша известная мастерица. Она прекрасно готовит и не оставляет равнодушным не одного человека, который попробовал еду из ее рук. Ойша очень любит свою работу и получает колоссальное удовольствие от процесса работы, и в общем от своей профессии. На пути Ойша возникла преграда. Ее главное оборудование – духовая печь стала работать очень плохо. Она приняла решение обратиться за кредитом и купить новую духовую печь, чтобы не останавливать работу и далее продолжать бизнес.
texts.en: Meet Oysha, the woman featured in this photo.  She is 52 and lives with her husband, her daughter-in-law and her grandson in the city of Khujand.  In Tajikistan, Khujand is also referred to as the northern capital.  Oysha is a well-known cook and no one can stay indifferent to the delicious food that she prepares.  Oysha really enjoys preparing food and she gets an immense pleasure from her work and her profession in general.  However, a hurdle has come her way: her main tool, her oven, has started to work very poorly.  For this reason, Oysha has decided to take a loan and buy a new oven, so that she doesn't have to stop working and she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 56 years old and married with 6 children. With two children still in school, Tita works very hard to provide for them.

Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Tita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, diapers, sanitary pads, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Tita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik has been involved in construction for three years already.  He provides home internal and external construction work in the Ararat region. 

Arayik lives with his wife and two little kids (6 and 3 years old). 

He has now applied for this loan to purchase a rotary hammer drill needed for his construction work. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This is Arayik's first deal with Kiva lenders and he hopes to receive their support and invest in his business.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill for construction work

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 28 years old married man from Samtredia district. He has 3 little children and his wife is a tailor and gets the only income for satisfying family's increased needs. Up until now, her salary has not been enough to address all family-costs since her income is very low. 

Tamaz wants to help his wife to lead the family more effectively and start his own activity. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Tamaz applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Tamaz will start purchasing cattle and sell meat at the local market. 

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will greatly increase. Tamaz and his wife will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and start selling meat, providing a regular income for his family

loans.name: Silvia Margoth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Silvia una señora de 41 años, vive con sus dos hijos, actualmente ellos estudian en una escuela fiscal en el sector.
Silvia cuenta con años de experiencia en su negocio, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella recorre visitando a su clientela, además es directora de cosméticos donde cuenta con hijas que también realizan el mismo trabajo, gracias a ellas ella también gana pero debe estar siempre pendientes de que todo lo hagan bien.
Silvia cuenta con una vitrina en su casa donde tiene toda su mercadería, cada vez que la visitan vende su producto, ella desea seguir creciendo, comenta que gracias a los créditos de la Fundación ha podido mejorar mucho, es clienta desde hace más de un año y se siente feliz por el apoyo que brindan. Con este crédito ella podrá comprar otras vitrinas y comprar más mercadería para surtir por la temporada.
texts.en:
Silvia, a 41-year-old woman, lives in the city of Santo Domingo. She lives with her two children who currently attend a State primary school. Silvia has years of experience in her business. She makes a living selling cosmetics and goes out visiting her customers. She is also the manager of a cosmetics business where she has daughters who do the same job. As a result of their work she also earns money but she has to always be making sure they are doing everything right.

Silvia has a display cabinet in her home where she has all her merchandise. Every time anyone visits her she sells her products. She wants to continue growing and says that thanks to the loans from the Fundación she has been able to improve a lot. She has been a client of the Fundación for more than a year and feels happy because of the support they give her. 

She will use this loan to buy more display cabinets and buy more merchandise to stock up for the season.

loans.use: to buy more display cabinets to display her merchandise.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза живет  в городе Турсунзаде вместе с родителями. Очень отзывчивый, доброжелательный и общительный человек.  В течение  нескольких лет Наргиза  занимается пошивом платьев и  преобразование  новых фасонов. Так как профессия швеи   пользуется неизменным уважением и всегда востребована Наргиза, уверенна,  что  сделала правильный выбор. Но чтобы она  успешно продвигалась, вперед ей необходимо  финансирование,  чтобы она могла купить новую швейную машинку для  пошива платьев. Наргиза  надеется, что Вы поддержите ее,  и  она сможет  реализовать свои мечты в реальность.
texts.en: Nargiza lives in Tursun-zoda with her parents. She is a kind, compassionate, and friendly woman. For the past several years Nargiza has been sewing dresses and designing clothing. Since tailoring is an essential service and always in demand, Nargiza is sure she has made the right choice of profession. But in order to progress, she needs funding to purchase a new sewing machine. Nargiza hopes you will support her so she can realize her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 19-years-old single lady from a village near Nablus city. Her father is a farmer where he gets a very simple income. 

Hala is a student in the university where she studies social sciences. She would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family. 

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay for the new semester. By taking this loan, Hala will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Hala appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay for the new semester fees in Social Sciences

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf is 39-years-old married with 3 children 2 of them attending school, living in Kasese Uganda. Adolf owns a retail shop of a general merchandise like rice, salt and is a farmer growing bean plus rice to earn his side income. Adolf has been in this business since 2007 working 12 hours a day and 7 days a week.

 He is a very hardworking business man who carries out his activities day and night. He has a dream of being the super power in the business, however much he is faced by a problem of limited capital. 

Adolf is seeking for credit to buy stock like rice, salt, cassava and maize flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock like rice, salt, cassava and maize flour for selling.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vivian is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Vivian has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Duden

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Duden, one of Ruma’s agents. Duden lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. Duden is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He just joined Ruma last year.

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Duden's shop. This will allow Duden to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called "Mapan", designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Duden and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 

As a Mapan agent, Duden is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Duden will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Duden believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices. 

Duden is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital to facilitate the introduction of Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 50 years old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, where he sells different types of eatable items e.g samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha etc. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage house hold.

Zareena's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purpose, so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Zareena has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: Мичгона молодая девушка из Душанбе. Она вышла замуж сразу после окончания средней школы. Ее муж работает на автозаправочной станции оператором. Мичгона уже второй год дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Мичгона с мужем вместе работают и стараются поднять семейный бюджет. Они решили отремонтировать дом, но их средства не позволяют им совершить задуманный план. Мичгона сама обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО Хумо поддерживает женщин и предоставляют им более выгодные условия кредитования. Мичгона просит ей помочь купить стройматериалы и кондиционер так как летом в городе очень жарко и трудно обойтись без кондиционера. Она заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: Mijgona is a young woman from Dushanbe who got married right after finishing secondary school.  Her husband works at a gas station.  Mijgona has been sewing women's dresses, from home, for the past two years already.  Both Mijgona and her husband work and do all they can to boost the family's budget.  They have now decided to renovate their home but they do not have the resources to carry out this project.  Mijgona has therefore decided to apply for a loan, because MDO Arvand supports women and offers them advantageous credit conditions.  She is requesting help to buy some building materials as well as an air-conditioning unit, because the summers in the city are very hot and it is difficult to do without air conditioning.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy building materials and an air-conditioning unit.

loans.name: Deibith Patricia

texts.es:
Deibith es una mujer de 29 años de edad, criada en las zonas rurales de Antioquia, es madre de dos hijos y se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino una actividad con la que saca adelante su familia, genera esperanza e ilusión de progreso.

Pagar la educación de sus hijos es su sueño y meta a presente y futuro, mantener su negocio es su prioridad de momento y a pesar de tener fuerte competencia tiene buenas ideas y un amigo incondicional como Interactuar que está dispuesto a estirarle la mano cuando más lo necesita.

Deibith quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que busca ampliar y aprovechar el espacio disponible en sus cocheras, comprara 5 cerdos de engorde y alimento.
texts.en:
Deibith, who is 29 years old, was brought up in the rural areas of Antioquia. She is the mother of two children and makes a living raising pigs. With this work she is able to bring up her family, and it gives her hope and an eagerness to make progress. 

Paying for her children's education is her dream and her goal, both now and in the future. At the moment her priority is to keep her business going and despite strong competition she has good ideas and a true friend like Interactuar which is ready to give her a helping hand when she needs it most. 

Deibith wants to ask for a loan. The reason is that she wants to expand and make the most of the space available in her sheds. She will buy 5 pigs for fattening and pig feed.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs for fattening and pig feed.

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Con esfuerzo, trabajo duro, ahorros y optimismo hace 18 años Manuel monto un pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos, su perseverancia y ganas de progresar le permitieron tener un restaurante en el cual genera tres empleos.

Manuel quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con granos, frutas, refrescos, productos fritos, abarrotes, utensilios, servilletas, platos y bolsas plásticas.

Este préstamo le permitirá tener insumos suficientes para cubrir un periodo de tres meses, aumentara sus clientes, sostendrá su negocio y seguirá dándole a su esposa y sus dos hijos una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
With effort, hard work, savings, and optimism, Manuel set up his small business of selling food 18 years ago.  His perseverance and desire to make progress allowed him to have a restaurant, which generates work for three employees.

Manuel wants to request a loan to stock his business with grains, fruits, soft drinks, fried products, groceries, utensils, napkins, plates, and plastic bags.

This loan will allow him to have enough supplies to cover a period of three months.  He will get more customers, sustain his business, and continue giving his wife and two children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his business with grains, fruits, soft drinks, fried products, groceries, utensils, napkins, plates, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru: Гулистон мать троих детей в свои 49 лет смогла пройти через многое. Оставшись без мужа, она одна вырастила своих детей. В данный момент она торгует на рынке прохладительными напитками. Однако в связи с жаркой погодой ей негде хранить напитки в холоде. Для этого необходим новый холодильник. Именно с этой просьбой она обращается к Вам за помощью в приобретении нового холодильника и аппарата для изготовления напитков. Она очень надеется на положительный ответ.
texts.en: Guliston is the 49-year-old mother of three children and she has gone through a lot in life.  Left without a husband, she has raised her children by herself.  At the moment she sells cold drinks at the market.  However, during the warm season, she has nowhere to keep her drinks refrigerated and she needs a new refrigerator.  It is precisely for this reason that she is turning to you, so that you might help her to buy a new refrigerator as well as machine to prepare drinks.  She truly hopes to get a positive answer.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge and a machine to prepare drinks.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Jafar, one of Ruma's agents. Jafar lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. Jafar is happily married and together with his wife, they have one cute son together. Jafar's main source of income is selling electronics and housewares to his community. Jafar joined Ruma last year and he decided to join Ruma because he wanted to expand his business with technology, and right now, he is also becoming an agent who sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He is a hardworking man and his community sees him as a cheerful and kind mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Jafar needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Jafar’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Jafar is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase mobile airtime credits to help his village community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Âgée de 42ans, Amavi mère de famille revend des produits alimentaires(boisson, riz, tomate...) qu'elle achète dans sa boutique. Elle sollicite un quatrième crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux désirs des clients. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère assurer le bien - être de la famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Amavi, age 42, is a mother who buys grocery items (beverages, rice, tomatoes, etc.) to sell in her shop. She is seeking this 4th loan to stock up on merchandise and better meet customer demand. 

In the long term, her goals are to ensure her family’s well-being and to sustain her activity.

loans.use: to buy general grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cake ingredients such as banana, flour, cooking oil, sugar, firewood

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos,  y su negocio es la venta de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, paciente, optimista, generoso, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Batallas’ localizada a 60 kilometros de la ciudad, siendo una de las entradas al lago Titicaca, donde se aprecia el típico entorno altiplánico, el sitio es famoso por ser el lugar típico de elaboración de la marraqueta, conocida también como pan de Batalla. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Wilmer es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que son mayores de edad y no trabajan, Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno; él se ocupa de comprar terneros para alimentar, criar y engordar para su posterior comercio a mejor precio, “heredé el negocio de mi familia, mis padres están cansados y ya no trabajan, mi trabajo sustenta a mi familia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes en cola de espera, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ganado y forraje. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de engorde de su ganado, él desea realizar la compra de terneros vacunos para su engorde y posterior venta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilmer solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para su engorde y venta y con los beneficios cuidar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 26 years old, single and has no children. He sells cattle for a living.

He is entrepreneurial, independent, patient, optimistic, generous, responsible and hardworking. His business is in Batallas, a town located 60 kilometers from the city. It is one of the entrances to Lake Titicaca, where the typical highland environment is found. The site is famous for making marraqueta, also known as Batalla ("Battle") bread. It has cold, dry weather with temperatures during the day varying between 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Wilmer is a dark complected with brown eyes and short black hair. He is short with a medium physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks at home; he speaks Spanish with the general population and for conducting business. His life is shared with his parents who are old and do not work. They live in a home built of adobe, brick and cement with a tin roof and brick floor. It has electricity and well water.

His business is trading cattle. He buys calves to feed, breed and fatten for further trade at a better price. "I inherited the business from my family. My parents are tired and no longer work. My work supports my family ...," he says. He has the advantage of customers waiting for his business; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of cattle and fodder.

His dream is to improve the quality of fattening his cattle. He wants to purchase beef calves for fattening and sale. This is his first loan with the institution in the four years he has worked in this business.

Wilmer is requesting a loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell in order to support his parents.

loans.use: buy cattle for fattening and selling in order to support his parents.

loans.name: Malohatkhon

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Малохатхон. Ей 23 года. Она живет вместе со свекром и свекровью. Ее муж сейчас на заработках заграницей. Малохатхону посчастливилось недавно стать матерью. Она очень счастлива, она очень сильно ждала своего ребенка и благодарна Бога за такой чудесный подарок.
  После родов у Малохатхон возникли проблемы со здоровьем. Она лечится, но ей не хватает денег на приобретения препаратов. Так как она не может ждать, когда ее муж отправит ей деньги, она обратилась к Вам за финансовой поддержкой. Малохатхон верит, что ей объязательно помогут. Спасибо!
texts.en:
Malohatkhon is 23 years old.   She lives with her mother-in-law and father-in-law, as her husband is currently working abroad.  Malohatkhon recently became a mother and she feels very lucky and happy about this.  She had waited a long time before she could have her baby and she thanks God for this wonderful gift.

However, after giving birth, Malohatkhon started to develop health problems.  She is getting better, but she doesn't have enough money to buy the medications that she needs.  Since she cannot wait to receive money from her husband, she is turning to you, hoping for some financial support.  She is confident that she will receive some help.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase post-labor medications.

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara and her husband live in Tatev village in the Syunik region. They started their agribusiness five years ago with only 50 hens. Donara's main activity is selling agricultural products, home made jams from fruits, honey, vegetables, bread and different kinds of sweets to tourists coming to Tatev monastery which is nearby their home. 

Donara and her husband would like to enlarge their farm and have only cattle. That's the reason Donara asks this loan. She plans to purchase two cows and enlarge her herd. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Donara get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. 

Donara hopes for the lenders' support and is sure this will be an efficient cooperation.

loans.use: to pay for two cows to enlarge the herd of cattle and get income for the family

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián es un joven, talentoso, emprendedor, una persona que quiere estudiar y salir adelante. Vive en un hogar humilde, su deseo de ingresar a la universidad se estaba viendo en apuros ante la falta de recursos para pagar una matrícula e inclusos sostenerle los pasajes, pero este joven no se dejó vencer por esta inconveniente y busco alternativas e inicio a vender mercancía (cosmetología), ahora tiene un pequeño local, surtido y un almacén que se afianza con el pasar de los días y le gustaría aprovechar su buen momento para fortalecer su surtido comprando productos  para el cuidado del cuerpo, cuidado facial, para realizar masajes e incluso para regular el peso.
Su sueño es estudiar, viajar por el mundo y tener la oportunidad de comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a young talented entrepreneur, a person who likes to study and get ahead. He lives in a simple home. His desire is to enter university and he was having difficulties due to the lack of resources to pay for registration including paying for transportation. But this youth has not given up because of this problem. He looked for alternatives and started to sell merchandise (beauty supplies). Now he has a small shop with stock and a store that he is fixing as the days go by.

He would like to take advantage of this good period to strengthen this stock buying body care and facial care product to do massages including weight control. His dream is to study, travel the world and have the opportunity to own his own house.

loans.use: to buy body care and facial care products to do massages including for weight control.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 56-year-old, hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Naseem ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Naseem has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and laces, for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and laces, for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Nelsy Magladi

texts.es:
Nelsy, de 40 años de edad, trabaja como docente en la escuela de su comunidad, está divorciada y vive con su madre y su hijo de 10 años de edad.

Nelsy, tiene 3 años de experiencia de tener una librería y venta de productos de belleza, aprendió algunas cosas de su madre, quien se desempeña como asesora de belleza, fue por eso que decidió colocar su propia venta de estos artículos.


Nelsy, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de belleza, porque se encuentran en temporada de liquidación y ella los venderá en un mejor precio para obtener mejores ganancias y volver a invertir en e ir fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo.

Los sueños de Nelsy son, tener un bazar y una sala de belleza para satisfacer las necesidades universitarias de su hijo.
texts.en:
Nelsy, who is 40  years old, works as a teacher at a school in her community. She is divorced and lives with her mother and 10-year-old son. Nelsy has 3 years of experience owning a book store and selling beauty products. She learned some things from her mother, who worked as a beauty consultant, so she decided to start her own business selling these products.

Nelsy needs a loan to purchase beauty products because it is time for the clearance sale, so she will sell the products at a better price in order to earn more money, which she will use to invest in her business and strengthen her working capital.

Her dreams are to have a general store and a beauty salon so that she can pay for a university education for her son.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Nora has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Julieri

texts.en:
Julieri is 40 years old, married and has four children, all attending school. She lives in Kasese, Uganda and sells second-hand clothes. Julieri needs money to buy second-hand clothing to sell. She is a hard-working and honest woman who faces a challenge of limited capital which hinders her business expansion.
She intends to use the loan to buy to buy second-hand shirts, dresses, skirts and blouses for selling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shirts, dresses, skirts and blouses for selling.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Un negocio de venta alimentos salvo al económica en la familia de la señora Luz Marina quien quedó viuda a cargo de 4 hijos y ella una ama de casa sin experiencia laboral debía buscar alguna manera magina de generar recursos para mantener a su familia.

Desde que inicio la venta de alimentos las cosas han cambiado, ahora sus hijos volvieron a ingresar a la escuela, tienen 3 alimentos diarios, su hogar está bien, pagan sus deudas, pero falta algo, falta ese pequeño capital de más que genere progreso y ella está muy limitada por su capacidad de producción, la cual se la restringe los implementos, equipo y espacio con el que cuenta.

Luz Marina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una nevera, una estufa, una mesa, materia prima para la elaboración de desayunos, almuerzos y productos fritos.
texts.en:
A business selling food is saving the economy in the family of Luz Marina, who is widowed and has four children. She was a housewife with no working experience and had to find some way of generating income to support her family.

Since she started selling food, things have changed. Now her children returned to enroll in school, they have three meals a day, her home is good, and they pay their debts, but something is missing. She lacks that small amount of additional capital to generate progress and she is very limited in her production capacity, which is restricted by tools, equipment, and space.

Luz Marina wants to request a loan to purchase a refrigerator, a stove, a table, and raw materials for making breakfast, lunch, and fried foods.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, a stove, a table, and raw materials for making breakfast, lunch, and fried foods.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 54 years old and married with three children.  

Criselda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Criselda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Criselda has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Criselda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Leon Dario

texts.es:
Leonardo es un lobo solitario de 63 años de edad, no tiene pareja ni familia, heredo un cultivo de café y lo trabaja desde muy joven, este ha sido el trabajo que ha realizado desde que era menor de edad y que espera seguir realizando hasta que su salud se lo permita.

Leonardo es un hombre humilde, trabaja para vivir cómodamente, no busca grandes lujos, es feliz con su vida.

Debido a un problema global que azota a los agricultores que es el alto precios de los insumos agrícolas, Leonardo quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de café, insumo indispensable para cualquier tipo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a 63-year-old single man. He does not have a spouse or any family. He inherited a coffee farm and has worked here since he was very young. He has been doing this work since he was a young boy and hopes to continue as long as his health permits. Leonardo is a humble man and works in order to live comfortable. He does not seek luxury; he is happy with his life.

Due to the high prices of agricultural supplies, which is a global problem facing all farmers, Leonardo hopes to receive a loan to purchase fertilizer, which is a necessary item for every plant, for his coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, a necessary item for any plants, for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Olga Regina

texts.es:
El iniciar un negocio hace tres años cambio la vida radicalmente de la señora Olga, una mujer de 54 años  madre de 4 hijos ellos ya mayores de edad.
Vive en una zona  golpeada por la violencia, donde hay pocas oportunidades y allí sigue ella luchando no pro sobrevivir, solo por mejorar su condición agradece lo que tiene y lucha por conservarlo y mejorarlo, por esta razón inicio su negocio de venta de cerveza y refrescos en cantidades y ahora busca tener un mayor número de inventario por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar estos dos productos en cantidades ya que sus ventas son al por mayor.

Su sueño como ya se había mencionado es conservar y mejorar lo que hoy tiene, su hogar.
texts.en:
Olga's life was radically changed three years ago when she started her business. She is 54 years old and is the mother of four adult children. She lives in an area that has been hit hard by violence, where there are few opportunities, and she continues to fight not to survive, but to improve her condition. She is grateful for what she has and fights to keep it and improve it.

For these reasons, she started her business selling beer and beverages. She now seeks to increase her inventory, so she has requested a loan to purchase these two products in bulk because her sales are in bulk. Her dream, as mentioned, is to conserve and improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase beer and beverages in bulk in order to sell them.

loans.name: Adriana Vanessa

texts.es: Ella es Adriana es una joven emprendedora, luchadora, que quiere comprar una vivienda propia, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como lo es cosméticos, ropa, calzado lo hace ambulantemente pero gracias a sus buenos resultados quiere montar un ocal comercial, por ello busca un apoyo económico para ajustar el dinero que necesita para comprar una vitrina mayor cantidad de surtido y un aire acondicionado todo ello para el local.
texts.en:
This is Adriana, a hard-working young entrepreneur, who wants to buy a home of her own. She makes a living selling merchandise such as cosmetics, clothing and footwear. She does this as a street vendor but thanks to her good results she wants to set up a shop. 

This is why she is looking for financial support, so she can get together the money she needs to buy a display cabinet, a larger quantity of stock and an air conditioning unit, all for the shop.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet, a larger quantity of stock and an air conditioning unit, all for the shop.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a shrewd tea farmer from Ryamuganga, Kakiira Kyamuhunga in Bushenyi district. He is a 27 year old father of 03 and their ages are 9, 5 and 2 only 1 is not school going. He has a tea farming business located in Ryamuganga Kyamuhunga and the main reason he stared the business was and is still to earn income to support his house hold. 

He does trade in shoes alongside the tea farming to supplement his incomes. This tea farming business started in the year 2012 to generate an income to as to support this family. He is borrowing ugx1,500,000 to buy more herbicides to spread his tea plantation so as to earn more profits and this is his fourth loan cycle from UGAFODE. 

The local community are his most frequent clients and people from around Bushenyi and he works for 10 hours a day to serve his clients better and his main challenge is weather changes. But he struggles so hard to beat the competition. He hopes to buy a bigger piece of land to increase on tea production and build a house and educate his siblings into better citizens of the nation and finally asks the institution and Kiva lenders to continue in business.

loans.use: To buy herbicides

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a male aged 28 married with 5 children 2 attending school. He owns a retail shop for glasses and plastics where he is faced with a challenge of limited income. He has an additional source of income of farming. He has been in this business for 8 years in order to sustain his family. 

He describes herself as being hardworking and with hopes of educating my children and being rich; Joseph will use the loan to buy glasses and plastics to sell.

loans.use: to buy glasses and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Ellisel

texts.es:
La fuerte competencia, la creación de nuevas empresas de confección, han llevado a la señora Ellisel a tomar decisiones, buscar alternativas para dinamizar su trabajo y atraer a los clientes.
Ellisel es mujer de 57 años de edad, una persona soltera que se dedica a la confección a terceros, actividad que aprendió de su madre y perfecciono en trabajos. Busco el camino del emprendimiento ya que quería tener unos ingresos altos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que al estar soltera y cuidar de sus familiares toda la responsabilidad económica caía en sus hombros.
La idea que se le había ocurrido a Elissel es comprar una motocicleta para el transporte de la mercancía, entregar un productos a tiempo y en la puerta de la casa sería un plus enorme para su empresa, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta generara un empleo y podrá poner el vehículo al servicios de otras empresas.
texts.en:
Strong competition and the creation of new clothing companies have led Mrs. Ellisel to make decisions and look for alternatives to streamline her work and attract customers.

Ellisel is 57 years old, a single person who is dedicated to third-party dressmaking, which she learned from her mother and perfected by doing. She chose entrepreneurship hoping for high income in order to gain a better quality of life, since being unmarried and taking care of her family placed all financial responsibility on her shoulders.

The idea of buying a motorcycle to transport goods had occurred to Elissel. Front-door, timely delivery of products would be a huge plus for her business. She wants to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to generate employment and to make the vehicle available to other businesses.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to generate employment and to make the vehicle available for other businesses.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is in his late 40s, married and has six children, all in school. He runs a motorbike transportation (bodaboda) business. He manages his own motorbikes. He works hard and has been running this business for five years now, working from 11:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. daily.

George is able to earn a good profit each month. He runs his business with assistance from his wife. He has approached Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to request business loan support. He will invest his loan to purchase his wheels and other spare parts for his motorbike, which is not functioning well.

George desires to expand his business by purchasing another motorbike and to be a successful father. He is so thankful to everyone who will support his business. George will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and other spare parts for his motorbike which is not functioning well.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Glory Hazina Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising hand in the photo is Ann.  She is forty six years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
She does bananas farming as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and book keeping that has enabled her manage the business better than before. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits from improved sales. This will assist her cater for her family’s upkeep and payment of school fees for the children.
Ann is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy quality fertilizer to  increase output and in return increase profits from improved sales.

loans.name: Jesus Cerbeleon

texts.es:
Oscar es un veterano de 50 años de edad, tiene un familia conformada por su pareja y tres hijos adolescentes, se dedica al alquiler activos para banquetes, mesas, sillas, cristalería, manteles, adornos entre otros, es uno de los pocos prestadores de este servicio residentes en montería ya que esta zona es de bajo recursos y no cuenta con mucho capital para preparar grandes eventos, pero Oscar sigue hay dándole buen servicios a lso clientes que acuden a él.


En vista que la alcaldía pertinente está desarrollando eventos, reuniones acuden a empresas del sector para el alquiler de todo la infraestructura y por ende el negocio del señor Oscar está creciendo, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de sillas, estanterías de exhibición y cristalería para acoger grandes eventos.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 50 year old veteran. He has a family made up of his partner and three adolescent children. He works renting assets for banquets, tables, chairs, glassware, table cloths and decorations amongst others. He is one of the few providers of this service living in Montería as it is an area of low resources and doesn't have a lot of capital to hold big events. But Oscar continues to provide good service to the customers who come to him.

When the local city government is holding events and reunions they look to companies in this sector to rent all the infrastructure and in the end Oscar's business is growing. So he wants to request a loan to buy chairs, exhibition shelving and glassware to host large events.

loans.use: to buy chairs, exhibition shelving and glassware to host large events.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is responsible mother of 1 child and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Sumaira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Sumaira's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Sumaira  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Sumaira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Tagonjetsa Group

texts.en:
Ida is 49 years old and the sole provider for her husband and two children. 

Ida will use the money from this loan to expand her small vegetable selling business. She relies on the enterprise to help her family meet their basic needs. 

In the near future, Ida hopes to make enough profit to buy a motorbike for her family. Her goal over the next two years is to save enough money to open a full-fledged grocery shop!

loans.use: To buy vegetables to provide income for her family

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia Delia sigue dedicándose a la venta de frutas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria”, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plátanos entre otros.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Delia continues working selling fruit. She has worked in this business for years, and thanks to her hard work it has gone well. She is part of the communal bank “Señor de Huanca de Patria”. She is a responsible and hardworking person and that allows her to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, among other things. She is grateful and appreciates the loan, and commits to be responsible with her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
Pedro, de 63 años de edad, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y tiene 5 hijos.

Pedro, tiene mucho tiempo de cultivar la tierra y trabajar con ganado y sus hijos han seguido sus pasos, ya que él los ha sabido educar y sembrar en ellos el amor a Dios.

Pedro, está solicitando el crédito para comprar insumos para la temporada agrícola, con esta cosecha asegurar dinero para satisfacer las necesidades de la casa pero también asegurar la alimentación de su familia.

Pedro, desea que su cosecha sea muy buena y que sus hijos se superen y logren grandes cosas en la vida.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 63 years old, is married and his wife looks after the household tasks. They have 5 children.

Pedro has many years' experience in cultivating the land and working with livestock and his children are following in his footsteps, since he knew how to educate them and sow the love of God in them.

He is asking for the loan to buy supplies for the agricultural season so that with this harvest he can be sure of having money to satisfy the needs of his household as well as ensuring that he can feed his family.

Pedro hopes to have a very good harvest and hopes his children will better themselves and achieve big things in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en: Sania is 25 years old and married. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become known for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 35 year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Fatima ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, they are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenses. Therefore, Fatima  has requested a 45,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy more stocks from personal collection to sell for her direct selling personal collection products business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 6 years. Yolanda earns more income from food vending.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks from personal collection to sell

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es:
María es una joven de 18 años de edad, desde muy joven se fue a vivir con su pareja, con la cual inicio hace poco un negocio de venta de teneros, tiene un terreno para ellos y buscan a través de un ayuda crediticia un impulso para empresa, ya que quiere comprar 3 novillos y cuido de levante y engorde.

La importancia de este préstamo radica en la sostenibilidad y crecimiento de su negocio, no se quiere dejar vencer por la competencia y busca tener una empresa para vivir cómodamente junto con su pareja y traer al mundo hijos en dignas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María is 18 years old. When she was very young, she went to live with her partner, with whom not long ago she started a cattle sales business. They have some land and are looking now for financial help to boost their company. They want to buy 3 cattle and food for fattening.

The importance of this loan resides in the sustainability and growth of their business, she doesn't want to let their competitors beat them. She wishes for a business that will allow her to live comfortably with her partner and to bring children to the world in decent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 3 cattle and food for fattening

loans.name: Faber De Jesus

texts.es:
Un trabajo incansable es la mejor denotación para Faber, quien le dedica a su negocio 14 horas diarias, tiene una tienda de abarrotes que el mismo fundo y ha visto a través del tiempo como ha crecido, pero si se preguntan porque trabajo tanto, la respuesta la encuentra cada que llega a su casa, tres motivos que son su felicidad y su fuerza para levantarse y realizar la rutina diaria, sus hijos de 4, 5, 8 años de edad.

Ahora Faber quiere solicitar un préstamo todo destinado para el crecimiento de su negocio, no se quiere detener, tiene proyectos de comprar vivienda, pagar la educación de sus hijos.

El préstamo será destinado para el pago de sus proveedores de granos, refrescos, cervezas y abarrotes.
texts.en:
Unceasing work is the best denotation for Faber, who spends 14 hours daily in his business. He has a grocery store that he started himself and he has watched it grow over time. If you ask him why he works so much, the answer that everyone that visits his house gets is three reasons. His happiness, his strength to get up and carry out his daily routine and his children aged 4, 5 and 8 years old.

Now Faber wants to request a loan which is totally destined to the growth of his business. He doesn't want to stop, he has plans to buy a house and pay for the education of his children. The loan will be used to pay his suppliers of grains, soft drinks, beer and groceries.

loans.use: to pay his suppliers of grains, soft drinks, beer and groceries.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is from Sisian town. A doctor by profession, Nelli also helps her husband with farming works. They are parents of three children (19,18 and 17 years old) and work hard to provide them with good life. 

Family is currently keeps 9 colonies of bees and grow walnut, apple and pear. 

Now, to invest on their farm and enlarge it, Nelli asks this loan. She plans to purchase two calves and six oxen for the farm.
 
This is her second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions before, was very difficult to repay and Nelli faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Nelli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and six oxen to enlarge their farm and get income for the family

loans.name: Jockus

texts.en:
Jockus is a 28-year-old man who is single with no children. He runs a motorcycle transport business. He also earns a salary as an additional source of income. 

Jockus describes himself as hardworking and with hopes of starting up a general merchandise shop in order to have income flowing in all the time. 

His business is faced with the challenge of road accidents, but Jockus is still so determined to buy many motorcycles for his transport business. He will use his loan to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robina is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Robina has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells home use products. 

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more home products for the shop, and will help Robina to generate greater profits and increase sales. Robina hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house. 

Robina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more home products for the shop.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda has been a member of PMPC for over 4 years. She is a skilled dressmaker at her place. As she learned that PMPC has been funding small business ventures, she decided to borrow money in order to augment her tailoring business. 

She is on her 9th loan in an amount of 25,000.00 PHP to purchase different cloth, needles, thread, tailoring chalk and new pairs of scissors. She wishes that through PMPC she will be able to provide opportunities to her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase different cloth, needles, thread, tailoring chalk and scissors

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Él es Miguel es un hombre de 47 años de edad que junto con su esposa están construyendo un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar y necesita tu apoyo, un préstamo que significara progreso, que significara mejora, su local es humilde, incluso usa la nevera de su hogar y necesita abastecerlo para vender más y hacerlo ver atractivo.

Miguel tiene una hija de 14 años su meta es pagarle la educación a futuro por ello solicita un préstamo para su negocio con el cual comprara productos de primera necesidad como lo son huevos, arroz, aceite, papal higiénico, azúcar, sal, frijol, panela entre otros.
texts.en: Miguel is a 47 year old man who together with his wife is building a business selling basic goods items and he needs your help, a loan that would mean improvement. His shop is simple including using the fridge from his house and he needs to stock it to sell more and make it look more attractive. Miguel has a 14 year old daughter and his goal is to pay her education in the future. So he is requesting a loan for his business to buy basic food items like eggs, rice, oil, toilet paper, sugar, salt, beans and diapers amongst others.

loans.use: to buy basic food items like eggs, rice, oil, toilet paper, sugar, salt, beans and diapers amongst others.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent runs a veterinary drugs supply business.  He is 32 years old and supports 4 siblings, ages 24,22,20 and 16 .. only the youngest one is in school.

This vet drug business started in the year 2007 to generate an income to as to support the family. He is borrowing ugx1,500,000 to buy more animal drugs so as to earn more profits and this is his fourth loan cycle from UGAFODE. Animal rearing is a big business among the local people who are his biggest clients. People from around Rubirizi come to him, as he works for 10 hours a day to serve his clients better but he struggles so hard in life to beat the competition. 

He hopes to buy a bigger piece of land and build a house and educate his siblings into better citizens of the nation. He is appreciative of Ugafode services and Kiva support.

loans.use: To boost his veterinary drugs business

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 32-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Five years ago, he opened his car spare parts shop to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Nader is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business. He lately started a car renting business as a second source of income. He still has only one car, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop his car renting business by buying a new car, which will help him satisfy his customers' requests. 

Nader hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to develop his car renting business by buying a new car

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, for which she sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 3,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cloth, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and increase her family's income. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cloth

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, sodas, cooking oil and soap. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, sodas, cooking oil and soap, and will help Agnes to generate and earn greater profits. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to operate a bigger retail shop. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas, cooking oil and soap.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah City. Muhammad is a father for six child he lives with them in a small humble house. 

In Rafah water is not suitable for drinking due by high salinity, Muhammad always concern about health of his children he took a USD loan from FATEN to buy water purification machine.  After that Muhammad can provide clean water for his kids
Muhammad appear in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine to provide safe water for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mats for selling to increase her income and rice for the family’s daily consumption

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 59 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income, to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 29 años de edad, dedicada trabajadora y muy comprometida con el futuro de su familia conformada por su pareja y sus dos hijos el mayor de 11 y la menor de 3.

Empezó con la preparación de almuerzos como una salida a los problemas económicos que tenía en su hogar y al tener que cuidar a sus pequeños tenía que encontrar algo que pudiera hacer desde su casa.

Gracias a su buena gestión, su limpieza, buen sabor de alimentos cada día tiene un almuerzo de más y esto el alegra pues está viendo que su empresa crece, a pequeños pasos pero crece.

Ella solicita un préstamo para mejorar su negocio y tú puedes ayudar a una familia humilde que con trabajo honesto está saliendo adelante, el préstamo será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina, ingredientes, materia prima para iniciar la preparación de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Diana is a 29-year-old woman who is dedicated, hard-working, and committed to the future of her family.  Her family is made up of her partner and her two children, the oldest who is 11, and the youngest who is 3.

She started making lunches to sell as a way out of household financial problems and with having to care for her small children she had to find something she would be able to do from her home.  Thanks to her management, cleanliness, and good tasting food, she has one more lunch to prepare every day.  This makes her happy because she is seeing her business growing, by small steps, but still growing.

She is requesting a loan to improve her business and you can help her humble family, who is getting ahead through honest work.  The loan will be used to buy kitchen tools, ingredients, and raw materials to prepare the food.

loans.use: to buy kitchen tools, ingredients, and raw materials to make food to sell.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan is a 47-years-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Hamidan’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Hamidan  has requested for 45000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Ridwan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ridwan, one of Ruma's agents. Ridwan lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. He owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma last year, and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology, as well as give more contribution to his community.

As the business grows, Ridwan needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Ridwan’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called 'Mapan', so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Ridwan is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase mobile airtime credits for helping his village community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is responsible mother of 5 children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. He needs to do some maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Robina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Robina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Robina  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy many kind of vegetables such as tomatoes, spinach, cabbage, chili

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida has been "banana cue" maker for a long time. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own tasty version of the "banana cue" recipe. She has maximized her profits and keep pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

This the reason why she availed another loan from PMPC, to buy more kilos of banana for her "banana cue" business.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of banana for her "banana cue" business

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 28-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He is a father of two small daughters. Fadi works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. Fadi is also a student in the university where he studies business administration. He would like to finish his studies to improve himself. 

Fadi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Fadi will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma  is 44 years old married woman and a mother of 3 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking and is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married with 10 children, 4 attending school living in Kasese Uganda. He deals in farming growing maize,beans, cotton, coffee and others, working 6 days a week and 6 hours per day. 

He is a hardworking, honest and competent man who further deals in livestock farming as a source of his side income. He is faced with a challenge of pests and diseases thus is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is a 46-year-old married woman who has been purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 44-year-old married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely increase her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 46-year-old, honest married mother of three who all are school-going. She is into a retail shop business and works for six days a week and 10 hours per day. She has another source of income which is stocking and selling soft drinks. 

Robinah started the retail shop business in the year 2005 to generate a living and this business is located in Ishaka division, Bushenyi district. She is borrowing UGX 1,500,000, in her sixth cycle of borrowing. She is borrowing this money to buy more stock for her retail shop. Her clients are people from all walks of life who come to her, hoping to buy all kinds of goods, and also bars in and around Ishaka division. 

Robinah hopes to educate her children into better citizens of this country. She faces a challenge of lack of enough capital though she is a hard-working lady. She applauds the institution and Kiva lenders for their persistence in fighting poverty within the communities and also boosting businesses of small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy daily household use items to sell.

loans.name: Jormor Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Jormor and are into the sale of groundnut paste, eggs, shoes, bags and toys. Rita is 30 years old and a merchant selling groundnut paste. She has been in this business for ten years. Her supplies of groundnut paste are from the big market in the capital and are then sold at her town.
