Rita wants to grow her business, that is, to sell a lot of groundnut paste to meet the needs of the family. She plans on putting all her love into a judicious investment with the funds received. The problem with which she is confronted is sometimes the quick outflow of merchandise.

Rita is married to a retailer of basic supplies at the market in town.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one daughter in a simple house. He has a cafeteria for selling soft drinks. 

He is also a student in the university. He would like to finish his studies to improve himself.
Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his home works and reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study course, so as to improve himself

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her family. For the past 2 years, she has made a living selling personal use products. Her business is located inside her home. Additionally, she travels to different neighborhoods and makes sales as a street vendor.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc. at wholesale in order to continue with her work so that she can earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida  is 49 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 5 children. She along with her husband has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Zahida is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for her children's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, bananas and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sticky rice

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 39 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past six years, she has worked hard to sell women's clothing.  To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes, which will help her increase her income and her profits. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will have enough stock to meet customer demand. She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ishaq

texts.en:
Ishaq is a 20-years-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His fatherworks as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Ishaq is a student in the university where he studies Humanities. He would like to finish his study to improve himself. 

Ishaq took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Ishaq will be able to do his home work and reports easily. 

Ishaq appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study in Humanities

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 41 years old from Kisumu married with nine children whom he is supporting.  He operates a taxi services within Kisumu, a business he has been doing for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of KES. 18,000.  He has applied for his 9th loan which he will use to maintain his taxi

He has a dream of starting farming.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi business

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 36 years old, married to Bernard and supports a family of five children. She has been practicing farming for the last 19 years earning KES2,000 per month.

Linet has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a cow for milk. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to start a retail business in the area. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with educated children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk supply for the family and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Juleta

texts.en:
Juleta is 58 years old and she lives alone in Syunik village of Syunik region. Juleta is a widow. She is a librarian and simultaneously a very skilled farmer; She has a plot of land on which she cultivates apricot, apple, pear trees and she also raises some vegetables. Juleta also has chickens and she sells eggs to her neighbors. Juleta says that her work in the library and her farm’s activities are the occupations which fulfill her every day and she cares both of it greatly. 

This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Juleta asks as she wants to order and settle a tombstone for her beloved husband who died a year ago.

loans.use: to order and settle a tombstone for her beloved husband who died a year ago

loans.name: Ogbede

texts.en: Ogbede is a 35-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling smoked fish in a military camp settlement. She is requesting a GHS 3,000 loan from ID-Ghana to buy more items to sell to her customers. Ogbede has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a 42 year old married woman. She operates a pub and works for 6 days in a week and 10 hours per day. She has another source of income which is farming dealing in Matooke or plantain selling. She started the tailoring business in the year 2005 to generate income to earn a living and this business is located in Kikuba Village- Ishaka division Bushenyi district. 

She is borrowing ugx1,000,000 and is in her fourth cycle of borrowing. She borrowed this money to buy more stock if beverages for her bar. Her clients are people from all walks of life who come to her bar to have a drink. 

She hopes to educate her children up to high levels of learning. She faces a challenge of limited capital to adequately stock her pub. She is however hard working and thinks these will soon be history if she keeps getting financial boosts. She appreciates the services of the lenders and looks toward a better relations.

loans.use: To buy a stock of beverages for her bar

loans.name: Dagoberto Miguel

texts.es:
Que forma de empezar un nuevo semestre que con crecimiento, este el pensamiento que tiene Dagoberto una persona humilde pero trabajadora, padre de dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, vive con su familia y genera los recursos gracias a su negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar.

Dagoberto quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador que le permitirá aumentar la cantidad de inventario disponible en su negocio, un préstamo que marcara progreso y ayudara a l consecución de un sueño a largo plazo que es comprar vivienda propia y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
What better way to start a new semester than with growth. This is the thinking of Dagoberto, a simple but hard-working person, and father of two children aged 7 and 4 years old. He lives with his family and generates resources thanks to his business which is a basic food product store.

Dagoberto wants to request a loan to buy a cooler which will allow him to increase the quantity of inventory available in his store. The loan would indicate progress and help him fulfill a long term dream of buying his own house and paying the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Doria Enildo

texts.es:
Trabajar por superarse y por su familia es el pensamiento del señor Doria un hombre de 50 años de edad que por herencia familiar continua un negocio de cría de pollos el cual espera que en un futuro algunos de sus tres hijos de 9, 7, 5 años de edad lo tomen y se conviertan el sustento de su familia por largas generaciones.

Doria es una persona que no se conformo solo con los conocimientos de su padre, asistió a clases para administrar negocio en el campo y gracias a los métodos y las enseñanzas hoy tiene un negocio estable con proyecciones de crecimiento.

Doria quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de alimento para pollos de engorde, y comprar materiales para la construcción de bebederos y comederos, ya que gracias a los costos que saco a futuro ahorrara mucho con la facilidad que ofrecen estas dos construcciones.

Su sueño es tener una empresa modelo en la vereda y ser exportador de pollos.
texts.en:
Working to better himself and his family is the thought of Doria, a 50-year-old man who, through family inheritance, carries on a business raising chickens.  He hopes that in the future some of his children, who are now 9, 7, and 5 years old, will take it on and turn it into a means of sustaining their family through many generations.

Doria is a person who does not stop at the knowledge from his father, but also attended business administration classes in the country. Thanks to the methods and lessons, he now has a stable business with projections for growth.

Doria wants to request a loan to buy feed for broiler chickens, and materials to build feeders and water stations.  Thanks to the costs spent, he will save a lot in the future with the ease offered by these two constructions. 

His dream is to have a business in town and be an exporter of chicken.

loans.use: to buy feed for broiler chickens and materials to build feeders and water stations.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 37-year-old woman with 1 school-aged child, and lives in the town of Luwero Uganda. 

Scovia has managed her clothing business for 6 years and requests a loan to expand her business, The loan will be used to purchase more skirts, t-shirts, dresses, and generate greater profits.  She will be able to pay for school fees. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, t-shirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Maria Sandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella  se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos posee 15 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, vende sus productos en la época de verano y con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha salido adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticida  y asi tener una buena cosecha para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 43 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She raises basic grains. She has 27 years of experience in agricultural activity. She sells her products in the summer season, and with the earnings that she obtains, she and her family have made gotten ahead. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides and thus have a better harvest in order to have getter earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has no children who are currently in school. For the past four years, she has worked hard to manage her studio, in which she makes photographs. To help expand her business, Martha has requested a loan for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy a photograph printer, which will help her generate greater profits and expand her business. Martha hopes to own a big studio in the future. She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which mainly serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a photograph printer.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a 28-year-old married woman with 4 children (3 attend school) and  lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. 

Nuru has managed her retail shop for 4 years and sells sugar, soda, cooking oil, soap, and beans. 

Nuru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UG from BRAC Uganda to buy these items. This will help Nuru to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Nuru hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Nuru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nuru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar ,soda, cooking oil, soap, and beans.

loans.name: Santos Obdulia

texts.es: Doña Santos vive en casa propia con su hija y sus tres nietos, ella posee una pequeña tienda  ubicada en su lugar de residencia, además se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene 11 años de experiencia en el negocio,  con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, quesillo, maíz, etc. todo por mayor para surtir su negocio y así tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos lives in her own house with her daughter and her three grandchildren. She has a small store located in her house and she also works selling pupusas. She has 11 years experience in the business and with what she makes as profit she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, cheese. corn, etc. wholesale in order to have greater economic income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, cheese. corn, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen  is 27 years old, single woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her father for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She feels happy by contributing to the family income. 

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
This young farmer is 23 years old and his name is Artur. He is just married and he lives with his nice wife in Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region. Artur is a driver and he gives cargo services in his region. He is also a farmer and from the beginning, he had no poor cattle on his farm.  

Here he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, sheep, lambs, chickens and also he has beehives. With the help of his beloved wife, Artur sells his farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat (pork, mutton, beef and poultry), eggs and a little honey. Artur also cultivates and sells good potatoes on his land. 

This loan Artur is sure that will be great for his farming as with the loan amount he will buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel and also fodder for all his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel and also fodder for all the animals on his farm

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia hails from Ronda, Cebu. She is 55 years old and is married to a carpenter. For the last two years, Delia has been earning a living by raising hogs and selling snacks such as puto (steamed rice cake) and bibingka (baked rice cake) in her community.

She is requesting a loan at CEVI to buy feed for her hogs and ingredients for her food vending business, such as sugar, coconut milk and sticky rice.

With your loan, Delia’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will result in an increase of their income. In the future, she plan to expand her business to be more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and to buy sugar, coconut milk and sticky rice for her food vending business

loans.name: Widodo

texts.en:
Widodo lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. He lives with his wife and three children, one daughter and two sons, and earns a living by selling mobile airtime credits to people in his community.  

As his business grows, Widodo needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to acquire more mobile airtime credits to sell to people in his community so they can connect with loved ones no matter how far apart they are. Widodo’s goal for the future is to serve as an e-commerce business so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Widodo is grateful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Felicia Sofia

texts.es:
Felicia es una tierna y adorable abuela de 62 años de edad, una persona que gusta mucho de trabajar y ama su tienda de abarrotes, no solo por los beneficios económicos que le genera, el solo hecho de la interacción, de estar ocupada, es saludable y gratificante para ella.

Inicio su negocio por vocación al trabajo, su deseo es comprar una vivienda propia, para ello tiene que mejorar sus ventas, comprende que tiene una edad avanzada y debe acelerar su paso.

Felicia solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, con la que seguirá en pie su proyecto de comprar vivienda.
texts.en:
Felicia is a sweet and lovable grandmother. She is 62 years old and really likes to work at her grocery store. She loves it not just because of the financial benefits, but because she can interact with others and keep busy; the work keeps Felicia in good health and is very gratifying.

Felicia started this business because she wanted to work. Felicia wants to own her own house but, to do so, she must increase sales. Felicia knows that she is older and must pick up the pace in order to buy a house.

Felicia is applying for a loan in order to stock up on staple goods and thus continue working towards her goal of buying a house.

loans.use: to stock up on staple goods and thus continue working towards her goal of buying a house.

loans.name: Salamti

texts.en:
Salamti is 49 years old married woman and a mother of 2 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk and she owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 33-year-old married woman with 6 children (all attend school) and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. 

Regina has  manage her clothing business for 3 years. 

Regina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UG from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes.  She wants to generate greater profits and boost the business. Regina hopes  to have a bigger shop in the future. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Regina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, with five of them currently in school. For the past five years, Madina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, sodas, cooking oil, soap, beans, and Blue Band margarine.

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, sodas, cooking oil, soap, beans, and Blue Band, and it will help Madina to generate more sales and increase her profits. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her land. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Madina, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, sodas, cooking oil, soap, beans, and Blue Band margarine

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en: Hanifah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, she has worked hard to run her fish-selling business. To help expand it, Hanifah has requested a loan for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will allow her to buy more fish so she can generate greater profits and meet other household needs. In the future, she hopes to open a new branch of her business. Hanifah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which mainly serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Ismail has been working hard to manage her business, which deals in spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Ismail has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and it will help Ismail to generate greater profits and increase sales. Ismail hopes that in the future she will be able to buy more land. 

Ismail is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Ismail, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more spare parts

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 37-year-old single Palestinian man. Due to the low social and financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, he started working four years ago as a car blacksmith to cover his needs and expenses.

Firas is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business and improve his living conditions, thus today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy furniture for his house to prepare it for his wedding.

Firas hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and provide his future family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house to prepare it for his wedding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sausage to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to support her business. 

Recently, Mildred took a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. 

Mildred wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply vegetables to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel to concrete the floor of her home.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afi is 35 years old and started a grocery business to sell vegetables, charcoal, and cooking oil in Teshie. She used the previous retail experience  to establish a successful business. Every day at dawn, neighborhood residents can shop for grocery items.

Afi is very committed to her business since it provides income for her family. She has one child who attends school. She will use this  sixth loan from ID-Ghana to purchase milk, cheese, eggs, meat, fruit, vegetables, charcoal, and cooking oil. 

Her goal is to locate her business in a sector of higher sales.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, eggs, meat, fruit, vegetables, charcoal, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maricela Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maricela, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, no continuo estudiando porque la escuela le quedaba a diez kilómetros desde su casa; hoy en día está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y su hija todavía no va a la escuela. 

Maricela, se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar y a apoyar a su esposo en la agricultura cuando va a fertilizar la milpa, ella sabe cómo hacerlo porque con sus padres lo hacía, el lugar donde siembran está a medio kilómetro de su casa.   

Maricela, necesita el dinero para comprar 3 sacos de abono para fertilizar la milpa, con ello estará abonando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, todo para asegurar la alimentación del año venidero para su familia. 

Maricela, sueña con tener una casa digna para vivir y tener un terreno propio.
texts.en:
Marciela is 31 years old and studied up until the sixth grade. She couldn't finish her studies because the school was 10 kilometres from her home. 

Nowadays, Marciela has a partner who works as a farmer and a daughter who hasn't started school yet. Marciela looks after their home and supports her husband to fertilize the maize fields. Marciela knows this work well as she used to do it with her parents. The place where they grow the corn is half a kilometre from their home. 

Marciela needs money to buy three sacks of fertilizer to fertilize the maize fields.With this quantity of fertilizer, Marciela can treat 7,000 square meters of maize, which will ensure the family's food for the coming year. 

Marciela dreams of having a decent home and some land of her own.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer to fertilize the maize fields.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 33 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is a widow with 6 children, 4 attend school. For the past 3 years, Aisha has worked hard to manage her retail shop to sell phone accessories. 

Aisha has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UG from BRAC Uganda to purchase phones, chargers, batteries, and other accessories.  This will help Aisha to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Aisha hopes in the future to construct a house. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase  phones, chargers, batteries, and other accessories.

loans.name: Guddy

texts.en:
Guddy is a 48-year-old married woman with 3 children and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. 

For the past 5 years, Guddy has worked hard to manage her clothing business.  Guddy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGfrom BRAC Uganda to buy more garments and generate greater profits. Guddy hopes to meet the family's basic needs. 

Guddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Guddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more garments.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children (2 attend school) and lives in the town of Nateete A in the Kampala region of Uganda.  

For the past 4 years, Florence has worked hard to manage her charcoal business. 

Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UG from BRAC Uganda to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy sacks of charcoal, generate greater profits, and increase income. Florence hopes  to buy a  truck for business purposes. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Margaret has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Margaret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bigger sauce pans, spoons, kettle, and will help Margaret to generate greater profits and generate more income. Margaret hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better restaurant. 

Margaret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margaret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy bigger sauce pans, spoons, kettle

loans.name: Vaster

texts.en:
Vaster is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Vaster has been working hard to manage her grocery, which sells sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans 

To help expand her business, Vaster has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans and will help Vaster to generate greater profits and increase family income. Vaster hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Vaster is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vaster who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells posho,sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans,blue band. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more posho,sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and increase profits. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more posho,sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

loans.name: Calorine

texts.en:
Calorine is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children (all attend school) and lives in the town of Nateete A in the Kampala region of Uganda. 

For the past 2 years, Calorine has worked hard to manage her fruit and vegetable business. 

Calorine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UG from BRAC Uganda to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, bananas, irish potatoes, avocados, and egg plant. It will help Calorine to generate greater profits and expand her business. 

Calorine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Calorine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, bananas, irish potatoes, avocados, and eggplant.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Charity has been working hard to manage her bar business which sells beers, waragi, water, soda, passion fruits. 

To help expand her business, Charity has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer. water. soda, and will help Charity to generate greater profits and expand business. Charity hopes that in the future she will be able to provide the best services to her customers. 

Charity is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charity who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more crates of beer. Water. Soda

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María es una empresaria con mente ganadora, una persona de 49 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia de dos hijos con un excelente negocio de cría de aves que inicio por necesidad económica ya que se separó de su esposo y este representaba todos los ingresos para el hogar.

Ahora ella tiene un negocio rentable y con un excelente futuro, ha logrado sostener a sus dos hijos y convertirse en una fuerte competidora en el mercado.

Buscando mejorar, llegar a un mayor número de clientes, María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de aves como lo son pollos y codornices, en lo posible recién nacidos ya que todo el proceso de crecimiento y engorde lo realizan en sus galpones.
texts.en:
María is a businesswoman with a winning mindset. She is 49 years old and the female head of a home with two children. She has an excellent business raising poultry that she started out of economic necessity after she separated from her husband and become solely responsible for the household costs. 

Now Maria has a profitable business with an excellent future. With this business Maria is able to support her two children and her business has become a strong competitor in the market. 

Maria is seeking a loan to increase her customer base, she will use the loan to buy poultry such as chickens and quails, newborn chicks that she will then raise and fatten in her poultry sheds.

loans.use: to buy poultry such as chickens and quails.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 26 years old and is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Zurabi

texts.en:
Zurabi, who is a 64-year-old hard-working man, lives in Kutaisi, a city in western Georgia. He has a housekeeper wife, a son, a daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

Zurabi works hard, and has been doing so for 22 years, aiming to provide good living conditions for his family. He is an electrician and also works at the security service. Zurabi has a great desire to make an additional source of income and improve his family's living conditions somehow. He decided to start poultry farming and to seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The startup loan program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Zurabi's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $2,300 for purchasing building materials and building a hen-house. Zurabi will start breeding chickens and will sell locally at a good price.

The startup credit will be a great support for this family, as their income will be significantly increased. They send regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to build a hen-house and start chicken breeding

loans.name: Julio Abel

texts.es:
Él es Julio un carismático y servicial caballero de 52 años de edad, propietario de una tienda de abarrotes, la humildad, sinceridad y felicidad que reflejan sus ojos es síntoma de una vida bien vivida y a pesar de no contar con lujos, propiedades él supo valorar  apreciar lo que la vida le dio, un trabajo, una familia, unos hijos y por ellos es que madruga diariamente y se esfuerza por llevarles el pan de cada día.

Pensando en su familia, en dejar un buen negocio a sus hijos Julio le gustaría solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de primera necesidad como lo es arroz, azúcar, café y productos de aseo personal.
texts.en:
This is Julio, a charismatic and attentive 52-year-old gentleman who is the owner of a grocery store. The humility, sincerity, and happiness that are seen in his eyes are the result of a life well lived. Despite not having luxuries or properties, he has been able to value and appreciate the things that life has given him: a job, a family, and children. It is for his children that he wakes up early every day and works hard in order to take home the daily bread.

Thinking about his family and wishing to leave his children a good business, Julio is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of staple goods such as rice, sugar, coffee, and personal care products.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of staple goods such as rice, sugar, coffee, and personal care products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits like banana, apple, orange, mango, water melon and etc.

Carmen has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits like banana, apple, orange, mango, water milon and etc

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a widow, 61 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat and additional material for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat and additional material for her food production business

loans.name: Clarise May

texts.en:
Clarise May works hard to support her family. Clarise May is married with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Clarise May requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Clarise May has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married with one child and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits like banana, apple, orange, mango, water melon etc.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits like banana, apple, orange, mango, water melon  etc

loans.name: Sabunyama Group

texts.fr:
Djiriba est la personne tenant la corde attachée au mouton. 
Tout en voulant une bonne marche pour l’amélioration de l’élevage de ses moutons, Djiriba a eu quelques  anomalies en cours de route qui est un problème de financement à cet effet, il à demander l’appui financier du RMCR en vue de pouvoir générer plus de gains et de pouvoir acheter plus de moutons et plus de tourteaux  pour avoir un meilleur changement dans sa vie familial. Il est analphabète âgée de 28 ans, marié, père de 02 enfants âgées de 06 à 03 ans, sa femme fait le ménage et le maraichage.
Son approvisionnement est faite dans les foires locales et après avoir les élevés il les vend dans les mêmes foires locales à des prix qui lui permet de réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel de 40000f par cycle de prêts. Il rêve  d’être indépendant dans l’avenir, ce prêts l’aide à supporter les couts liés à l’activité, il fait cette activité depuis 08 ans, les revenus qu’il obtient résume en tout son plaisir dans ce travail. Il est confronté à quelques obstacles tel que la chute des prix et la mort tragiques des animaux.
texts.en:
Djiriba, age 28, is a sheep breeder. He is the one holding on to the sheep in the group photo. Djiriba is illiterate. He is married with two children ages 3 and 6. His wife is a housekeeper and a market gardener. 

While striving to sustain a successful sheep raising business, he encountered financing problems along the way. He partnered with RMCR to buy more sheep and cattle cakes, hoping to bolster his income and improve his family life. He buys the sheep at local fairs, raises them and resells them at the same fairs for a profit averaging 40,000 F per loan cycle. 

These loans help him to cover the costs of his activity, which he has been practicing for 8 years. Some of the obstacles he has to face are drops in prices and the tragic death of animals. The revenue earned brings him all the joy he finds in his work. His hope for the future is to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy sheep and cattle cakes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Don Jose tiene de 53 años, está casado con la Sra. Gerónima, comenta que se dedica a la venta de dulces que ellos mismos fabrican con la ayuda de su esposa, tiene una clientela formada que se muestran satisfechos por la calidad que les ofrecen.
Don Jose comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil al empezar su negocio, pero que se fue abriendo camino con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de azúcar al por mayor, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su dulcería. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 53 years old and lives with Mrs. Gerónima. They sell sweets that he and his wife make themselves. They have a well-established client base which has been satisfied by the quality that they offer. 

Don Jose wants to mention that, initially, it was very difficult to start the business, but that it opened up new pathways in his career. He is seeking a loan to buy sugar in bulk, as it will enable him to carry on running his sweet-making business. He is grateful for the opportunity to carry on improving.

loans.use: To buy sugar in bulk

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Robinah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells beverages. 

To help expand her business, Robinah has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sodas, splash, water, beers and will help Robinah to generate greater profits and increase monthly profits. Robinah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a home. 

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more sodas, splash, water, beers for her beverage shop

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which rears poultry. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fees and vaccinations and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and increase profits. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to promote business. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy fees and vaccinations for her expanding poultry business

loans.name: Emilfe

texts.en:
Emilfe is 28 years old, single and has been in office supplies business for almost 3 years. His first loan with PMPC serves as additional working capital to start up his business. 

He finds hope as he turns the odds in business into opportunities to expand. He asked for another amount of 15,000.00 PHP as additional capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise goods such as paper and stationary, and office supplies

loans.name: Haykaz

texts.en:
Haykaz from the village Varser of Gegharkunik region lives with his wife, his son and his son’s family. Haykaz is the only employed person in his family. He works at the gas station. Farming is considered as the main source of income for their everyday needs. 

On the farm, Haykaz has cows, calves, a heifer, sheep, pigs, lambs and also chickens. His wife and daughter-in-law greatly organize the sale of their farm products such as milk, cheese, eggs and Haykaz with his son find buyers for their farm meat. On his plot of land Haykaz cultivates potato, cucumbers, tomato, garlic, peppers and greens. He sells his farm’s goods to re-sellers right from his farm. 

Haykaz asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams as he needs to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and some fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
José es una persona polivalente de 64 años de edad el cual realiza dos profesionales que son la cría y levante de cerdos y taller de mantenimiento de bicicletas. Actividades que inicio hace aproximadamente 30 años.

Estas dos actividades le permiten sobrevivir y salir adelante y a pesar de estar en una zona de muy bajos ingresos este hombre genera diariamente el sustento para su familia conformada por 2 hijos y su pareja.

Con la intención de mantener su forma de trabajar, de tener inventario de repuestos y reforzar su negocio de cría de cerdos, José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de:
•	Cerdos de levante 
•	Alimento para cerdos
•	Cemento y arena (construcción de cocheras)
•	Mantenimiento de compresor para inflar llantas de bicicleta y mangueras nuevas.
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old and a man of many trades who makes a living from two types of work: raising pigs and a bicycle maintenance workshop. 

Jose started both of these lines of work approximately 30 years ago and they have allowed him to survive and support his family. Despite being in a region with very low income, Jose has been able to generate enough money everyday to take care of his family, which is made up of his partner and two children. 

With the intention of keeping his work going, to have an inventory of spare parts and strengthen his pig-raising business, Jose is seeking a loan to buy: 
•	Pigs to raise 
•	Pig feed
•	Cement and sand (sheds construction)
•	Compressor to inflate bicycle tires and new tubes.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and materials to construct sheds.

loans.name: Menalyn

texts.en:
Menalyn is very thankful to Kiva for granting a loan amounting to PhP 15,000. With this Menalyn bought new plastic ware products such as chairs, clothes hangers, laundry baskets and was able to pay the rental advances for a stall to sell their products in a big public market. Menalyn business is doing good, for a new plastic ware store in the area, it already has regular customers and because the location is in the market, a lot of people patronized her products. Menalyn was able to pay her loan on time and was able to hire a helper to her store, also a distant relation from the provinces. 

Menalyn wanted to expand her business and increase her stocks in her stall. Menalyn is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy more plastic ware products such as clothes hangers, chairs, pails, plastic tubs, plastic shoe rack and laundry baskets.

Menalyn is confident that with the new loan she will be able to continuously expand her store add new and more stocks to meet the demand of her customers and increase her income more. Menalyn is still saving for their future and still eager to help her distant family by providing them employment.

loans.use: To buy more plastic ware products such as clothes hangers, chairs, pails, plastic tubs, plastic shoe rack and laundry baskets

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 43 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is Married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her catering business, which provides catering services. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy decorations plates, warmers and will help Flavia to generate greater profits and improve business. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to have a great business. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flavia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy decorations, plates, warmers for her food service business

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 41 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells, bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans and will help Justine to generate greater profits and improve the business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to have a great business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells, bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans,blue band. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

loans.name: Jose Antonio Virgilio

texts.es: José tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hermana de 33 años de edad. José se gana la vida trabajando como jornalero desde ya hace varios años y es  un hombre conocido en su comunidad por su dedicación al trabajo y su responsabilidad. José anteriormente solicito un crédito para invertir en la construcción de una pila para reguardar el agua y además pudo cambiar una parte del techo de la casa que estaba en malas condiciones, debido a su grata experiencia y lograr su objetivo desea seguir invirtiendo en las mejoras de la vivienda por lo que decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, lámina y madera para construir una pequeña galera en el área del lavadero y evitar los rayos del sol mientras lava la ropa de uso diario.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and lives in his own house, together with his 33-year-old sister. José makes a living working as a day labourer and has done so for several years. He is a well-known man in his community for his dedication to work and his responsibility.

José previously requested a loan to invest in the construction of a basin in which to collect water, and was also able to replace part of the roof of his house, which was in poor condition. Due to his pleasant experience and being able to achieve his goal, he wished to continue investing in home improvements, so he decided to request another loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, laminate and wood to build a small shed in the laundry washing area and be sheltered from the sun while washing everyday clothes.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, laminate and wood to build a small shed in the laundry washing area and be sheltered from the sun while washing everyday clothes.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 39 years old, married woman and is the mother of 4 children. She deals in business selling animals to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She is working hard to bear her household expenses. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 30000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is single woman living together with her child. She is living in a family house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated cosmetics at her residence. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of cosmetics in her township.

With the GHS 1,500 she wants to purchase cosmetics for resale. She decided to join ID-Ghana  to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman, 60 years old and has seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Imelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline and other materials for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel, de 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive junto con sus hermanas y sus dos sobrinos.

Anabel, tiene una tienda desde hace más de 5 años en su casa, cerca de su casa hay una cancha de futbol, donde llegan muchos jóvenes de la comunidad a jugar y es con ellos que ella vende sus productos.

Anabel, necesita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, detergente, pan, huevos, entre otros productos de primera necesidad y es por eso que necesita el dinero porque ella no cuenta con lo suficiente para surtirla.

Ella, sueña con tener una tienda más grande, para obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Anabel is 29 years old, a single mother, and has two children. She lives together with her sisters and her two nephews. For more than five years, Anabel has run a store from her house. Close to her house there is a soccer field, where many youths from the community go to play, and they are the ones who she sells to. 

Anabel needs the loan in order to buy rice, beans, bread, eggs and washing detergent, among other key products. She needs the money because she does not have enough to stock her store. Her dream is to have a bigger store in order to obtain better income and improve her economic condition.

loans.use: to invest more in her store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.

She practices poultry, dairy, and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed and fertilizers and hence increase her dairy and vegetables production. With increased income, she will be able to pay for her family's food and clothing.

Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers and hence increase dairy and vegetables production for increased income to pay for food and clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane wishes to thank Kiva for the financial support that enabled her to buy quality poultry feed. This increased her eggs production, and she was able to meet her customers’ demands and also increased her income. With increased income, she was able to pay part of her children's school fees.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and certified vegetable seeds to diversity her farming. This will supplement her income and hence she will continue paying school fees for her children and also pay for food and clothing.

Jane is grateful to Kiva for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and certified vegetable seeds, for increased income to pay for school fees, food, and clothing.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 40 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Salima has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in clothes. 

To help expand her business, Salima has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Salima to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Salima hopes that in the future she will be able to open a wholesale shop. 

Salima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for her store

loans.name: Jazmin Sarai

texts.es: Jazmín de 25 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de ser madre soltera está sacando adelante a su hija de 6 años de edad con la que vive en casa propia desde hace 3 años. Jazmín se dedica desde hace 1 año a prestar sus servicios de cosmetología en una sala de belleza, pero ella desea poder realizar trabajos en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plancha para cabello, pinza para ondas, secadora de cabello, ganchos con cintillo, etc., y de esta manera sacar adelante a su hija y tratar de brindarle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Jazmín, 25, is a hard-working woman who, despite being a single mother, is supporting her 6-year-old daughter. They have lived in their own home for the past three years. 

For the past year, Jazmín has been offering her cosmetology services at a beauty salon, but she wants to be able to work from home.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy a hair straightener, a curling iron, a hair dryer, hair clips with ribbon, etc. This will allow her to support her daughter and try to give her the best.

loans.use: to buy a hair straightener, a curling iron, a hair dryer, hair clips with ribbon, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena de 64 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a sus cinco nietos de 21, 19, 17, 15 y 12 años de edad. Magdalena desde hace ocho años en su casa de habitación posee una pequeña granja de vacas que a diario le dan leche  la cual  comercializa  con las personas que habitan en su comunidad, gracias a las ventas y los buenos ingresos que esta actividad le brinda ayuda a suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar, además recibe los ingresos de su hija que hace varios años emigro al extranjero en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas y poder  sacar adelante a toda su familia. Magdalena con el motivo de mejorar su calidad de vida  desea cambiar el techo  de su hogar que está en mal estado y construir las paredes de su vivienda las cuales se encuentran deterioradas, es por ello que tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito en FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de lámina, ladrillo, polines, arena y cemento para hacer las reparaciones antes mencionadas y de esta forma poder brindar a su familia una vivienda más digna y segura.
texts.en: Magdalena is 64 years old and she lives in her own home with her five grandchildren who are 21, 19, 17, 15 and 12 years old. For eight years now, Magdalena has owned a small barn where she keeps dairy cows. She sells the milk to people who live in her community. Thanks to the sales and the income she earns, she is able to pay for the basic needs of the household. She also gets some money from a daughter who left to live and work abroad several years ago and sends money home. Magdalena would like to improve her quality of life and she wants to repair her roof, because it is currently in bad condition, and she would also like to build walls for her home because they are currently deteriorating. And so, she has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase laminates, bricks, 2X4s, sand and cement in order to make the aforementioned repairs and improvements. This will help her be able to give her family a more secure and dignified dwelling to live in.

loans.use: to purchase laminates, bricks, 2X4s, sand and cement to repair her roof and build walls for her home.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 35 years old and married with two children. Analie works very hard to provide for them.

Analie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, coffee, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Analie has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, coffee, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc. 

Analie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, coffee, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geraldine is 43 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Geraldine has a buy and sell sea foods business in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs, shrimp, oyster and other sea foods to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs, shrimp, oyster and other sea foods to sell

loans.name: Luisa Angelica

texts.es:
Luisa es una joven con 20 años de edad, con una hija menor, trabajadora y emprendedora, desea abrir su primer negocio, un almacén de ropa, con el fin de sacar a su hija a delante.

Su sueño es comprar una vivienda propia.

Solicitó un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio de blusas, jeans, calzado y bolsos. Espera formalizar su negocio e incrementar las ganancias.

Ayude a que Luisa cumpla su sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Luisa, 20 years old, is a young woman with a daughter. She is hardworking and enterprising, and wants to open her first business, a clothing store, in order to get ahead with her daughter. Her dream is buy a home of her own.

She has requested a loan to stock her business with blouses, jeans, footwear and handbags. She is looking to formalize the business and increase profits.

With your loan, you can help Luisa to reach her dream.

loans.use: to stock her business with blouses, jeans, footwear and handbags. She is looking to formalize the business and increase profits.

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey is a 40-year-old single mother of two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Salomey has a buy-and-sell ice chest, pegs, scribing brush, napkins and hangers business in the Accra-Teshie. Salomey is requesting for GHS 1,400 loan from ID-Ghana to purchase ice chest, pegs, scribing brush, napkins and hangers to sell in the market.

Salomey has been in this business for 9 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase an ice chest, pegs, scrubbing brush, napkins and hangers to sell in the market.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Gracias a su negocio de venta de helados esta mujer llamada Beatriz ha encontrado una salida a su crisis económica. Beatriz es comúnmente conocida por ser una criadora de aniamles y agricultora, junto a su esposo tiene sus terrenos y sus animales, pero están pasando por un momento complicado, donde su negocio de helados le están dando una mano para sacar adelante el otro negocio.

El propósito principal que tiene Beatriz para trabajar es pagar la educación de sus hijos por ello no se rinde y luchara incansablemente para lograr cumplir esta promesa.

Beatriz se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para realizar el pago a los proveedores de helados y compra de mayor surtido de helados.
texts.en:
Thanks to her business selling ice cream, this woman named Beatriz has found a way out of her economic crisis. Beatriz is commonly known as an animal breeder and farmer. Alongside her husband, she has her land and her animals, but they are going through a complicated time, where her ice cream business is giving them a hand to get on with the other business.

The main purpose that Beatriz has for working is to pay the education of her children. Because of it, she doesn't give up and will fight tirelessly to get to  fulfill this promise.

Beatriz is requesting a loan to make a payment to the ice cream suppliers and to buy a larger selection of ice cream.

loans.use: to pay ice cream suppliers and buy a larger selection of ice cream.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 38 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming and mostly dairy and vegetables farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure so as to increase production, especially of potatoes and carrots. Hence she will have more income to pay school fees for her children.

Salome is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure, and hence increase vegetables for increased income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
The gentleman in the photo is Wilson. He is twenty-six years old, married, and a father of one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in September 2014.

Wilson does maize, beans and potato farming in his small ancestral farm. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he is now able to manage his farming business well and profitably. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to obtain a good harvest and higher income from the sale of his farm produce. This will enable him to support his young family and buy land to expand his farming business.

Wilson is happy for Kiva and their lenders. He appreciates the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to boost sales and lead to more income.

loans.name: Upendo Tumaini Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Edward. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development.

He is involved in a shoe selling business. He also works as a security guard so as to supplement his income. He has applied for a Kiva loan to buy more shoes hence add stock for increased income.  This will help him pay his children's tuition fees.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.  He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more shoes hence add stock for increased income to pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.name: Mogoon Women Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Samson. He is a member of Mogoon Women Group. He is 66 years old and married with two children. He is a maize farmer and also does poultry farming. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial savings, he has learnt how to draft his budget and plan well for future. 

Samson is borrowing a loan from Kiva which he intends to use to purchase chicks to boost his poultry business hence be able to provide food to his family.  Samson is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicks that will boost poultry business thus provide food to the family.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Patricia has been working hard to manage her timber business, which deals in timber sales. 

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber and a machine for cutting timber, and will help Patricia to generate greater profits and increase on daily use. Patricia hopes that in the future she will be able to become the best enteprenuer. 

Patricia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patricia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more timber and a machine for cutting timber

loans.name: Wikwatyo Wa Atui S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Scollastica, a member of Wikwatyo wa Atui SHG. She is fifty-nine years old, married, and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in dressmaking and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a sewing machine that will consequently increase her income. This will assist her to cater for her family needs such as food, medicine and school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine hence more income to enable her pay for family's expenses, e.g., food, medical, and school fees.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia Ines  pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria”, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cereales.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the "Señor de Huanca de Patria" communal bank. As well as carrying out daily chores, Ines has a business selling cereals. She has had the business for some time now, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. This trade allows Ines to help her family to move forward in life.

Ines is applying for a loan in order to buy cereals.

Ines is grateful for and values this loans. She promises to be responsible and make her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Elizabeth. She is 23 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2014.

Elizabeth raises poultry as her main business. She is grateful to HiH EA for the enterprise training and inculcating a savings culture. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks and feed for her poultry. She hopes to satisfy market demand for eggs and white chicken meat and hence earn more income. She will thus pay for her college education fees and secure herself a brighter future.

Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed for her poultry, hoping to satisfy market demand for eggs and white chicken meat and hence earn more income.

loans.name: Wikwatyo Wa Atui S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Patrick, a member of Wikwatyo Wa Atui SHG. He is sixty-five years old, married, and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

He practices mixed farming as an economic activity. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chickens hence expand his poultry farming. This will enable him to meet his customers' demand for chicken and eggs hence more income for better medical care for the family. 

Patrick is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chickens hence meet his customers' demand and earn more income for better medical care for his family

loans.name: Jeska

texts.en:
Jeska is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Jeska has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which deals in spare parts items. 

To help expand her business, Jeska has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more motor spare parts, and will help Jeska to generate greater profits and increase sales. Jeska hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business. 

Jeska is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jeska who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more motor spare parts for sale in her store

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans,groundnuts. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans, groundnuts, and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Pauline hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pauline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans, groundnuts

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Лутфия 39 лет. Она мать одиночка. Лутфия развелась с мужем, и у нее один 6 летный сыночек. Без мужа вырасти детей нелегко, но Лутфия старается справляться с этими. Она заботливая и жизнелюбивая мать. Лутфия решила начать свой бизнес, и за счет дохода от бизнеса обеспечить семью. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить будку для ателье. Лутфия будет заниматься шитьем женской одежды на заказ. На оставшуюся часть денег она хочет приобрести швейную машинку для шитья, и планирует взять себе ученицы. Для завершения данной операции у нее нет денежных средств, и по этой причине она просит кредит. Она старается ради сына, и чтобы зарабатывать и жить дальше. Лутфия очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Lutfiya is 39 years old. She is a single mother. Lutfiya divorced from her husband, and she is alone with a six years old son. It is not easy to raise a child without a husband, and Lutfiya strives hard to manage this. She is a loving and active mother. 

Lutfiya decided to start her own business, and provide for her family based on the income from it. She applied for a loan in order to purchase a booth to have as a studio. Lutfiya will work with sewing women's clothing on order. For the remaining money she will purchase a sewing machine. She plans to take on an apprentice. She does not have enough money to complete this purchase, and therefore she requests a loan.

Lutfiya works hard to make her son happy and to earn money and live better. She is very much in need of your support.

loans.use: to purchase a booth (to serve as a studio) and start a new business

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en:
