Mustafa, who is in his early 40s, is a married with 4 children. He has been running a genge [a fruit and vegetable stand] and motor bike transportation business for five years now. He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Mustafa’s Seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and previous loans paid very well. He will use this loan to increase the stock of his genge. He dreams of owning a genge duka [a large store].

Mustafa  will share this loan with his loan group "Makoka," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his genge (fruits and vegetables) business

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Diana es una bella mujer de 32 años de edad, una persona responsable, trabajadora, emprendedora e innovadora que gracias a unas clases de estética y cuidado de cuerpo y a su mente ganadora monto un negocio donde oferta servicios de masajes corporales, algo nuevo en su zona y que ha sido de buena acogida por sus vecinos.

Ella es madre de dos niñas la mayor de 11 y la pequeña princesa de tan solo 1 año de edad, espera que crezcan sanas y tengan el apoyo siempre de sus padres que les darán la mejor calidad de vida que este a su alcance.

Diana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de uso diario para los masajes principalmente geles, también parte del préstamo lo destinara para la compra de jean un nuevo producto que venderá en su negocio.
texts.en:
This is Diana, a beautiful 32-year-old woman. She is responsible, hard-working, enterprising and innovating. Thanks to a number of classes in beauty treatments and looking after the mind and body, Diana started a business offering massage services, a new trade in her local area that has been well-accepted by the locals.

Diana is a mother to two daughters; the eldest is 11 years old while the youngest princess is just 1 year old. Diana hopes that they grow up healthy and with the constant support of her parents who will provide them with the highest possible quality of life.

Diana wants to apply for a loan in order to buy stock to use daily in her work providing massages, such as gels; she will also use part of the loan to buy jeans, a new product that she will start to sell at her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to use daily in her work providing massages, such as gels; she will also use part of the loan to buy jeans.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a 26-year-old single male living in Kasese, Uganda. Brian owns an agent of MTN and Airtel mobile money business which involves depositing and withdrawing money from mobile phones.  He also practices farming, growing crops like maize and bananas, which earns him side income. He is an honest person who started his business in 2012 working ten hours a day and six days a week. He is limited by capital which hinders his business growth.  He is requesting a loan to boost his mobile money business.

loans.use: to boost his mobile money business.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Shamshad is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 40000. 

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materiald, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Cynthia. She is 39 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She does maize, beans and potato farming as her main business. She has benefited a lot from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management; this has enabled her to do budgeting, planning and record keeping. 

Cynthia is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs, i.e., fertilizer and seeds. This will increase her yield hence more profit that will assist her to cater for the basic family needs and manage her business well.  

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will increase  yield hence more profit to help meet family basic needs.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо выражает свою благодарность  на Вашу поддержку. Она погасила предыдущий кредит. У Мехринисо прекрасная семья. Она мать двоих сыновей. Старший сын после окончания школы, решил заниматься земледелием вместе матерью. Младший сын учится в школе. Мехринисо честная и трудолюбивая женщина. После животноводческой деятельностью она решила начать еще один бизнес. Она сейчас занимается земледелием в родном районе. Работа на земле это очень большой труд. Мехринисо занята этой деятельностью  уже много лет.   Ей на работе помогает  старший сын. Она сейчас посадила шала,и хочет обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Мехринисо обратилась за кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для обработки урожай.
texts.en:
Mehriniso extends her gratitude for your help. She repaid the previous loan.

Mehriniso has a lovely family. She is the mother of two children. After finishing school, her eldest son decided to work with farming together with his mother. The youngest son goes to school. 

Mehriniso is an honest and hardworking woman. After the livestock breeding business she decided to start another business. Currently she works with field crop cultivation in her native region. Working with the land is hard. Mehriniso has been in this business for several years. Her eldest son helps her with the work. 

Currently Mehriniso has sown brown rise, and would like to process the land with mineral fertilizers. She applied for a loan in order to purchase fertilizers to treat the crops.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Fidele Group

texts.fr:
M. BOUKARE est responsable du groupe  FIDELE. Marié il est père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 18 ans et le moins âgé a 18 mois. 02 des enfants vont à l’école et Il a 08 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis 17 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il veut s’acheter 05 sacs d’engrais et un (01) bœuf.
Monsieur veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité et aussi s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne se payer une parcelle.
texts.en:
M. Boukare is the leader of the group called Fidele. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest 18 months old. Two of the children attend school and M.Boukare is responsible for supporting eight people. 

Monsieur Boukare has done farming and livestock raising for 17 years. He buys his supplies in the neighboring markets. With the money from the loan, he wants to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and one steer. 

He wants to use the profit from the loan to reinvest in his business and also to support his family. His ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and one steer

loans.name: Shapag

texts.en:
Shapag is a 48-year-old widowed woman who lives in Gardabani district with her pensioner mother. The family has no source of income except the pension, which is really hardly enough even for food.

Shapag wants to do her bit for the family's welfare and start an activity. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a clothing trading business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Shapag’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo – the Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

She will purchase stock of various kinds of clothing and will start selling among neighbors and in her community through the district. She will also work on private orders and get her own customers.

Shapag and her mother will be very thankful for the financial support, as their living condition will significantly increase with regards to Kiva lenders, and they will tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to start her own business and trade in clothing.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 44 years old, married woman and she has 2 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Mumtaz expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past 14 years, Safina has been working hard to manage her produce business selling beans, rice, maize, and cassava. 

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce and will help Safina to generate greater profits and increase sales. Safina hopes that in the future she will be able to have more stores in the area. 

Safina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Safina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with neither of them currently in school. For the past six years, Rachael has been working hard to manage her catering business, which offers catering services. 

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more warmers, saucepans, and plates, and will help Rachael to generate greater profits and increase sales. Rachael hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits. 

Rachael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Racheal who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more  warmers, saucepans, and plates

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa started selling fuel along the road in 2014 with her own capital of $600. Her plan is increase her business by buying more fuel for her loved clients. 

Very often, she runs out of fuel because she doesn't have enough money to buy a lot of fuel for her business. that is the reason she is taking a loan of $1,000.00  from Tuba Rai Metin.  She hopes after getting this loan, she won't run out of fuel anymore.

loans.use: To buy fuel and resell it to motor bike owners

loans.name: Elis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Elis, one of Ruma’s agents. Elis lives in Tasikmalaya, a city in southeastern West Java, Indonesia, located between Bandung and Purwokerto on the southerly of the two major road routes across Java. She is happily married. Together with her husband, they have three children. She owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community.

As the business grows, Elis is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Elis improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. Elis is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta lives in Liquica. She lives in a house partially made of wood. She doesn't have enough money to finish her house. She heard about Tuba Rai Metin and she is now applying for a loan of $1,500 to buy bricks, cement, sand and other items to be able to complete her building.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand,  bricks and other items.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells sodas, beer, water, and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy crates of sodas and beer and will help Rosemary to generate greater profits and Improve her well-being. Rosemary hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosemary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy crates of sodas and beer

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Patience has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells sugar, sodas, cooking oil, soap, beans, and blue bands. To help expand her business, Patience has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items to sell and will help Patience to generate increased sales and greater profits. Patience hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up another business. Patience is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patience who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for traditional microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, sodas, cooking oil, soap, beans, and blue bands to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, sugar and coconut to use in making rice cakes to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita has perfected her snack recipes for snack vending business. She is 62 years old and has big dreams for her children. She works hard to support for their education and has doubled her efforts for her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to buy raw ingredients for snack vending business. Tita hopes to see her business do well and would love to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snack vending business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Agnes has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fish vending.

Editha dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Adoko Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Jeanne vit à Tokoin pour entreprendre son activité. Jeanne vend des œufs dans son quartier afin de gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Jeanne s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Jeanne réalise une bonne rentabilité et demande ce nouveau crédit pour acheter des plateaux d’œufs. Jeanne souhaite réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 48 year old woman. She is married with four children. She lives in Tokoin where she runs her business. Jeanne sells eggs in her district to earn a living and help her family. She buys her stock twice a month at the market. Jeanne's business is profitable and she requests this new loan to buy trays of eggs. Jeanne hopes to make a profit to help her husband with the family expenses and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy 45 egg trays.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of the Dufatanye group. She is 33 years old and married with three children, between the ages of 6 and 15 years. Dufatanye means “come together” in English. Group members sell different products and they all wish to expand their businesses to make a better future for themselves. 

Marie owns a shop and has been running the business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits, and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits, and juice to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Anotieta started her business kiosk in 2013 with her own captital of $400. She wants to expand her business by buying more items such as cooking oil, sugar, mineral water, and other items. She is very proud of her business because many people come to her kiosk to buy their needs.

loans.use: to buy items such as mineral water, cooking oil, concentrated milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 59 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rita has been in this business for fifteen years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jyambere Group

texts.en: Jyambere is a group led by Ancille, who is 47 years old. The group name means “Go Ahead.” The group leader is married and has five children between 2 and 14 years of age. She has a shop and has been in business for the past six years. The group members sell a variety of items, and they have the same ideas for changing their lives. With the loan, Ancille would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny is 43 years old and married with five children, all five children are currently in school. Sonny works very hard to provide for them.

Sonny runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and bread.

Sonny has been in this business for ten years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Suprena

texts.en:
Suprena is 50 years old and has eight children. She is married and has four children, who are currently in school.

Suprena is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Suprena has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Agahozo Cb Group

texts.en: Agahozo is a group led by Elina, who is 40 years old. The name means “Amazing Group.” Elina has been a group leader for four years. She sells clothes and has been in business for 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses for sale. Part of the profits from the business will be reinvested and part will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Maximilien Houemang

texts.fr:
M. MAXIMILIEN est marié et est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 11 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il à 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’élevage de porcs depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il veut s’acheter 05 porcs, 02 sacs de résidus de maïs et 500 kg de résidus de boisson.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Il compte s’occuper de l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Maximilien is married with two children. The older child is 11 and the younger one is nine. The two children go to school and he is responsible for four individuals. Mr. Maximilien has been rearing pigs for five years. He buys his animals in neighbouring villages.
With the loan he requests, he would like to buy five pigs, two sacks of corn residue, and 500 kg of  beverage residue.
He would like to use the profits made from his loan to expand his business. He plans to take care of his children's future.

loans.use: to buy five pigs, two sacks of corn residue, and 500 kg of  beverage residue.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas has a kiosk in Liquica, where she lives. She sells canned sardines, cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks and other items. She want to increase her capital, which was only $1,000 when she started in 2010. She approached Tuba Rai Metin for a loan of $1,000 to help her buy more items to sell, including sugar, toothpaste and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks, toothpaste and other items for resale.

loans.name: Ruth Saraí

texts.es:
Ruth, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, por problemas económicos no siguió sus estudios, está acompañada desde hace 8 años, su pareja es policía, tiene dos hijos los cuales uno de ellos está estudiando y el otro esta pequeño.

Ruth, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que salió de estudiar, ella era quien le ayuda a su mamá en la agricultura, luego su mamá viajo a Estados Unidos y por problemas de salud tuvo que regresar al país, el terreno donde van a cultivar está a una distancia de 15 minutos y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m. 

Ruth, necesita el crédito para comprar 4 sacos de abono y fertilizante para la milpa, porque tiene plaga y si no la quita perderá la milpa. 

Ella sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean un orgullo para la familia.
texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years of age and studied to the ninth grade. Due to economic problems, she could not continue her studies. Ruth has been married for eight years. Her husband is a policeman. They have two children, one of whom is studying and the other is still small.

Ruth has been dedicated to agriculture since she left school. She used to help her mother farm. Later, her mother traveled to the United States but due to health problems, had to return to El Salvador. The land Ruth cultivates is some 15 minutes distance from their home. She works at the farm from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm. 

Ruth needs the loan to purchase four sacks of manure and fertilizer for her plot because it has a plague  and if she doesn't eliminate it, she will lose the land.

She dreams of seeing her children finishing their studies and becoming the pride of the family.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure and fertilizer for her agricultural field.

loans.name: Toulassida Group

texts.fr:
M. PAUL est responsable du groupe  TOULASSIDA. Marié il père de 16 enfants. Le plus âgé a 37 ans et le moins âgé a 20 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait le jardinage depuis 11 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 04 sacs d’engrais et 02 poules. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il compte aussi prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Paul is the leader of the Toulassida group. He is married with 16 children. The oldest is 37 and the youngest is 20. One of his children goes to school and he has seven dependent individuals.
Mr. Paul has been  a gardener for 11 years. He buys his supplies in local villages.
With the loan he requests, he plans to buy four bags of fertiliser and two hens.
Mr. Paul would like to use his profits to expand his business. He also plans to take care of his children.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertiliser and two hens.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Pequeños pero seguros pasos son los que está dando la señora Martha, una vendedora de alimentos (comidas Rápidas).

Martha es una mujer de 37 años de edad, la necesidad y la falta de oportunidades de empleo la llevaron a iniciar con su negocio y hoy agradece mucho que esta oportunidad que le envió el destino se le presentara ya que sus ingresos han mejorado considerablemente y puede pagar la educación de su hija de 20 años de edad cómodamente.

Con el ánimo de progresar, de ir adquiriendo activos fijos que potencien su actividad Martha quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un congelador e insumos, teniendo la oportunidad de almacenar un mayor numero de productos y tener existencias siempre disponibles.
texts.en: Martha, a fast food vendor, is taking small but steady steps. She is 37 years old, and necessity and a lack of employment opportunities led her to start her business. Today, she is very thankful that this opportunity presented itself to her, as her income has improved considerably and now she can comfortably pay for the education of her 20 year old daughter. With intent to progress and continue acquiring fixed assets that improve her work, Martha wants to request a loan to purchase a freezer and consumables, as this would allow her to store a greater number of products and to always have supplies available.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and consumable goods

loans.name: Speciose's Group

texts.en: Consolee is the group leader who is 49 years old. She is married with six children between 16 and 28 years old. The group is called ABARWANASHYAKA, which means “hardworking people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to change their future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes and cassava to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a hardworking woman from Liloy. She runs a business raising pigs at her own backyard. She availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her business by adding more heads of pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en: Domingga learned about PMPC and the benefits it gives to their members. She decided to join and start up her gardening on her own backyard. She asked for an amount of 7,000.00 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes that through partnership with Paglaum, she can supply vegetables to her neighboring communities.

loans.use: to purchase gardening materials such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Candida

texts.en: Candida lives in Liquica. She runs her business of selling coconut oil. Coconut oil is well appreciated in Liquica for its multiple uses. Candida hasn't enough money to open a kiosk where she can have a lot bottles of coconut oil. She requesting from Tuba Rai Metin a loan of $1,500 to help her open a small kiosk and stock it with a lot of coconut oil.

loans.use: to buy more coconut oil to resell.

loans.name: La Lune Group

texts.fr:
M. PAUL est responsable du groupe  LA LUNE. Marié il père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 06 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait le jardinage depuis 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 04 sacs d’engrais et 05 kg d’insecticides. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne encourager ses enfants à aller loin dans les études.
texts.en:
Mr. Paul is the leader of the La Lune group. He is married with five children. The oldest is 22 and the youngest is seven. Four of his children go to school and he has six dependent individuals.
Mr. Paul has been  a gardener for 20 years. He buys his supplies in local villages.
With the loan he requests, he plans to buy four sacks of fertiliser and five kg of insecticide.
Mr. Paul would like to use his profits to expand his business. He also plans to encourage his children to study for as long as possible.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertiliser and five kg of insecticide.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, a 63-year-old married mother of nine, has been farming rice in the Philippines for four years now. Having borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, she is now requesting a new loan for PHP 20000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 36 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 15 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which operates in  shoes and bags. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and complete the house. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to open another branch. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more shoes for sale in her store

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 40 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Asiya has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Asiya has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Asiya to generate greater profits and expand business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase more stock. 

Asiya is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asiya who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie runs a store in Liloy. She is fortunate to operate her store in a populous place and she would want to take advantage on the good sales she gets these days. 

She recently availed a loan to restock store with items like biscuits, sugar, canned goods and milk. Elsie hopes to sustain her business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like biscuits, sugar, canned goods and milk

loans.name: Moises Ivanov

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés es una persona luchadora que siempre quiere salir adelante no importa los problemas que se le presenten, él  tuvo un lamentable  accidente en el cual atropello con un automóvil a una persona que se encontraba en estado de ebriedad, él se hizo cargo durante varios años del accidentado que estaba en terapia intensiva, el Sr. Moisés tuvo que pagar todas su cirugías y todo su tratamiento para su recuperación, y los ingresos que tiene no le alcanzan por ello entro a capacitarse en un centro sobre metal mecánica, dadas la limitaciones económicas que tenía no pudo equiparse bien es por eso que solicita un crédito para la compra de equipos y herramientas para su actividad, de esta forma incrementará sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: Moisés is a determined person who always wants to get ahead no matter the problems he faces. He had a terrible accident in which he hit a person who was drunk with his car. For several years he was responsible for the accident victim, who was in intensive therapy. Moisés had to pay for all of the surgeries and treatments for the victim’s recovery, and he did not have enough income to cover the costs, so he started training in a center for metalworking. Because of his economic limitations, he has not been able to buy equipment; therefore he is requesting a loan to buy equipment and tools for his trade, so that he can increase his income for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools for his trade, so that he can increase his income for the benefit of his family.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stocks of Irish potatoes and will help Rose to generate greater profits and increase family income. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more snacks of Irish potatoes for sale at her stall

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with non of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Farida has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells, bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

To help expand her business, Farida has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans,blue band, and will help Farida to generate greater profits and increase financial stability. Farida hopes that in the future she will be able to increase to a super market. 

Farida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bread, eggs, sugar,sodas,cooking oil,soap, beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more “nira” or “sap” as the raw material to make palm sugar, more firewood, and books for her children's school needs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, a 27-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school, works very hard to provide for her family. For the past year she has run a general store in the Philippines and is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Jemali

texts.en:
Jemali, 48 years old, is a married man from Baghdati district. Jemali's wife lives abroad and his daughters live with their father.

Jemali is busy with a small-scale agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is a monthly income from their agricultural business. They have a vineyard and grow grapes, which are sold at the local open market. It is hardly enough for food for the family.

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Jemali requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, he plans to buy a cow and start dairy farming. The family will start selling milk products among the local people.

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Jemali is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children have a good living condition. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and sell milk products.

loans.name: Asmati

texts.en: Asmati is 33 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 12-year-old son. She works as a cleaner and gets a small monthly income. Asmati's husband works as a singer at a local restaurant. Asmati wants to purchase musical apparatus for her husband. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for purchasing a good quality microphone and dynamics and other needed instruments for musicians. Asmati's husband will have his own equipment and will not have to pay rent for it. This will increase his income and with increased the income, the family will be able to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to purchase musical equipment for her husband who works as a singer at local restaurant

loans.name: Samuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Samuel un hombre de 39 años de edad es el orgullo propietario de un restaurante de la vereda la chía, un negocio en donde cuenta con 5 empleados y espera seguir proyectándose y ampliando conforme vea la necesidad de hacerlo.

Empezó el negocio en el año 2011 por gusto al trabajo independiente y dese ese año ha notado un crecimiento exponencial el cual espera no acabe.

Samuel es padre de un hijo de tan solo 8 años de edad, vela por el cuidado de este y su meta es pagarle un excelente estudio, pero no solo tiene que cuidar a su pequeño, sus empleados se han convertido en su familia y esta motivándolos para que estudien o monten su negocio.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra masiva de insumos y su producto estrella la carne ya que la carne asada es el alimento estrella de su negocio.
texts.en:
Samuel is a 39 year old man, and the proud owner of a sidewalk café.  He has five employees and hopes to continue to plan and grow his business as he needs to.  

He began the business in 2011 because he likes to work for himself.  Since the beginning he has had exponential growth which he hopes never stops.  

Samuel is father to an 8 year old son.  He takes care of him and his goal is to provide excellent schooling.  However he not only has to take care of his son, as his employees have become family and he motivates them to study or begin their own businesses.  

He is asking for the loan for bulk purchases of goods for the restaurant, including meat for his best seller, carne asada.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in bulk as well as meat, as grilled meat/carne asada is the stand out item of his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products and diversify her grocery shop.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: El grupo “YAHVE YIRE” se encuentra conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista y prestar servicios. Liliana tiene 44 años de edad es soltera ella implemento un pequeño negocio en su vivienda en el cual ofrece menú dulces bazar jugos con la ayuda de sus padres que ya son personas de la tercera edad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de dulces gaseosas y más productos para su bazar. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Liliana es la que viste polera negra con rosones de colores amarillo celeste y fucsia.
texts.en:
The group “YAHVE YIRE” is made up of members who work in retail and service. 

Liliana is 44 years old and single. She set up a small business in her home in which she offers candy, juice, and knickknacks with the help of her elderly parents. She will invest the loan in the purchase of candy, soft drinks, and more products for her corner shop. 

The group thanks the KIVA lenders for the loan. Liliana is the one wearing a black shirt with yellow, blue, and fuchsia colored bows.

loans.use: to buy more candy, soft drinks, and products for her corner store.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 39 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her pharmacy. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and increase income. Doreen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the drug shop. 

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Doreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her restaurant & Bar, which sells beers, sodas and food. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks and food items, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drinks and food items for her restaurant

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 49 years old, married and the mother of three children, has been engaged in an Internet cafe business for three years. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years, maintaining her good standing by paying her loans with no records of defaults. 

Delia has requested a loan of 20,000.00 PHP to purchase new computer key boards, a mouse, head set and speakers for her cafe. She hopes that she can expand her business and add new computer units with future assistance from PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase new computer key boards, a mouse, head set and speakers

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida thought she was in the right place when she joined the Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. Florida has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Florida wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is from Larena, Siquijor. He is 51 years of age. This year, 2015, he joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of this co-op. From his desire to help the family, he is engaged in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Larena, Siquijor. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income has existed for eight years now. In need of additional working capital, he requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in an amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase and/or have more income so he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family and also he is happy he can support the education of his children, which is the main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 30-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. For 10  years she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns income by raising pigs.

Jocelyn, who has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, has requested a PHP 30000 loan to buy more stocks of household goods to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Obrah Group

texts.en:
This is the third loan time with ID-Ghana, and the group is requesting a loan to allow its members to grow their respective activities (liquid soap, cabbage, plantains, yams, and credit cards).

Faustina is the group representative. She has been selling liquid soap for two years. Faustina is 41 years old and married, and she has three children. She owns a liquid soap business through hawking, which allows her to stay active all day long. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase liquid soap.

Faustina wants to further improve her business and make her business better known.

loans.use: to purchase liquid soap to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en:
Bichiko, 51 years old, is from the village of Geguti. He lives with his unemployed wife, son and daughter.

Bichiko requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his trading business startup but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan.

The only source of income for the family is a small-scale family agricultural business. They have two greenhouses, one milk cow and a plot of agricultural land. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Bichiko requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, he will start trading in seasonal fruits and vegetables. The couple will start cultivating fruits and vegetables and sell them in nearby towns with a price markup. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income.

Bichiko will be very thankful for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: to start a trading business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 41 años de edad, una persona sencilla, estética, trabajadora, que se dedica a la reparación y tapizado de muebles.

Vive con su pareja e hijo de 20 años de edad, trabaja con este y su deseo es que a futuro pueda heredar el negocio que con tanto esfuerzo y perseverancia monto.

Una de las principales herramientas de German es el compresor ya que con este pinta cada acabado, y mueble que pasa por su negocio, en el momento el que tenia se le averió y necesita con urgencia comprar otro, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar el comprensor.
texts.en:
German is a 41 year old man, simple, stylish and hardworking who works in the repair and upholstery of furniture.  

He lives with his wife and 20 year old son.  He works in this industry and his dream is that in the future he can pass the business on which he grew with such effort and perseverance.  

One of the main tools that German uses is the compressor, as he uses it to paint each finished item that passes through his business.  His compressor no longer functions and he urgently need to purchase another.  This is the reason that he is asking for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Chaka est la personne tenant dans sa main la corde attaché au bœuf. 
Chaka N’Golo est un malien âgée de 44 ans, marié père de 06 enfants tous âgées de 11 à 01 an et 08 mois dont 03 sont scolarisés sa femme fait le ménage à la maison Chaka est alphabétisé. Il rêve d’être un grand éleveur dans l’avenir en voulant réaliser ce rêve, il a eu des problèmes de fonds pour qu’il puisse avoir en possession beaucoup de moyens adéquates , donc il a fait appel aux services financiers du RMCR pour acquérir plus de fonds pour pouvoir acheter plus de bœufs et d’aliments bétail, il fait ses approvisionnements dans les marchés locales et après avoir finis de les élevés il les vents sur le marché à des prix élevés  qui lui permet d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. Il peut réaliser un bénéfice de 50000f par cycle, il est souvent confronté à des obstacles qui est la chute des prix sur le marché, il fait cette activité depuis 04 ans.
texts.en:
Chaka is the person holding in his hand a rope that is attached to the bullock.
Chaka N'Golo is a 44 year old Malian man who is married with six children aged between 11 and one year and eight months, three of whom attend school. His wife is a housewife. Chaka  can read and write. He dreams of being an important livestock farmer in the future. While trying to realise his dream, he had some problems  trying to obtain sufficient funds, so he turned to the financial services of RMCR to acquire more funds to enable him to buy more livestock and cattle feed. He buys his stock at the local markets, and when he has finished fattening  them, he sells them at the market at a high price which enables him to provide for his family. He can make up to 50,000f each season, but he is often confronted with difficulties such as a drop in market prices. He has been in this business for four years.

loans.use: to buy bullocks and cattle feed.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 28 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her timber business, which sells wood, timber. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wood for sale and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and expand business. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to increase stock. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, crianza de ganado repasto y transporte de personas en una moto taxi, tiene de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola desde hace 8 años e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos y poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children. He grows corn, raises grazing cattle, and transports people in a motorbike taxi. He started farming 8 years ago and began with his own capital. He markets his products in and around the area where he resides. 

José is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides etc. and improve the land shown in the photo, in order to be able to continue with his crops and be able to obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn is a 58-year-old married weaver with an only child, who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has woven Cambodian traditional clothes since 1980. Her husband is a 57-year-old rice farmer and her only child works in a bank. Together, the family can make approximately USD 23.33 a day. Lorn is now requesting a loan for her husband to buy fertilizer for rice farming. This loan will help her husband gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. Lorn’s plans are to buy more farmland for her husband to cultivate rice and to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Marven

texts.en: Marven has been in the Internet Cafe business for three years. He is 30 years old, married and from Larena, Siquijor. He learned about Paglaum MPC and the services offered to its members. He decided to join and ask for an amount of 50,000 PHP as additional capital to purchase new keyboards, mice, headsets and speakers. He hopes for success through PMPCs financial assistance and to expand his business for the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase new keyboards, mice, headsets and speakers.

loans.name: Cyclin

texts.en: Cyclin has mastered her hog raising business in Larena, Siquijor. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just like she takes care of her hog raising business, so it is with her membership in PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run there for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 50,000 will help her purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah thanks Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her buy poultry feeds. This increased eggs production and she was able to earn more income that she used part of it to pay for her children's education.

She is borrowing a second Kiva loan to buy more poultry feeds to continue increasing eggs production.  This she hopes will increase her income levels to continue paying school fees for her children.

She is thankful to Kiva and her lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed that will help improve her productivity hence pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 42 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, chips, etc.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her door to door sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Ma. Lucy

texts.en:
Ma. Lucy is 40 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Ma. Lucy has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ma. Lucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Marilyn has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Melalyn

texts.en:
Melalyn is 34 years old and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Melalyn has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Melalyn would like to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: 54 летняя замечательная женщина Чумагул. Она из городка Куляб. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Муж занимается перевозом товаров. У него есть грузовик марки «КАМАЗ». Сын  уже год занят торговлей деятельности на рынке. Он продают фрукты. Дочка швея. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды более 6 лет. В семье все трудится и у всех есть свой бизнес. Чумагул опытная рукодельница. Она более 10 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. В швейном деле Чумагулу больше нравится шить национальную женскую одежду. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы расширить свой бизнес. За счет кредита Чумагул купить швейные принадлежности. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
The wonderful 54-year-old woman Jumagul is from Kulob. She has one son and one daughter. Her husband works transporting goods. He has a KAMAZ brand truck. Jumagul's son has been working at the market for a year. He sells fruit. Jumagul's daughter is a seamstress, and she has been sewing women's clothing for more than 6 years. In this family, everyone works, and everyone has their own business. 

Jumagul is an experienced seamstress. For more than 10 year, she has sewn women's clothing. Jumagul likes sewing traditional women's clothing the most. She has applied for a loan to expand her business. With the loan, Jumagul will buy sewing supplies. The loan she is requesting will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alicia is 45 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Alicia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Alicia has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 52 years old and has five children. Amelita is married and has one child still in school.

Amelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Amelita has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 38 years old and has two children. Angelita is married and has two children are presently in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelita has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other rice farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Luz Milena

texts.es:
Luz Milena es una mujer práctica, no cuenta con estudios superiores ni experiencia laboral, solo su ingenio y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene un negocio de alimentos donde su producto principal son las empanadas, un delicioso frito de mucho consumo en Colombia.

Paralelo a este negocio tiene una cría de cerdos y vende mercancía, ya que es la fuente principal de ingresos y tiene 3 hijos es una responsabilidad que ha sabido llevar.

Luz Milena para proyectar y mejorar su producción ha encontrado ciertos problemas como lo son el poco apoyo en financiamientos, la falta de capital no le permite crecer más pero gracias a que en interactuar encontró un si te ayudamos como respuestas, hoy vino a contar su historia y pedirles ayuda para comprar cerdos de cría, insumos para los alimentos y vitrina para exhibir su ropa, accesorios y cosméticos en venta.
texts.en:
Luz Milena is a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed.

She has a food business where her main product is empanadas, deliciously fried and eaten a lot in Colombia.

At the same time she also has a business breeding pigs and selling goods and it is the main source of income. She has a responsibility to her three children she has managed to bring up.

In pursuance of protecting and improving her production Luz Milena has encountered some problems such as lack of financial support. The lack of capital does not permit her to expand but thanks to Interactuar she found we will help you with answers. Today she came to tell her story and to ask for help in order to buy breeding pigs, feed supplies, and a showcase to display her clothing, accessories, and cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs, feed supplies, and a showcase to exhibit her clothing, accessories, and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase of sacks of feed for her pigs.

Myrna has been pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамиле 35 лет. Она из района Джиликула. Джамила замужем и мать одного ребенка. Все жители района Джиликула знают её как одну из самых лучших учительниц района. Однако её зарплаты было не достаточно, для того чтобы прокормить свою семью. Поэтому Джамила дополнительно занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Её клиентки очень довольны, потому что она шьет очень аккуратно. Для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес, Джамиле нужно купить еще одну швейную машинку и материалы. Её основная проблема в том, что у неё нет достаточно средств. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом и обещает, что во время будет погашать свой займ.
texts.en:
Jamila is 35 years old. She is from the Jilikul region. Jamila is married and has one child. Everyone in Jilikul knows her as one of the best teachers in the region. However, her salary was not enough to feed her family. Therefore, Jamila also works by sewing traditional dresses. Her clients are very satisfied because she sews very neatly. 

In order to expand her business, Jamila needs to buy another sewing machine and material. Her main problem is that she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for a loan, and promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and material.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients for her food vending business.

Nida has been in this business for 18 years. She also earns more income from fishing. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Paulina works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Paulina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Oscar Dario

texts.es:
Por motivos que no quiere nombrar para no despertar lastima este hombre llamado Oscar de 33 años de edad dejo su negocio de producción de leche, pero una vez superado sus inconvenientes quiere acudir a Interactuar quien con un si te apoyo está dispuesto junto con su amigo Kiva a ayudarlo a reiniciar su actividad con la que genera el sustento para su pareja e hija de 4 años de edad.

La importancia de este préstamo radica en que le darías la oportunidad a un hombre trabajador de luchar por un mejor futuro para su familia y aunque el monto es elevado lo invertirá sabiamente en dos vacas lecheras en periodo de gestación.
texts.en:
For reasons he doesn’t want to name in order not to arouse pity, this man named Oscar, 33 years old, left his dairy business, but now that he has overcome his problems he wants to apply to Interactuar which, with a positive response is willing together with its friend Kiva to help him restart his business, with which he generates a living for his partner and 4 year-old daughter.

The importance of this loan is that it would give a hard-working man the opportunity to fight for a better future for his family, and although the amount is high he will invest it wisely in two gestating dairy cows.

loans.use: restart his dairy business.

loans.name: Wanah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Wanah. Wanah is 50 years old and a widow. She lives with her children. 

Wanah is a food merchant.  She has sold snacks, cooked side dishes, etc. for 15 years.  She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,200,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy materials and to build a bathroom, septic tank and a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for the family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for the family, but the family income is still not enough to build a toilet and water resources for cash.  However, they are able to repay the loan.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity, and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials and build a bathroom, septic tank and toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for the family.

loans.name: Nongtaaba Sect 01 Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZALISSA est responsable du groupe   NONGTAABA SECT 01. Mariée elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 17 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. 03 des enfants vont à l’école et elle à 09 personnes en charge.
Madame fait le commerce de savons, et de maïs frais depuis plus de 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 03 cartons de savons, 02 cartons de détachant en poudre et 01 sac de maïs frais.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne encourager ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Madame Zalissa is the head of the Nongtaaba Sect 01 group. She is married and the mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 17. Three of her children go to school and she has nine dependents in total.

For more than two years, she has been selling soap and corn. She buys her supplies in the neighboring villages. With the money she earns, she would like to buy three boxes of soap, two boxes of stain-removing powder, and one bag of fresh corn. 

She wants to use her earnings to strengthen her business. She would like to encourage her children in their studies.

loans.use: buy three boxes of soap, two boxes of powder stain remover, and one bag of fresh corn.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 48 years old and is married to a tricycle driver. She is storeowner and she has been running this business for one year. The couple is blessed with six children. Out of her six children, only her youngest child attends to school. 

Marissa would like to borrow financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000. She will be using this amount to buy grocery items and ingredients for her homemade longganisa. Marissa is looking forward for approval of the requested loan amount to keep her business progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and ingredients for homemade longganisa to sell.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a hollow block making business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cement and sand for making hollow blocks. Remia has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cement and sand for making hollow blocks.

loans.name: Aylin

texts.en:
Aylin is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aylin is 37 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Aylin has a fishing business in the Philippines. Aylin requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials needed for her business.

Aylin has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old with two children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Rowena has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
M. MAXIMILIEN est marié et est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 20 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il à 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture depuis 09 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il veut s’acheter 20 sacs d’engrais, 01 motopompe et 01 voyage de camion de fiente de poules.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et survenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il ambitionne mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Monsieur Maximilien is married and the father of six children between the ages of three and 20. Four of his children go to school and he has nine dependents total. 

He has been in farming for nine years. He buys his supplies in the neighboring villages. With the money he earns, he wants to buy 20 bags of fertilizer, one motor pump, and one truckload of bird droppings. 

He would like to use his earnings to strengthen his buisness and meet the needs of his family. He wants to increase his revenue-generating activities.

loans.use: buy 20 bags of fertilizer, one motor pump, and one truckload of bird droppings.

loans.name: Chap's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chap, born in 1976, is an ethnic Thai  woman. She has been participating in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January, 2000. She currently lives with her husband’s parents, her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
	
Her family’s main occupation is cultivation, and the annual income from harvesting 1.4 hectares of coffee is about VND 80 to 85 million. However, the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. Her eldest son is studying at a university.  She wants a loan to pay for her son education’s fees and to invest more in his education, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow for this purpose.
	
She hopes that that the loan will help her son have better conditions for studying, and when he graduates from university, that he will have a stable, good job.

loans.use: to pay her son's education fees.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia live in Atsabe. She is married and has three children. She is a businesswoman and has a kiosk. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. Virginia started her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of USD 1,000. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as detergents, sugar, cooking oil, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, and other things to sell.  She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin so she can have more working capital to buy more goods. She hopes with this loan she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy detergents, sugar, cooking oil, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 42 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Rashida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. 

Rashida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: La señora Maruja tiene 30 años de edad,  tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario, los escasos  recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a seguir estudiando, es madre soltera  tiene 1 hija (dependiente) a la que apoya en su educación y alimentación, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven actualmente tiene su propia vivienda que se compró con su esfuerzo ahí vive con su hija, también tiene su lote agrícola de 6.2502 has. Hace  5 años, empezó a trabajar independientemente desde que el papa de su hija le abandono, empezó a cultivar piña y yuca con la ayuda de sus padres, actualmente quiere mejorar sus cultivos, por eso solicita un crédito para ampliar su plantación de piña y a si mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Maruja is 30 and has a primary school education. Because of a lack of funds her parents were not able to help her continue her studies. She is a single mother with 1 daughter (dependent) whom she supports by paying for her education and nutrition. She began working at a very young age and now owns her own home that she bought through her hard work which she shares with her daughter. She also has her farm plot of 6.2502 hectares. Five years ago she began working on her own after being abandoned by her daughter's father. She began growing pineapple and yucca with her parents' help. Now she wants to improve her crops and that is why she is requesting a loan to increase her pineapple crop and improve her standard of living.
