loans.use: to expand her pineapple farm and, in turn, improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина жительница замечательного района Джиликул. Ей 28 лет и она не замужем. Она живет со своими родителями и братом. Мадина очень талантливая и сильная девушка. Она всегда помогает родителям. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Мадина имеет 10 летний опыт в этой сфере. Так как её швейная  машинка очень старая, а на покупку новой у нее нет денег, Мадина решилась взять кредит для покупки новой машинки, а также приобрести дополнительную машинку для подшивания краёв платьев (оверлок). Она верит в Вашу доброту и надеется на положительный ответ.
texts.en:
Madina is a resident of the wonderful region of Jimikul. She is 28 years old and not married. She lives with her parents and brother. Madina is a very talented and strong woman. She is always helping her parents. Madina sews women's clothing, and she has 10 years of experience in this area. 

Because Madina's sewing machine is already very old, and she does not have the money to buy a new one, Madina has decided to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine, and additionally, to buy another sewing machine to sew the edges of dresses (a serger or overlock sewing machine). She has faith in your kindness and hopes for a positive response.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, and also to buy a serger sewing machine.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolores is 49 years old and has one child still in school.

Dolores has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials needed.

Dolores has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials needed

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 62 years old, married and has four children.

Elena is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elena has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other rice farm supplies

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 44 years old and married with three children, one child still in school, Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc.

Elsie has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has been involved in retail activities since 2011. She started her business with her own working capital of USD 200. Anita is married, and her husband works in security. Anita has a shop as her business. She is requesting a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies that people like, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, wheat, and other things to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, wheat, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Raquela

texts.en:
Raquela is a businesswomen and she has a small kiosk. She is requesting a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, soft drinks and other things to sell. 

Raquela opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of USD 100. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers’ salaries for rice farm preparation.

She supplements this income with earnings from raising livestock. Rosalie dreams that one day she will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for rice farm preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 48-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. 

Her husband has been running a general store for the past eight years.  Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shahida's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g. rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for resale. 

Therefore, Shahida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities, and will help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband grow his general store business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to afford the maintenance cost of his taxi. Therefore, Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Asma's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide  better transport services to earn a profitable income. Asma also plans to save some of the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood has successfully built her business of hand embroidery. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads and frames to fill orders for her customers on time and to earn stromg profits. 

This monetary help can take Maqsood  closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and frames to fill orders for her customers on time and to earn strong profits.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Bernadette business involvement.She has been raiseing hogs for more than seven years. Currently, she’s raising seven pigs. Bernadette is 30 years old, married to a farmer and had two children who are still attending school. She also engaged herself in a variety store and farming business. 

Bernadette wants to buy seven sacks of hog feeds and vitamins to improve the growth of her pigs.To achieve her goal,she is requesting for a loan of PHP20,000.She hopes and pray that through her loan, she could be able to generate better income and maintain her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of hog feeds and vitamins for her livestock business

loans.name: Sokhour

texts.en: Sokhour, 27 years old, is a married rice farmer with a small child who lives in the province of Takeo, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2000. Her husband is 31 years old and works as a car mechanic. Both Sokhour and her husband can earn around $20 each day. She has a cow and now she needs to buy one more ox for plowing. Therefore she has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help her have enough funds to buy one more ox and reduce plowing expenses. In the future, she wants her husband to run his own car repair shop and to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy one more ox for plowing

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is a 20-year-old, married mother with a dependent child. She resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than three years. Her husband is 23 years old and earns some income from selling ice cream in a village. Neang and her husband can make a daily income of $ 20. 

She wants to buy piglets to fatten and sell, but she does not have enough money, so she is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. With the loan, she will have enough finances to buy piglets to fatten and earn additional income to improve her living standards. In the future, she is going to save money, run a small grocery store, build a new proper house and send her only child to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Edgar De Jesus

texts.es:
Trabajador, amante del campo y de los animales este es Edgar un ganadero de 45 años de edad que con esfuerzo, trabajo ha constituido un negocio de  ganado lechero que le ha servido para mantener a su familia conformada por su pareja y sus dos hijos.

El trabajo de Edgar atraviesa por un buen momento, tiene vacas que dan buena cantidad de leche, algo que le sirve para afrontar la crisis por la que estos ganaderos pasan y es debido al bajo costo de venta de leche y eso sumado con las enfermedades, fuertes lluvias y la competencia hace que el negocio se complique, pero Edgar sigue con una actitud inquebrantable y ya que su meta, es pagar la educación de sus hijos seguiría diariamente trabajando y pro superarse.

Edgar solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas en periodo de gestación lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche.
texts.en:
Worker, lover of the field and animals, this is Edgar.  He is a 45 year old farmer who, through his own efforts and work, has established a dairy business which has served to support his family that includes his partner and their two children.

Edgar's work is going through a good phase.  He owns cows that produce good quantities of milk, which helps to deal with the crisis that these farmers are going through which is the low cost of selling milk.  This issues, coupled with diseases, heavy rains and competition makes the business complicated.  

Nonetheless, Edgar continues with unwavering attitude and since his goal is to pay for the education of his children he will continue with his daily work in order to succeed.  

Edgar is requesting a loan to purchase two cows in gestation period which will allow him to increase the milk supply.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and has five children. Evelyn is married and has three children are presently in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mafe

texts.en:
Mafe is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mafe is 30 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Mafe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mafe requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and sea foods to sell.

Mafe has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and sea foods to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old, married and has one child.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maricel has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other rice farm supplies

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Medilyn is 26 years old and has one child still in school.

Medilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Medilyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional material needed for her business.

Medilyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material needed for her fishing business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for nine years. Her husband is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to pay for maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to pay for maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Salma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Salma's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and  provide  better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Salma  also plans to save some of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Salma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repair of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 43-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. 

Her husband has been running a general store for the past 20 years.  Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shazia's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g. rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for resale. 

Therefore, Shazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his general store business.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina lives in Ermera. She has been involved in business activities since 2012 with her own working capital and she makes the best of it. She has very great interest in doing business. 

Natalina has a small store and she hopes to open a bigger store, but her capital is insufficient, so she is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  

She will use this loan to buy more items to keep in her store, including sugar, detergents, milk, salt, lighters, soap, cigarettes, cooking oil, soft drinks, and hard drinks.  She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, detergents, milk, salt, lighters, soap, cigarettes, cooking oil, soft drinks, and hard drinks.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is a 35-year-old woman and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, and sells apples, bananas, grapes, and other fruits. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shaista's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore, Shaista has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more fruits for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 63 years old. She is known in the Cangmalalag, Siquijor area for her tailoring business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record so that she can always turn to the cooperative in times of need.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita lives in Tigbawan, Lazi, Larena, Siquijor and supports her children in building their houses from the ground up. She applied for a loan, which she used to buy building materials, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paints and pay her workers.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hard-working widow with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more cows to fatten and sell.

She still fattens cattle as her main source of income.  She started her business with an aim of generating income and meeting personal demands. She also practices crop farming, growing coffee and bananas to earn extra income. 

Imelda intends to buy a vehicle to aid her in transporting her products to her customers, and to stop borrowing and be self reliant. She still faces a main challenge of competition and inadequate capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening at her farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening at her farm.

loans.name: Retno

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Retno, one of Ruma agents. Retno lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java, located about five hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Retno is a university student who has a strong desire to become an entreprenur. She sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. Retno joined Ruma in 2014. She found out about Ruma from a sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to try to become an entrepreneur in technology, as well as increase her savings and provide more service to her community. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Retno has seen an improvement in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Your loan will be very useful to help her to improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

Retno is seen in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for her village community.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ani, one of Ruma’s agents. Ani lives in Tasikmalaya, a city in southeastern West Java, Indonesia, located between Bandung and Purwokerto on the southerly of the two major road routes across Java. She is happily married. She owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her community. 

As the business grows, Ani is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ani improve her business, and accordingly, her community that needs access to such services. Ani is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Kamunyu-Ini Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Dorris, who is 45 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She conducts vegetable and maize farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy manure and pesticides to improve her farming and earn more income. This will enable her buy reading materials for her children as well as to pay school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides in order to improve her farming and increase her income to pay school fees and buy reading materials for her children.

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en:
Akhter, 55, is married and has seven children. She is shown with her son who for many years has run a chicken store where he is known in his community for the good-quality hens he sells.

For the improvement of her son’s business, Akhter has applied for a 30,000 PKR Murabaha loan (an acceptable form of credit under Sharia, or Islamic religious law) through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy more hens along with chicken feed for them. Her son expects a boost in his earnings through this loan and hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more hens to sell along with chicken feed for them.

loans.name: Faizaan

texts.en:
Faizaan is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. In order to bear her daily expenses, she is involved in the business of cropping with her husband. They have gradually built their business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now, Faizaan has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase various types of seeds, along with good-quality soil and mud. This would help her grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase various types of seeds, along with good-quality soil and mud.

loans.name: Munkhzaya

texts.en: Munkhzaya is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling shoes to local people since 2010. His wife helps his business. Their children go to elementary school. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass. That would enable his family to live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollution into the air. Munkhzayar is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia needed capital to pay for land and seedbed preparation when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. 

PMPC to Eulalia came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has availed another loan for the next cropping season. Eulalia perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is juggling a rice farm with supervising the renovation of her home. Anita hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 20,000. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Like a nurturing mother, Anita has made it a point to diligently pay her obligations to the cooperative.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Rojita

texts.en: Rojita is requesting a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. She lives near the main road and every day, many people come to buy her gasoline so she is still happy to do her business. Rojita has been involved in business activities since 2013, she started with her own working capital of $300.00. She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, because with this loan she can improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Mashendra

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Mashendra, a Ruma agent who lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java. Mashendra is a young man who has big hopes of becoming an entrepreneur. He sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services (electricity, water, etc) for his community. Mashendra joined Ruma in 2014 having learned about Ruma from a sales executive who came to his stall. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Mashendra has seen improvement in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. This loan would be very useful in helping Mashendra improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

Mashendra is in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services for his village community.

loans.name: Omary

texts.en:
Omary is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children in the Endebess Division of Kenya. He practices dairy, poultry, sheep, and goat farming to earn a living. 

Omary is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. He only has a dozen hens at the moment, whose products are used for family consumption. To enlarge the business, he intends to use this loan to buy over 40 head of poultry. He wants to take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market. 

Omary will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s wellbeing and the children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat is 35 years old and married to the man shown in this photo. He is a barber who is known in his town for cutting and styling hair well. He uses his profits to help support the family.

Nazakat finds his customer base is continually growing. For this reason Nazakat has obtained a 30,000 PKR Murabaha loan (an acceptable form of credit under Sharia, or Islamic religious law) for her husband to buy more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with extra furniture for his shop.

loans.use: to buy more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with extra furniture for his shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Maliana and is now applying for a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a bigger store, so she is taking this loan because she wants use it to improve her management. She will use it to buy additional supplies according to what people like including cooking oils, aqua, biscuits, noodles, milks, sardines, sweets, lighters and other things to sell, including soft drinks, SGM milk, perfumes, hand body, toothpaste, cigarettes, pens, sweets, biscuits, hard drinks, etc. 

Angelina has been involved in business activities since in 2010, when she started with her own working capital of USD 300.  She is earning a good income from her business, because many people like to buy from it, so she is still happy to do her business.

loans.use: to buy SGM milk, perfumes, hand body, toothpaste, cigarettes, pens, sweets, biscuits, soft drinks and hard drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
A sus 67 años de edad la señora Inés no se ha rendido, ella quiere cumplir sus sueños de comprar una vivienda, esta perseverante mujer se dedica a la venta de accesorios en oro y acero, tiene un local comercial.

Inés busca un apoyo financiero que necesita para la compra de una vitrina grande para la exhibición de inventario variado principalmente oro y acero.
texts.en:
At her 67 years of age, Inés has not given up.  She wants to fulfill her dreams of buying a house.  This persevering woman sells gold and steel accessories.  She has a commercial place.

Inés is seeking financial support.  She needs to buy a large display case to show her varied inventory, which is mainly gold and steel.

loans.use: to buy a large display case.

loans.name: Purevjal

texts.en: Purevjal is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working at a chemical factory for more than 20 years. His wife breeds cattle and sells diary products to local people for profit. Their children all live on their own. The house he and his wife live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs urgent repair. Purevjal is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass for house renovation. By doing so he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollution into the air. Purevjal is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en: Floriana is requesting a loan of (USD) $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business selling gasoline. She started to sell fuel in 2005 with her own working capital of (USD) $100. She is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy her gasoline and she also brings her gasoline to sell in the market. She is very happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin because she can use it to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. Aurelio has been able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days. 

He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently he took a loan to restock his store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soap, shampoo and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to expand his business for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with items like canned goods, oil, soap, shampoo and soy sauce.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar, 48, is married to the man shown in this photo. He drives a van in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

Kishwar’s husband wants to change out the engine in his van, as it is causing a lot of pollution and consuming too much oil. So Kishwar has requested a 35,000 PKR Murabaha loan (an acceptable form of credit under Sharia, or Islamic religious law) through Kiva's field partner Kashf for her husband to buy one for the van so as to make it easier on his customers.

Kishwar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his van so as to make it easier on his customers.

loans.name: Vingunguti Group

texts.en:
Mbullu, who is in his late 50's, is single with one grown child. He has been buying and selling cows for 20 years now. He works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mbullu's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loans to buy and sell more cows and has managed to pay back all of his loans successfully.  

Mbullu used his profits to take care of himself, repay his loans, cover household expenses, and put some in his bank account. He is doing great. He will use this loan to buy and sell more cows. He dreams of owning a big business.

Mbullu will share this loan with his loan group Vingunguti which consists of 4 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell more cows.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, but she earns an income as well. At the age of 48 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Diosa wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, as well as earning for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. 

In the future, Adriana wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome has been supporting himself and his wife by working for a construction company. He recently decided to start his own construction business in order to have more independence and input in the operations.

He has a lot of experience in this area, so he is confident in the potential of his new business. His greatest opportunity so far has been a contract to work for a community college in his area. This helped to significantly grow sales, and he is looking for bigger contracts like this to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to fund company operations for his construction business.

loans.name: Nakaryd

texts.en:
Nakaryd is energetic and passionate for fitness. She and her husband are originally from Venezuela, and she works hard to have her own business on top of a full-time job at a fashion store.

In the evenings after work, she teaches Zumba classes at a local gym. She wants to use this loan to make a website and create more effective advertising for her classes.

She is dedicated to providing excellent, personalized service to all of her clients and eventually wants her classes to be well known throughout the community.

loans.use: to create a website for her Zumba business.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary una mujer con actitud, con garra, fortaleza, una persona que ha sabido que es salir de las adversidades ya que por motivos del destino perdió a su esposo quedando como madre cabeza de familia de dos hijos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de mercancía, papelería, cosméticos y accesorios que trabaja de lunes a sábado 6 horas por día.

Busca mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, para ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina para la exhibición de velas, resmas de papel, entre otros.
texts.en:
Luz Dary is a woman with attitude, courage, and strength.  She is a person that has known what it is to overcome adversity, as her destiny was to lose her husband and be left as the woman head of household with two children.    

She has a business selling merchandise, paper, cosmetics and accessories and works Monday through Saturday for 6 hours each day.   

She looks to increase her sales and increase her usefulness.  For this, she is requesting a loan to buy a glass cabinet to display candles, reams of paper, and other things.

loans.use: to buy a glass cabinet to display candles, reams of paper, and other things.

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmarjav, 35 years old, lives with his wife, two children, mother-in-law and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as house interior designer at a building company since 2012. His wife runs small grocery store next to their house. His mother-in-law has retired from work and gets a state pension. His brother is unemployed and now looking for job. His two children both go to school. The house his family lives in has been deteriorated over the years, and it needs urgent repair. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,300 USD to buy building materials such as brick, shingles, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Nereza

texts.en: Nereza is managing a farm and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 5,000. Nereza hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record, so that she can always avail the programs and services that the cooperative is offering.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Herminia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day, because she is selling in the center of the market. 

Herminia will use this loan to buy some additional supplies such as detergents, soap, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, coffee, scissors, candles, soft drinks and hard drinks, as well as other items to sell. 

Herminia has been involved in this business activity since 2001, which she started with her own working capital of 200 USD. She feels very comfortable because with her business she can be responsible for her family. 

Herminia hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soap, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, coffee, scissors, candles, soft drinks and hard drinks, as well as other items to sell.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven has been working in Providence for many years with his transportation business. He is proud to have a reputation for a very high level of customer satisfaction. He lives with his wife and operates on his own.

He wants to expand his business, and in order to do so, he is requesting this loan to help him to cover expensive car maintenance and to buy a bigger car. His next step will be to own a limousine so that he can transport people to special events.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his transportation business.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Elena es una joven de 25 años de edad, su familia la podemos apreciar en los cuadros que ella misma elaboro, conformada por su pareja y dos hijos que hoy en día tienen 5 y 3 años de edad, durante estos últimos 5 años se dedicó de lleno a criar a sus hijos, dejando toda la responsabilidad financiera a su pareja.

Ya que sus hijos están más grandes, van a la guardería tiene un poco tiempo para ella, dejo atrás muchos proyectos que quiere retomar como lo son estudiar, tener casa propia y ahora que tiene a sus hijos su deseo es que estudien y sean unos profesionales.

Elena quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de fabricación de velas artesanales, con el dinero del monto comprara lo siguiente:
•	Ollas
•	Moldes
•	Colorantes
•	Esencias
•	Cera
•	Gel
•	Utensilios varios
texts.en:
Elena is a young woman, age 25. In the pictures, which she has created herself, we can see her family; it is composed of her husband and two children who are now ages five and three. During these last five years, she has devoted herself fully to raising her children, leaving all the financial responsibility to her husband.

As her children are bigger and going to nursery school, she has a little time for herself. She put aside many projects that she wants to resume, such as studying and having her own house. And, now that she has her children, her wish is that they may study and become professionals. 

Elena wants to request a loan to start a business making artisanal candles.  With the money, she will purchase the following:

•	Pots
•	Molds
•	Colorants
•	Scents
•	Wax
•	Gel
•	Various utensils

loans.use: to purchase pots, molds, colorants, and wax, among other items.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un laborioso hombre de 46 años de edad, su familia la conforma su pareja y sus dos hijos de 12 y 17 años de edad que depende económicamente de él, se dedica a la cría de ganado, actividad que inicio por necesidad económica y que está en vía de crecimiento.

Un negocio como la cría de ganando es algo de azar, las enfermedades, las sequías e incluso las fuertes lluvias son solo algunos de los motivos por el cual un ternero en etapa de crecimiento puede fallecer y por desgracia le toco pasar por esta situación por ello en base a sus ahorros y un préstamo que quiere pedir para completar el dinero desea comprar dos terneros para regular su actividad.
texts.en:
Víctor is an industrious 46-year-old man, his family is made up of his partner and their two sons of 12 and 17 years old, who depend on him financially, he raises cattle, an occupation that he started out of economic necessity and which is in the process of growth.

A business like cattle-raising is one of chance; diseases, drought and even strong rains are some of the reasons for which a growing calf can die and unfortunately he was affected by this situation, therefore with his savings and a loan that he wants to request to complete the sum of money he wishes to buy two calves to get his business in order.

loans.use: buy calves.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Senhor Augusto, casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 4 são maiores e independentes, e 4 na sua responsabilidade frequentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, e reformado da educação, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, termo acumulador, tanque de água, pagamento de mão-de-obra para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção sua casa e iniciar a construção de aviários para a posterior criar frangos para o consumo e vender como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
 O seu maior desafio é de ver os seus filhos formados e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos
texts.en:
Augusto is married and the father of eight children. Four of them are independent adults and three are still under his care and attend primary and secondary school. He is a retired teacher and owns a house where he lives with his family.

He will use the requested amount to buy cement, a water heater and a water tank, and to pay for the labor needed to continue building his house.

In the future, he plans to finish building his house and start building pens to raise broilers to sell, with the intention of improving the family income.

His biggest challenge is to see his children finish school and pay back the loan without defaulting, in order to lay the ground for future loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, a water heater and a water tank, and pay for the labor needed to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron and sand to finish two porches on her house.

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is 57 years old, widowed, and comes from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She has dedicated herself to raising her children. But now that she has only one child left in high school, she has found a partner to support her in all the challenges in life. 

Ma. Nancy is grateful that God has blessed her with a salon which has been her stable source of income used to provide for her and her child's daily needs. It is her passion for beauty and styling hair that drove her to open and maintain this kind of business. She attends seminars to both hone her skills in hair styling and update her with the newest trends. She has been operating her salon for several years already, so she has established a good reputation in the beauty business and has maintained regular customers. Through word of mouth her clients have increased over the years.

To help her expand operations of her beauty parlor she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy hair dye, shampoo, hair treatments, conditioner, and other beauty supplies. She thanks God and thanks you for your good heart, trusting that she will receive the financial aid she needs to continue to serve her customers well at her salon. Her earnings are a big help in both providing for her family's daily sustenance and sending her child to high school.

Ma. Nancy hopes to still grow and expand her business. She prays that God will continue to bless her with good health and long life until she will be able to send her child to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase salon supplies such as hair dye, hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, as well as other supplies needed for her salon business.

loans.name: Fortaleza_74 Group

texts.es:
Cinthia es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área céntrica y comercial, edificios de oficinas públicas y privadas conviven lado a lado. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Cinthia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (en el centro, viste polera negra y calza roja). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, papel, champú, aceite, especias, refrescos, harina, etc., actividad que realiza en su tienda de barrio ubicada en su domicilio, “mis ventas comienzan en la madrugada cuando llega el pan, y terminan muy por la noche…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia directa en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir el negocio con cantidad y variedad de productos para continuar con las ventas. Su sueño es ser la mejor tienda del lugar, ella desea abastecer su tienda para continuar trabajando en su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cinthia solicita un préstamo para surtir su tienda con alimentos de primera necesidad, continuar en el negocio y ser la mejor tienda del lugar.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a 32 years old woman. She  lives with her partner and has two children, ages 5 and 9.  . She has a neighborhood store selling basic food staples and other items.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, persevering, responsible, and very hard-working. She carries on her business in the Mutualista area, a downtown commercial area where public and private office buildings co-exist side by side.

The climate is warm and subtropical with a temperature that varies during the day between  21 and 35 degrees centigrade

Elvira is of average build, low in stature, dark-skinned, with grey eyes and long black hair that she wears tied up. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in this area, and she speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business. She is in the center of the photo, wearing a black T-shirt and red pants.  

She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver, and with her children; the eldest goes to school and the younger one is still not school-aged. They live in their own room constructed of wood, with a sheet metal roof and brick floor. The home has potable water, electricity and a sewer connection. Her business is selling basic food staples and other items, such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, paper, shampoo, cooking oil, spices, soft drinks, flour etc., an activity she carries on at her neighborhood store located in her home. " my sales start in the early morning when the bread arrives, and end very late at night," she says. 

Her business's advantage is that she doesn't have direct competition in the area. The disadvantage is her lack of working capital for supplying the store with quantity and variety of products for her on-going sales. Her dream is to be the best store in the area. She wishes to supply her store so that she  can continue working in her business. This is her third loan with the institution in the two years she has been carrying on this activity. These are the reasons why Cinthia is requesting a loan for supplying her store with basic food staples; to continue her business, and be the best store in the area.

loans.use: To stock her store with basic food staples,  keep her business going and be the best store in the area.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en: Alphonce was born in 1966. He has been running an electronics shop for six years now. He works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Alphonce's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy electronics items like cookers, fans, and radios to increase stock in his shop. He is so hard-working and happy with the loan. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to start building his house and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the out-of-stock items in the electronic business. He dreams of finishing building his house. He will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out-of-stock items in his electronic business

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is a hard-working 26-year-old smallholder farmer from Esani village in Western Kenya. To earn a decent living, he practices dairy, tea and tree farming. There are over 200 trees growing on his 0.5 acre farm.

Rodgers is seeking a loan of KES 50,000, which he will use to acquire important assets and inputs for his farm business. His plan is to spend: KES 20,000 to buy hens and start poultry farming; KES 20,000 on a water tank for watering his crops; and KES 10,000 for farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.
 
Through your loan, Rodgers will be able to acquire new assets, generate new income and grow his existing business to the next level. Rodgers will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and to continue investing in poultry.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Pagb Tarpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est responsable du groupe  PAGB TAR PANGA. Mariée elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 11 ans et le moins âgé a 1 an. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 08 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnant.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 04 sacs de petit-mil, 01 sac de maïs, 01 sac de sorgho et 04 sacs de haricots.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne payer un congélateur pour la vendre en plus de l'eau.
texts.en: Mrs AMINATA is the leader of the PAGB TAR PANGA group. She is the married mother of 4 children. The eldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. 3 of the children go to school, and she is taking care of 8 persons. Mrs AMINATA has been selling cereals for 11 years. She gets her supplies from surrounding markets. With the money from the loan, she wants to purchase 4 bags of pearl millet, 1 bag of maize, 1 bag of sorghum, and 4 bags of beans. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her activity. She hopes to purchase a freezer to also sell water.

loans.use: to buy bags of pearl millet, maize, millet and beans

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a businesswoman who earns through the buying and selling of various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for concreting of a fence. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for concreting of a fence

loans.name: Remely

texts.en: Remely is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 60 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Larena, Siquijor. This is how she supports her family, with a meager income of PHP 8,000 per month. Recently, Remely availed herself of a loan to purchase Nipa thatch, bamboo, nails and labor for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase Nipa thatch, bamboo, nails and labor for roofing

loans.name: Wendkouni De Kalgonde Group

texts.fr:
Mme KOURA est responsable du groupe  WENDKOUNI DE KALGONDE. Elle  est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 24 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 12 personnes en charge.
Madame fait la restauration depuis 18 ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes boutiquiers.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 10 sacs de riz et un sac d’arachides pour transformer en pâte d'arachide pour sa cuisine.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne aussi encourager ses enfants dans les études en payant leurs études.
texts.en: Mrs KOURA is the leader of the WENDKOUNI DE KALGONDE group. She is the married mother of 5 children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 24 years old. 3 of her children go to school, and she has to support 12 persons. Mrs KOURA has had a restaurant for 18 years. She gets her supplies from wholesaler shopkeepers. With the money from the loan, she intends to buy 10 bags of rice and 1 bag of groundnuts to turn into peanut paste for her kitchen. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her activity. She also hopes to encourage her children to study by paying for their studies.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and groundnuts.

loans.name: Tina

texts.pt:
A senhora Tina de 22 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude numa casa cedida pelos sogros, é casada, mãe de 2 filhos menores e vive com mais um sobrinho que está sob sua responsabilidade.
Com o presente financiamento de 10.000 irá comprar vinho, cerveja diversa e refrescos para revender em casa.
Tem como sonhos crescer no negócio e construir uma casa melhorada para dar conforto a sua familia.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Tina is 22 years old. She comes from Magude and lives there in a house that was provided by her in-laws. She's married and has two underage children. She's also responsible for her nephew who lives with her.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she will purchase wine, various types of beer and refreshments for re-selling at her house.
Her dreams are to make her business grow and build a better house so she can provide comfort for her family.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been turning to business and to credit in order to meet her needs.

loans.use: to purchase wine, various types of beer and refreshments for re-selling.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said, who is 35 years old, is married and has four children who are in school. He is a businessman running a chips kiosk for 10 years now. He is working from mid-day to midnight daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit. Said is now requesting his seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Said used his previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to restock his chips kiosk with potatoes, eggs, and chicken. He also increased the number of customers. In the coming years, Said would like to sell other types of food such as rice, etc., so as to have all types of customers. He plans to invest his new credit in buying new kitchen equipment for making chips. He will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen equipment for making chips

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.en: Leopoldina lives in Maliana, and she is a businesswoman.  She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for the business and her shop is in the center of the market, so many people come to buy in it. Leopoldina has been involved in business activities since 2011. She started with her own working capital of $100. She is earning a good income from her business, so she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy additional supplies including hand and body balm, perfume, candy, soap, chips, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy hand and body balm, perfume, candy, soap, chips, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Alonso

texts.es:
El trabajo de Jairo no se trata de ofrecer un servicio de entretenimiento para las personas, ni vender alimentos, ni cerveza, ni refrescos, su principal responsabilidad es generar una excelente calidad de vida a su familia conformada por 3 hijos menores de edad y su pareja y para ello usa como herramienta su negocio de Bar.

Jairo sueña con tener vivienda propia, con salir adelante, ver a sus hijos graduarse de una universidad, vivir feliz y cuando genera mayor número de recursos ampliar su familia, pero para ello necesita mucho que su negocio crezca.

Jairo se siente muy motivado por los últimos resultados de su negocio, se ha quedado sin mercancía de cerveza, por ello desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de inventario de cerveza, licores y refrescos.
texts.en:
Jairo’s work has nothing to do with offering entertainment to people, selling food, beer, nor beverages. His primary responsibility is to create an excellent quality of life for his family, comprised of three underage children and his partner. In order to achieve this he uses, as a tool, his business of Bar. 

Jairo dreams about having his own home, getting ahead, seeing his children graduate from university, living happily, and once he generates more resources, expanding his family. However, for that to happen, he needs a lot so that his business grows. 

Jairo feels very motivated by the latest results of his business. He has been left without a supply of beer, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase an inventory of beer, liquors, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of beer, liquors, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Wendnalokdo Group

texts.fr: Assetou, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Assetou et les autres membres du groupe sont à leur 3ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et les remboursements se font à la bonne date. Elle est coiffeuse de profession depuis 14 ans. Elle fait des perruques pour vendre. Assetou a besoin d'un crédit pour approvisionner son salon de coiffure en mèches, en gèle et en pommades.Elle a beaucoup de client parce qu'elle est accueillante et fait les tresses rapidement et bien. Après ses services rendus et la vente de ses mèches, perruques et pommades, Assetou aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire les dépenses de sa maison et aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Assetou, the representative member, is a married mother of two. She and the other group members are on their 3rd loan contract with ACFIME, and the payments have been made on time. Assetou has been a hairdresser for fourteen years. She makes wigs to sell. 

She is in need of a loan to stock her hair salon with hair extensions, gels, and ointments. She has many customers, since she is accommodating and braids hair well and quickly. After providing services and selling hair extensions, wigs, and ointments, Assetou will have a profit enabling her to cover household expenses and also to continue her business.

loans.use: to stock her hair salon withhair extensions, gels, and ointments

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.pt:
Senhor Álvaro tem 38 anos de idade é casado, pai de 2 filhos frequentando o ensino primário, contabilista de profissão e vive na casa própria com a sua família, sustentando mais 6 sobrinhos órfãos de pais.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de arroz, farinha, batata, feijão e outros derivados para reabrir a sua mercearia visto que esteve por um tempo fechada.
No futuro pretende ampliar a sua casa e ampliar o seu negócio colocando os produtos perto dos cidadãos aumentando assim a sua renda mensal.
O seu maior desafio é de aumentar a renda familiar de modo a colocar os seus filhos a estudar em escola com melhores condições para se aprender, actualmente estudam numa escola publica e ao relento.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 38 years old, married and the father of two children who go to primary school. He is an accountant by profession, lives in his own home with his family and also supports six nieces and nephews who are orphans.  

This loan amount will be used to buy rice, flour, potatoes, beans and other items so he can reopen his store which has been closed for a while.

In the future Álvaro would like to extend his house, enlarge his store and place his products close to the townspeople to increase his monthly income. 

Álvaro's main challenge is to increase his family's income so that he can put his children through school in the best conditions to learn. At the moment they are studying at a public school and outside.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, potatoes, beans and other items

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.pt:
Senhor Aurélio tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com a sua esposa, pai de 3 filhos frequentando o ensino primário e secundário, é negociante e operador de máquinas, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de arroz, açúcar, leite, farinha, óleo, massas, para aumentar os produtos na sua mercearia visto que ha muita procura dos mesmos pelos seus clientes.
 No futuro pretende abrir uma escolinha como forma de contribuir na educação das crianças da região onde vive e consequentemente reduzir o analfabetismo.
A exiguidade de fundos faz com que os seus planos não sejam realizados a tempo oportuno, assim sendo vai apostar em empréstimos na hluvuku adsema como forma de alavancar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Aurélio is 39 years old and lives with his wife. He is the father of three children who go to primary and secondary school. He is a businessman and a trader who lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else financially.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, oil and pasta to increase the amount of products in his store, seeing as there is a lot of demand for them from his customers.

In the future Aurélio would like to open a small school as a way of contributing to the education of children and reducing illiteracy in the region where he lives.

Due to a scarcity of funds his plans didn't come to fruition at the right time, so he is now counting on his loans with Hluvuku-Adsema as a way of moving forward with his projects.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, flour, oil and pasta to increase the amount of products in his store

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 37-year-old Lebanese married mother who lives with her husband and 4 school-aged children. 

Despite bad circumstances, Hanady is making a great effort, in cooperation with her husband, to be able to provide for their family’s needs. 

Hanady has owned a minimarket since 2014. And today, she is asking to take a loan from Kiva's field partner Vitas. s.a.l. She will purchase merchandise for her business so she can both enhance her job and increase her revenue. 

Hanady is an optimistic person, always aiming for the best, and plans to receive more Kiva loans in the coming years to keep improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her minimarket.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools to use for higher production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm tools for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Bayle Group

texts.en:
Fatxiya is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She makes fast food and sells it to secondary schools in Gabiley, and also she provides food for weddings and other special concerts. 

Fatxiya is the mother of four children, and surprisingly, she is the head of her household because she covers all the needs of her family. For instance, she pays school fee for her children, she pays utilities for her house, and also, she monitors and solves her family problems.  

Now she wants to expand her fast food small business; therefore, she applied for a loan of $200 from Kaaba MFI. Fatxiya wants to use the loan to buy more dry food such as flour and sugar. 

Fatxiya is the group leader of Bayle group, and she is the one in the group photo sitting in the middle and raising her hand. Bayle group consists of six female members, and all of them have different existing small businesses.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for her fast food business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine owns "Upstate Events," which started as a private chef service in 2012. Because of huge demand, she expanded in 2014 to be a full-service farm-to-table caterer for weddings and special events. The business supports the local food economy by purchasing only food that is grown, raised and produced locally. They also only use local vendors, like photographers. Christine is a licensed nursing professional and has extensive experience in the hospitality industry, specifically restaurant management and creative development. She recently took over an historic property to create a beautiful event venue, and this extensive renovation process is in its final stage. She currently has 20 employees but wishes to continue expanding the business. Her goals are to grow food to benefit families in need in the community and also to create a community food hub. When the new venue is open, she will also offer educational and hands-on programs for residents, teaching them to source, cook and preserve local food for healthy year-round eating. She will use this loan to finalize renovations and purchase additional kitchen equipment.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen equipment for her farm-to-table catering service

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in the Obwari location of Kenya. He practices dairy, poultry, goat and tree farming on his one acre of land. Mostly, his activities meet subsistence levels.  

Through Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance partner that seeks to make Kenyan subsistence farmers more 'commercial minded', Mike is seeking a KES 40,000 loan to start commercial poultry farming.

With your loan, he will move from having six hens on his farm to over 40 of them. He has budgeted KES 20,000 for this move. The remaining KES 20,000 will be used to buy a water tank that will store water for his animals and crops during dry seasons.

Mike will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry in the future.

loans.use: to buy poultry and a water tank

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
Firdavs is a brave guy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a fourth year student at university. 

Firdavs was interested in financial accounting and recently has studied with excellence to be a good specialist. He is well-known among students and friends. 

Firdavs is a responsible, bright, honest and kind person. He does not have the money to pay for his educational costs this year. Therefore, he has appealed to IMON International asking for financial support to pay his education fees. 

He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees

loans.name: Ghadi Zeina Group

texts.en:
Ibtissam is the featured borrower for Ghadi Zeina Group. She got along with the other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbours and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses while living at the same time.

Ibtissam is a 58-year-old widowed mother of seven children. Six years ago, she started selling clothes from her house to cover her family's needs and expenses for she is their only breadwinner. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. 

Thus today, Ibtissam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Ibtissam is the first lady on the left of the photo. 

With respect to the other group members, Nagham is the lady sitting in the middle, and Zeina is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Lilian is a mother of one child who is in school. She is in her mid-20s and is supporting her family by running a grocery store selling beer, sodas, water, and spirits. 

Lilian has been managing the business for five years now. Lilian runs her business from 6 am to 11 pm and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is Lilian's second loan via Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy grocery stocks of drinks (beer, sodas, and water). She dreams of expanding her grocery business. 

Lilian will share this loan with her loan group "Tujikwamue," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery stocks of drinks (beer, sodas, and water)

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara is a 32 year old, married woman. She lives with her husband and three school aged children. Due to bad financial conditions, Lara and her husband cooperate together to fulfill their family needs in order to be able to live in a good way.

Lara decided to start her own business in 2011 from her home, where she offers a great variety of used clothes at good prices. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and therefore her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Miriam De Las Misericordias

texts.es:
Aquí Está Miriam orgullosa de ser una campesina, una mujer que junto con su esposo (ver foto) montaron un negocio de cría de aves buscando ingresos para sacar su familia adelante. 
Miriam es Madre de dos hijos inicio su negocio como necesidad económica, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura pero ambos trabajan en el galpón de pollos, tiene gran trabajo en equipo y lo más hermoso es ver el amor que se respira en el ambiente de su hogar.
Comprar los terrenos donde habitan, pagar la educación de sus hijos y salir adelante es la ambición de esta trabajadora pareja que solicita un préstamo para crecer, con el apoyo que puedan recibir comprara 100 pollos de engorde y alimento.
texts.en:
This is Miriam who is proud to be a farmer.  A woman who, along with her husband (see picture), set up a poultry business looking to increase their family income.

Miriam is a mother of two.  She started her business as an economic necessity.  Her husband works in agriculture but both work with chickens.  They work great as a team and it is most beautiful to see the love that permeates the atmosphere of their home.

The greatest goal of this hard working couple is to purchase the land where they live, pay for the education of their children and move forward.

They are requesting a loan to grow, with any support they can receive, to purchase 100 broiler chickens and feed.

loans.use: to purchase 100 broiler chickens and feed.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia es una agricultura de pura cepa, una mujer formada en el campo y que gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos de su madre monto un negocio de cría y engorde de pollos, actividad que ha ayudado en su hogar a completar los recursos con los que se mantiene su hogar ya que está formando por ella, su pareja y sus tres hijos de 9, 13, 14 años de edad.

Esta carismática mujer no se conforma solo con sobrevivir, quiere crecer y ser una proveedora de las principales marcas de venta de pollos congelados en el país.

Sonia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de concentrado y 40 pollos, el concentrado será en grandes cantidades ya que sus pollos son de reconocimiento por su calidad y sabor.
texts.en:
Sonia is a pure-bred farmer, a woman formed in the field and who, thanks to the knowledge acquired from her mother, set up a chicken breeding and fattening business, an occupation that has helped, in her home, to complete the resources with which she supports her household since it is formed by her, her partner, and her three children aged 9, 13, and 14 years.

This charismatic woman does not settle for just surviving; she wants to grow and be a supplier of the main selling brands of frozen chickens in the country. She wants to request a loan for the purchase of chicken feed and 40 chickens; the chicken feed will be in large numbers since her chickens are recognized for their quality and taste.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed in large numbers and 40 chickens.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 37-year-old married Lebanese woman who lives with her two children, all of whom still attend school. 

To help her husband, Nisrine has worked diligently at producing food for the past three years. Her products are sold to all neighbourhoods and people really enjoy her tasty and delicious provisions. 

Today, Nisrine is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase foodstuffs and raw materials to continue her production. She is also planning to start visiting grocery stores, supermarkets and so on to sell them her food to make a good income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and raw materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and married. 

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in pig-fattening for four years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for her genge (grocery store).

loans.name: Gekara

texts.en:
Gekara, 29, is a smallholder farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya. He is married and has 3 children, the youngest being only 4 months old. To provide for his family, Gekara practices dairy, poultry, tea and tree farming. He also runs a side business that involves him transporting goods and passengers over short distances on his motorcycle.

Gekara is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. He intends to use this loan to buy a brood of hens that will lay eggs, produce chicks and provide meat for sale. He plans to spend half of the loan amount on poultry farming and the other half on farm inputs for his tea farm.

Gekara will use the income that he hopes to earn from this loan investment to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants continue investing in poultry to make his farm bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Celestina has been in this business for 20 years now.

Celestina requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, salt, soy sauce, rice, etc. for her business.

Celestina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, salt, soy sauce, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old and married. He lives with his wife and some of his seven children who are still attending school. His main business is banana farming. His four acre farm has over 1,000 trees, most of which produce bananas.
 
David is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. With your loan, he will be able to take great advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market. 

David will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry, to make it bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Abelardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Abelardo es un hombre casado tiene 55 años de edad, un negocio de tienda de abarrotes muy completo que desea convertir en un futuro en un supermercado y paso a paso lo va logrando ya que en su tienda va integrando mayor número de productos.

Expandir su local, ofrecer productos nuevos, aumentar su cantidad de inventario son solo algunos de los logros que desea alcanzar con un préstamo que desea realizar, para la compra de surtido de abarrotes, granos, productos de aseo personal, aseo doméstico y cancelar saldo anterior.
texts.en: Abelardo is a married man, 55 years old, with a very complete grocery store that he wishes to convert, in the future, into a supermarket. Little by little he is accomplishing this because in his store he keeps integrating more products. To expand his store, offer new products, increase his quantity of inventory, these are just some of the goals that he hopes to achieve.
