With a loan, he wishes to purchase an assortment of groceries, bulk grains, personal toiletry products, cleaning supplies, and cancel previous balances.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of groceries, bulk grains, personal toiletry products, cleaning supplies, and cancel previous balances.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dewi, one of Ruma agents. Dewi lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java, located about five hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband. She owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for her community. Dewi joined Ruma in 2014. She knew Ruma from one of the sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to try to become an entrepreneur in technology, as well as increase her savings and provide a bigger contribution to her community.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Dewi sees improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Knowing about the importance of this to her, your loan will be very useful to help Dewi improve her business and her community who need access to such services.

Dewi is the one who is seen in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her village community.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a 25-year-old single man from Deir al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. Muhammad is always thinking of ways to become economically independent and help his family with home expenses. He purchased a rickshaw to transport goods between shops and traders to generate income for himself and his family. Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to pay for the rickshaw. Mohammed appears in the photo with the rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Behzod

texts.en:
Behzod is a capable guy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. He is living in a big town, which has a long history. Behzod is single and lives with parents. He is a second year student at Polytechnical University. He wants to be an engineer-economist in the future. 

He was happy to hear about opportunity at KIVA that gives loans to change lives. He appealed to get a loan to pay for his tuition fees for his studies. He believes that KIVA lenders will support him and promises to be a professional of his major.

loans.use: to pay his tutiion fees for his studies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years old, married to Joyce and supports a family of four children.He has been operating as a butcher for the last seven years, earning KES 14,000 per month. 

John has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a cow to slaughter and sell as meat.He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy a vehicle for transportation.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow to butcher and sell as meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply more milk to customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Ondieki

texts.en:
Ondieki is 76 years old, married to Grace, and supports three children. 

He is a small-scale farmer earning an income of KES 14,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to set up a cow shed and lease land for planting nappier grass for his livestock. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

His hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to set up a cow shed and lease land for planting nappier grass for his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk in the market to earn more income.

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.es:
Un Duro golpe sufrió el señor Luis quien perdió a su esposa, quedando solo ya que no tenía hijos, encontrándose desesperado y depresivo por lo sucedido, este hombre quien la vida le dio una oportunidad le brindo fortaleza, esperanzas, ganas de progreso inicio con una tienda en la zona rural de zancudo y desde entonces trabaja entre 12 y 14 horas diarias para no solo generar el sustento diario si no progresar, tener la tienda más grande y completa de la vereda y perseguir el sueño que una vez inicio con su fallecida esposa de comprar una vivienda propia y hoy en día trabaja arduamente por lograrlo.

Para seguir progresando y tener un negocio grande, ir integrando otros servicios, generar empleo y estar  un paso más cerca de su sueño, Luis le gustaría solicitar un préstamo uno que invertirá en lo siguiente:
•	Compra de 10 juegos de mesas en madera
•	Comprar un televisor de 52 pulgadas para que sus clientes visualicen futbol en su negocio,
•	Adecuar una zona para iniciar la venta de comidas rápidas (generara un empleo)
•	Comprar un enfriador para almacenar alimentos refrigerados (genera un empleo)
•	Comprar surtido de alimentos congelados como  pollo, pescado, quesos, salchichas, embutidos en general
Como lo ven ese monto no solo traerá progreso a su negocio, generara empleos, trabajos que ayudaran mucho a que una zona tan vulnerable y pobreza como zancudo salga a delante a través de sus empresarios.
texts.en:
It was a difficult time for Luis when he lost his wife leaving him alone, as he had no children. He found himself hopeless and depressed by the event. This man who life gave an opportunity offering strength, hope, and the desire to progress, started a store in the rural part of Zancudo.

Since then he has worked between 12 and 14 hours per day not only to earn his sustenance but to progress. To have the biggest and most complete store in the area and chase the dream he once started with his wife of buying his own house.

Today he works very hard to achieve this. To continue to progress and have a large business he is integrating other services, generating employment and taking another step closer to his dream.

Luis wants to request a loan to invest in the following: buy 10 wooden game table; a 52 inch television so clients can watch football (soccer) in his store; adapt an area to start fast food sales (creating a job); buy a cooler to store refrigerated foods (creating a job); buy an assortment of frozen food like chicken, fish, cheese, sausage, and cold cuts in general. See how this amount not only brings progress to his business, generates employment, work that helps a lot in such a vulnerable and poor area such as Zancudo to get ahead through it's entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a games table, a television and make improvements to the shop amongst others.

loans.name: Maritel

texts.en:
Maritel is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns more income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers via her fish vending business.

Maritel has been in this business for two years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yeukai

texts.en:
Yeukai is a 30-year-old mother of one who resides in the Mbire District of Zimbabwe. She is a dedicated lady who is always campaigning for economic independence for all the young women in her community. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills education at the local secondary school. 

With the first loan she received she has been able to boost the business and make enough profit to help her provide for the family. Her market overlaps to the Zambian side of the border. The area is drought prone, but from her business, Yeukai is now able to fend for her family. 

The young woman has an ambitious future plan to purchase a truck for use in her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock through buying sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, juice, salt and mealie-meal in bulk to raise her sales.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. It will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful about getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for  embellishment.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy is a 59-year-old, widow with three children, who lives in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has been selling noodles  for over nine years. Two of her children are workers. Suy and her children can make approximately USD 25 per day.

Now Suy would like to request a loan because she needs finances to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy more groceries and improve her family's income. In the future, she is going to expand her business, and save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mẫn

texts.en:
Mrs Mẫn is 41 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.  Mẫn lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in the village.  Moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase a clean water filter machine .
In 2015, Mẫn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mẫn has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Mẫn hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clean water filter machine .

loans.name: Zuhurshoh

texts.ru: Зухуршох 41 летний уроженец аз города Куляб. Куляб не большой город с приятными гостеприимными людьми. Об этом народе у вас останутся одни приятные впечатления. Зухуршох один из этого удивительного района. Он вместе с женой и детьми живет тут довольно долгое время. Зурхуршох с женой занимаются переработкой шерсти животных. Они покупают, шерсти обрабатывают их солью, высушивают и после перепродают на заводах. Этим бизнесом они живут уже 15 лет. Сейчас есть потребность к их продукции, и им нужно приобрести больше шерсти на обработку. Зухуршох обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести больше шерсти. Он надеется, что его поддержат, и благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: Zuhurshoh is a 41-year-old native of the city of Kulob. Kulob is a small city with pleasant, hospitable people. You will be left with only pleasant impressions of these people. Zuhurshoh is one from this amazing region. He has been living here with his wife and children for quite a long time. Zuhurshoh and his wife process raw wool. They buy it, process it with salt, dry it out and then resell it to factories. They have been making their living from this business for fifteen years. Now there is demand for their product, and they need to acquire more wool for processing. Zuhurshoh has applied for a loan in order to acquire more wool. He hopes that he will be supported, and thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy raw wool for processing.

loans.name: Yarmuhammad

texts.ru: Ярмухаммеду 35 лет. Он из Шахритус. Ярмухаммад женат, и имеет троих детей. Жене 29 лет.  В Шахритусе Ярмухаммед занимается животноводством. Животноводческая деятельность  хорошая работа с хорошим доходом. Ему нравится своя работа. Ярмухаммад покупает молодых телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Вот так он зарабатывает на жизнь. Еще он занимается земледелием на земле. Ярмухаммад не боится трудиться, видно, что он сильный и трудолюбивый мужчина. 5 лет он занимается в этой сфере деятельностью. Ярмухаммад запрашивает кредит для купли несколько молодых телят.
texts.en: Yarmuhammad is 35 years old. He is from Shahrituz. Yarmuhammad is married and has three children. Yarmuhammad rears animals in Shahrituz. Animal rearing is a good job with good income. He likes his work. Yarmuhammad buys young calves, fattens them up for a few months, then resells them at the livestock market. This is how he makes his living. He also grows crops on some land. Yarmuhammad is not afraid of labor and it is evident that he is a strong and hard-working man. He has been working in this field for five years. Yarmuhammad is requesting a loan to buy a few young calves.

loans.use: to buy a few young calves.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man, living with his parents and two siblings. His parents are the main source of income for the family. As for Maher, he gives all his time to his education. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay his educational fees. 

He is very eager to make use of the loan, as his only purpose is to get an education to be competitive with others to reach higher positions in his professional career. This is his first loan, but he said that he would be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay his educational fees.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old. She is a mother of three. Her husband is a bus driver. All her children are attending school, and she wants to continue educating them so they will finish their studies and become successful someday.

She gets her family's sustenance by selling snacks and grocery items to the people in her village. She manages a store near a school. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy grocery items, soft drinks, and bread to sell in her store.

This will increase her sales capacity, and she will gain more profits from it. She will also continue offering good products and friendly service to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, soft drinks, and bread to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, a 46-year-old woman from Cortes, Bohol, engages in a buy-and-sell business. She sells dry goods like slippers, hangers and kitchen wares. She is married with three children, ages 22, 17 and 10, respectively. Her husband works in construction. She has been engaging in that kind of business for more than 10 years already.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional assorted dry goods, like clothing, hair gel, clips, perfume and many other things. With these, her stock will improve, and she'll be able to cater to her customers' orders. Thus, she could continue to send her children to school and provide better shelter to live.  

She is hoping that some day her livelihood will improve to support the need of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional assorted dry goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade equipment for her event/wedding DJ service

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the town of Badian in Cebu. He is 43 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in his community, which he has done for six years. He sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. 

He is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles and rice. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, David is confident that his sari-sari business will be more prosperous. He will use his profits for the school fees of his two dependents ages six and twelve.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles and rice, to help pay school fees

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery vive en el trópico de Cochabamba, se fue del departamento de Santa Cruz, tiene 1 hijo dependiente por el cual ella tiene que trabajar, desde entonces trabaja como agricultora realizando trabajos como jornalera independientemente porque sus familiares están en santa cruz y se encuentra sola junto a su hijo, ahora tiene su cónyuge él tiene su terreno en el cual trabajan juntos como agricultores, están saliendo adelante con mucho esfuerzo y mucha dedicación en su actividad, a la fecha se compraron un lote urbano, son personas responsables, trabajadores, su actividad económica es productora de yuca tienen en producción 1 1/2 hectárea, con el crédito solicitado quiere ampliar su producción de yuca para generar más ingresos y así mantener a su familia y darle una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosmery lives in the area of Cochabamba.  She left the department of Santa Cruz, and has one dependent child, reason for which she has to work. 

Since her move, she has been working as a farmer doing work as an independent day laborer because her relatives are in Santa Cruz and she was alone with her son.  

Now, she has her spouse who owns a field in which they work together as farmers.  They are moving forward with great effort and dedication in their activity.  To date, they bought an urban lot.  They are responsible people, and hard workers.

Her business is that of cassava production.  They have 1 1/2 hectares.

With the requested loan she wants to expand her production of cassava to generate more income and support her family and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her production of cassava to generate more income and provide for her family and give them a better life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and enough stock of nappier grass for the cow

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
Carmen, de 54 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como accesorios, algunos cosméticos, productos de uso personal, entre otros.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de sus tres hijos.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes. 

Mercancía como desodorante y cremas es lo que desea tener para aumentar sus ventas.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
.
Carmen, 54 years old, is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to get ahead and have a good life.  She works at selling varied merchandise such as accessories, some cosmetics, and personal care products among others.

 Carmen began this work eager to find the resources needed to support herself and her three children.  She is an enterprising and highly disciplined woman.  Deodorant and creams are the merchandise she wants to have to increase her sales.    Carmen hopes to be able to grow as a business person and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a large stock of merchandise and thus have inventory available to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tati

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! This is Tati, one of Ruma’s agents. Tati lives in Tasikmalaya, a city in southeastern West Java, Indonesia located between Bandung and Purwokerto on the southerly of the two major road routes across Java. Tati is happily married and she and her husband have three children. Tati owns and manages a small stall that sells basic household products. She's excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. 

By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Tati's shop. This will allow Tati to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product, Mapan, designed to assist lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save money little by little for larger purchases by depositing change with agents like Tati. As the balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 

As a Mapan agent, Tati will process deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts. She will also receive orders from customers for products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer places an order, Tati will submit the order via SMS and the product is delivered to the customer within 5-10 days. Tati believes that Mapan provides her community access to higher-quality products at lower prices. 

Tati is shown in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to serve as an agent for Ruma's layaway program, Mapan, and provide extra working capital for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops on her farm

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget (20) is successfully running a poultry business. She started with 50 birds, and upon receiving her first loan, she increased her flock to 100 birds. She has a current capacity of 100 birds every three weeks.

With the profit, Bridget managed to pay school fees for her brother, who was in form 4, and to make her repayments on time.

With the loan that she is requesting now, she is looking forward to increasing her sales volume by building a bigger fowl run and ordering more birds, from 100 to 250 per batch.

loans.use: to build a bigger fowl run.

loans.name: Joao

texts.en:
Joao lives in Dili. He started building his house but was not able to finish it off due to a lack of money.

He is now applying for a loan of $1,500.00 to buy cement, sand and other materials that he will be using to complete his building construction. He hopes that by getting this loan, he will be at last able to upgrade the house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and other materials to complete construction.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Her name is Ma. Chona. She is 47 and a resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and has one child who is already in high school. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs and for the schooling of her child.

Ma. Chona has a direct-selling business. She sells health supplements (LIFE products). Filipinos are now more health conscious and knowledgeable about herbal multivitamins for better quality of life and longevity. Her charming personality has earned her regular customers, and she has been referred to by most of her clients. Her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community are her base clients. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of "LIFE" health supplement products to meet the advanced and increasing orders of her customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings cover their daily sustenance and help fund her high school child's education.

Ma. Chona trusts that God will continue to bless her efforts with more success. She prays for a happy family and to be allowed to help more people become healthy. She faithfully meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several bottles of "LIFE" products (health supplements) to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a married mother of 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Eugenia has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her business.

Eugenia has been in this business for 3 years now. She would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
ÉL es Hernán un hombre de 55 años de edad, separado de su familia, es padre de dos hijas ya mayores de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, vive solo y todos los recursos que obtiene son destinado para pago de arriendo, gastos de alimentación, etc.

La demanda de sus clientes es el principal motivo por el cual el señor Hernán solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de grano y embutidos que son los productos que mayor rotación en su tienda.

El préstamo ayudara a crecer a este hombre que es tan feliz realizando su profesión.
texts.en:
He is Hernán, a 55 year old man, separated from his family,  the father of two girls already grown.  Hernán has a store selling products in daily use.  He lives alone and all the money he earns is needed for paying rent,  food costs, etc.

Customer demand is the primary reason why Hernán is asking for a loan to buy a selection of grains and cold meat, the products which sell quickly in his store.  The loan will promote growth in this man who is very happy carrying out his work.

loans.use: to buy a selection of grains and cold meats, the products which turn over most quickly in his store.

loans.name: Mayra Janneth

texts.es: Mayra tiene 36 años de edad es soltera vive con su madre en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar ella se dedica a vender legumbres en el mercado y solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo por que esta empezando y quiere crecer en el negocio gracias a este credito podra hacerlo, realiza las compras en Riobamba y en Ambato cada semana,su sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Mayra is 36 years old , single and lives with her mother in the province of Bolivar, Guaranda.  

She sells vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan for working capital because she is just starting and wants to grow her business.  Thanks to this loan she may be able to do so.

She makes her purchases in Riobamba and Ambato each week.  Her dream is to one day purchase some land to plant.  

She likes to spend her spare time with her family.

loans.use: to have working capital.

loans.name: Claudia Mirelly

texts.es:
Claudia, a sus 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace 5 meses se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección de manera independiente, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en su casa y con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 10 horas, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita en apoyo con la Corporación Interactuar es para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina plana, con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 

Claudia manifiesta que su mayor desafío es el alto costo de los insumos para trabajar, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Claudia, at 33 years old, is an energetic and hardworking woman. She always searching for alternatives that will allow her to progress.

For the past 5 months she has been making ready-to-wear clothes on her own. She learned this trade empirically and she slowly started to perfect her technique and expand her knowledge through practice. This prompted her to start her own shop in a space she adapted in her home. She bought her first machines with some of her savings. 

Claudia works alone every day for 10 hours a day but, depending on the amount of work she has, she has help from another person. In this way she has managed to generate enough income to cover her household expenses. 

The loan she is requesting with the help of Corporación Interactuar will be used to strengthen her business. The money will buy a stationary sewing machine with which she can streamline the production process and therefore acquire more contracts, generating more profits in her business. 

Claudia says that her biggest challenge is the high cost of supplies for her work. However, this keeps her motivated to continue providing a better service and striving so that her dream of accreditation for her business becomes a reality.This will allow her to generate employment opportunities so that she can improve her quality of life and that of the people that influence her work.

loans.use: to buy a stationary sewing machine with which she can speed up the production process and acquire more contracts.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP-UMKM Syariah’s clients, Ani. She is 66 years old and is a widow. She lives with her children; she has one son and one daughter. 

Ani is a food merchant. For 7 years she has been selling snacks, cooked side dishes, etc. Her children help her so they can improve their family's income.

Ani has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,200,000 IDR. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and toilet for their home so she can improve their access to water and sanitation. Her family's income is not enough to build a toilet and water access by cash in advance, but they are able to repay a loan they might receive.

Ani and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and toilet for their home so she can improve her family's access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: Argenis De Jesus

texts.es:
Argenis una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica y sobre todo poder dedicar su tiempo a sus 3 hijos, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios a domicilios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.

Espera crecer mucho más su negocio, en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado de un forma segura.
Su dificultad más grande es el transporte tan complicado en la ciudad.

El crédito será utilizado para adquirir productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.) con los que podrá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Argenis, always an enterprising person, has started various businesses trying to find economic stability and above all be able to devote time to her three children.  She is now working in the world of beauty with her services to customers at home of hair care, make up, nail treatment, etc.  With this Argenis has earned income to support her home.

She hopes to grow her business much more, and in future  be able to have her own local beauty parlor and position herself securely in the market.  The greatest difficulty for her is the complicated transportation system in her city.

The loan will go to acquire beauty products (makeup, curling irons, sprays, hair creams, etc.) with which she can offer a higher quality service.

loans.use: to obtain beauty products such as maquillaje, curling irons, sprays,  hair creams, etc., for her business

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a smallholder farmer residing in Kusero village in Kenya. He is mainly involved in crop farming, but he also practices livestock farming. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Fredrick needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements so he can enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he faces is the lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Fredrick is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers, and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Fredrick acquire the agricultural inputs necessary for both a successful harvest and quality yields. 

Income from this investment will help Fredrick to meet his obligations as the head of his family and family business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, a single man dreaming of raising his business to up-country, is aged 32 years. He is a tailor who makes and repairs clothing of many types. He has been providing this service for 13 years. Actually, he started as laborer to other tailors and then later moved on to his own dream. 

Godfrey is doing great and wishes to grow his business wide. He has 3 tailoring machines and 1 overlock (mashine ya kudarizi). His business starts at 7am, and he finishes at 9pm each working day. 

Godfrey needs to improve his business, especially for the coming Idd al fitr, so he can supply more customers. To meet that demand, he approached Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva's field partner, to find financial support. 

This is Godfrey's first loan, and he will use it to buy materials to make clothing. He will be held accountable for repaying the loan. He will be so thankful to everyone who will find a way to support his business and life.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothing.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and married. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like candies, noodles, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, noodles, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. 

Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like candies, noodles, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María una mujer de 35 años de edad que ha encontrado en la venta de mercancía que desea tener un local comercial quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar productos, desea tener un plante ya que vende al contado y se queda sin abasto, en lo que piensa invertir es en la compra de ropa.

María es una madre soltera que con valentía y osadía genera el sustento para su familia conformada por dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad.

Su principal sueño es comprar una vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a 35 year old woman who has found through selling merchandise that she wants to have a commercial stand. She wants to request a loan to buy products. She wants to have a base as she sells on credit and has no stock. So what she is thinking of investing in is buying clothing.

María is a valiant and daring single mother who generates the sustenance for her family made up of two sons aged 8 and 6 years old.

Her main dream is to buy a house and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, etc., and continue with her business, which generates good earnings.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 40 años de edad, conviviente con 02 menores hijos, él y su familia viven en el caserío Playa Grande del distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Rodolfo se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.Adicionalmente cultiva café variedad catimor 1 ha de 3 años de edad, también se dedica a la comercialización de aguardiente, contando con 1 ha de caña de azucar de su propiedad.

El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de un ternero para su engorde y posterior venta así como para la compra fertilizantes para su cultivo de café. Con esto Rodolfo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 40 years old and lives with his two minor children. He and his family live in the village of Playa Grande in the district of Santo Tomás which is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.

Rodolfo works raising and selling cattle. His business is located at his house. He has ten years experience in the business and he has very good personal and work references from the area. He also grows one hectare of three year old Catimore varietal coffee. He also works selling aguardiente (sugar cane alcohol) having one hectare of sugar cane on his property.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy a calf to fatten and later sell as well as buying fertilizer for his coffee crops. Doing this Rodolfo hopes to offer a better product to his clients which will allow him to generate more income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf to fatten and later sell as well as buying fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Rosalba Maricela

texts.es: Rosalba tiene 39 años de edad es trabajadora habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas una de 17 años y 11 años de edad es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que perdió a su esposo ella es la que lucha a diario para sacar adelante a sus dos hijas en sus estudios. Ella tiene su negocio de una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como champú, detergentes, etc., el cual es su fuente de ingresos y es así como ella tiene el sustento del hogar. Rosalba desea terminar de instalar ladrillo de piso, puerta y ventana en su vivienda ya que sus ahorros no le fueron suficiente para terminar la mejora de su vivienda, por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, puerta, ventana, lámina y polines así les dará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijas y a la vez estarán mas seguras de cualquier peligro.
texts.en:
39-year-old Rosalba is hardworking and lives in her own home with her two daughters ages 17 and 11. She is an entrepreneurial woman that lost her husband. She works everyday to help her daughters continue their studies. She has a convenience store where she sells basic products such as shampoo, detergent, etc., which is her source of income. 

Rosalba wants to finish installing ceramic tiled floor, a door and a window in her home. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI as her savings were not sufficient for improving her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, a door, a window, a metal sheet and idlers, which will improve her daughters' living conditions and help them be more secure.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, a door, a window, a metal sheet and idlers, which will improve her daughters' living conditions.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David and his family live in a rural home in Kiromurok village in Kenya. His family is composed of himself, his wife and five children. He enjoys dairy farming for it is his livelihood and source of income. 

David started farming 30 years ago. Today, he is a pensioner who also relies on the sale of his products from dairy, poultry and tree farming. His highest annual expenses is school fees.   

Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his business over the years. He is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow, which will reproduce calves and produce more milk for him to sell. Income from this loan investment will help him repay his loan and elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a 44-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices the rearing, fattening and selling of cows; however, he also practices farming to earn extra income. 

He was inspired by the need of family sustainability. He faces a challenge of insufficient funds; however, he has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening and selling.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es: Cristina de 35 años desde la comodidad de su hogar provee artículos misceláneos, negocio que en sus inicios fue familiar, sin embargo le propuso a su suegra comprárselo y llevar las riendas de esta actividad.  Sus vecinos del barrio en el que reside al sur del municipio de Barranquilla, pueden realizar sus compras a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., un horario muy amplio para adquirir útiles escolares, productos de belleza, dulces y demás.  Cristina considera que lo más beneficioso de trabajar desde su casa es poder cumplir con sus quehaceres y estar cerca de sus hijos que son menores de edad y necesitan de su constante cuidado. Una estrategia para lograr mantenerse, es la facilidad de pago  que brinda a sus clientes, así mismo ofrece precios ajustados a sus necesidades.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir con nuevos diseños de ropa interior y prendas de vestir.  Esta inversión permitirá la reactivación de las ventas y estar más cerca de su meta familiar que es ofrecer estudios de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 35 years old. From the comfort of her own home, she sells miscellaneous items. In its beginnings, this was a family business, however she proposed to her mother-in-law that she buy it from her and take over the reins of the business. 

Her neighbors, in the neighborhood where she lives in the southern part of the municipality of Barranquilla, can make their purchases from 8:00am until 6:00pm, a schedule that is wide enough for people to buy school supplies, beauty products, sweets, and more. 

Cristina thinks that the best part of working from her house is that she can complete her chores and be close to her children, who are young and need constant care. One strategy that has helped her support herself is the ease of payment that she offers to her customers, offering them prices that are adjusted to their needs. 

Currently, she is applying for a "credikiva", her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to stock new designs of underwear and clothes. This investment will stimulate sales and allow her to get closer to achieving her family goal, which is to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: Stock new designs of underwear and clothes

loans.name: Otamurod

texts.ru: Отамурод из района Дж. Руми, трудолюбивый и миролюбивый человек. Ему 45 лет. Он женат и у него 3 детей. Он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот. Отамурод  с юных лет занимался животноводством. Это сфера деятельности является основным источником дохода для него и его семьи. Отамурод хочет увеличить поголовье своих скотов. У него есть свой капитал, однако этого не достаточно. Он надеется, что ему помогут, и он сможет, расширит свой бизнес и улучшит жизненные условия своей семьи.
texts.en:
Otamurod, from the J. Rumy region, is a hard-working and peace-loving person. He is 45 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He raises animals for a living, and breeds cattle. Otamurod has raised animals since his youth. This work is the primary source of income for him and his family. 

Otamurod wants to increase the number of livestock he has. He has some capital, but it is not enough. He hopes that he will be able to find help, and then he will be able to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to increase his headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
Maria, una campesina llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Caucasia, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 
Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 10 horas en distintas actividades, es una mujer rebuscadora e inquieta
texts.en:
Maria, a farmer full of dreams and aspirations in life, wants to support her family by the sweat of her brow.

She has started her business of raising pigs, a common profession in the municipality of Caucasia, which not only highlights the price but also the quality of the pigs that are raised there.

Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of pigs, which she will fatten for resale, with the intention to get ahead, and take care of her family who raises her fighter and powerful spirit.

she works hard every day for 10 hours in different activities for she is an entrepreneurial and full of energy woman.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, which she will fatten for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spices, bouillon cubes, beans, eggs, sugar, oil, etc. in order to meet the demand of products that her customers request.

loans.name: Paola Gabriela

texts.es: Paola es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde que su hijo era recién nacido ya que vio la necesidad de tener algún ingreso para poder darle lo indispensable a sus niño, ella hace su venta por catalogo, por pedidos y ofreciendo a sus clientes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para mejorar su negocio, la aspiración de Paola es aumentar su negocio y de ahí tener algo de ahorro para la educación de su hijo ya que esta asistiendo a la escuela.
texts.en: Paola is married and has one 4-year old son.  She has made her living selling clothing since her son was a newborn, as she saw a need to have some income to provide her son with the essentials.  Paola makes her sales via catalog orders, on order and selling directly to her customers.  She is going to invest her loan in purchasing more clothing merchandise so she can improve her business.  Paola's aspiration is to grow her busienss and with that have some savings for her son's education, as he does go to school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena works hard to support her family. Jena is married and has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Jena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Jena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bertha Luz Marina

texts.es: A sus 56 años Bertha es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo y 4 hijas de los cuales 3 de sus hijas aun están con ella, vive arrendando desde hace 38 años que reside en Ecuador, ya que es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana, ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan, pastas, galletas y demás productos de panadería, para luego ofrecerlos en los colegios y escuelas de la ciudad donde habita, el dinero del crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de harina y demás insumos para elaborar el pan, comenta que sus productos los elabora en un horno viejo que le presta una amiga y que así es como se gana la vida, lo que Bertha aspira es seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus ingresos y de ahí dar la educación a sus hijas.
texts.en: At her 56 years of age, Bertha is a single mother.  She has one son and four daughters, three of whom still live with her.  She has lived in a rental for the 38 years that she has been living in Ecuador;  Bertha is of Columbian nationality.  She earns her living making bread, pastas, cookies and other bakery items which she sells in the primary and secondary schools of her city.  Bertha will use the money from the loan to purchase flour and other supplies for making bread.  She says that she makes her products in an old oven that a friend lends to her, and that is how she earns her living.  Bertha hopes to continue working and improving her sales and to increase her income so she can give her daughters an education.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Slamet

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Slamet, one of Ruma's agents. Slamet lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java located about five hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his child. 

He sells mobile airtime credits for his community. Slamet joined Ruma in 2014. He knew Ruma from one of the sales executive who came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try to become an entrepreneur in technology, as well as increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Slamet sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Slamet improve his business and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. 

Slamet is the one who is seen in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his village community.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta tiene 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida desde hace 13 años. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce desde hace 14 años es bien solicita por sus clientes que lo consumen lo que desea tener un horno más grande ya que el que tiene ya esta deteriorado las latas con las que posee igual ya están en mal estado y poder comprar mas ya que tiene mucha demanda con sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: horno, latas, levadura, etc., para su panadería ya que este negocio que tiene es el que le genera sus ingresos económicos y así poder tener otra mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 57 years old. She has lived in her own house with her life partner for the past 13 years. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who, for the past 14 years, has made a living baking sweet bread. She is highly sought after by the customers that eat her bread.

She wishes to buy a larger oven, since the one that she currently has is deteriorated. Similarly, the pans that she has are in poor condition. She wants to buy more because she has a high demand from her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy an oven, pans, yeast, etc. for her bakery. This business that she has is what provides her with an income, allowing her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an oven, pans, yeast, etc. for her bakery.

loans.name: Junecelinda

texts.en:
Junecelinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Junecelinda is 52 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Junecelinda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food-production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Junecelinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food-production business

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus and his family live in a rural home in the Kisii area of Kenya. He and his newly married wife enjoy dairy farming, for it is their livelihood and source of income. Justus started farming eight years ago, and now he has two cows, eight head of poultry and a 1-acre garden full of tea and trees. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his home. 

Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to make significant strides in terms of growing and stabilizing his business. Today, he is confident enough to seek external financing to purchase a cow — an asset that will give him calves and more milk for sale.

Through your loan investment, Justus hopes to change his business trajectory and make enough income to elevate the living standards of his family that is just getting started.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Leza

texts.en:
Leza is 39 years old and has two children. Leza is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

Leza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Leza requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Leza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La Sra. Diana se encuentra estudiando actualmente la carrera en Licenciatura en Marketing.
Está trabajando como promotora de ventas en la empresa, y comenta que está casada y tiene 2 hijos, por quienes está luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Diana is currently studying for a career in marketing.  She works promoting sales in a business and notes that she is married and has two children,
for whom she is struggling.  Diana is asking for this loan to pay the fees for her studies and with it will be able to fight to improve her life.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, vive con su conyugue y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Isabel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como carneros, gallinas,ovejas,entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio; además tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, entre otras. Cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales, para su comercialización así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Isabel espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband and their two children in a rural area of the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly make a living in farming, livestock and commerce.

Isabel makes a living raising and selling small animals such as sheep and chickens among others. Her business is located at her home, and she also has a small store selling snacks, soft drinks and other items. She has been in the business for two years and has very good personal and professional references in her area. She is requesting the loan to purchase a larger stock of animals to later sell, and she also will purchase balanced feed for them. With this loan, Isabel hopes to offer a better product to her customers and generate more profits to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase more animals, as well as balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase creams, oils and other items.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Maria Olga tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus tres hijas en casa propia de material rústico en el Distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica al comercio y crianza de animales menores y ganado vacuno, así como a la agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en un vivero en el cual siembra diversas plantas como cedro, cipreses, entre otros, para luego venderlas, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de materiales de protección y herramientas de trabajo, con esto Maria Olga espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de plantas a sus clientes y un mejor servicio lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Olga is 31 years old. She is a single mother. She lives with her three daughters in her own house made of rustic materials in the Santo Tomás district, located in the Cutervo province within the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra. The people there make a living in trade, the raising of small animals and cattle, as well as agriculture.

Maria Olga makes a living in agriculture. She works in a nursery in which she cultivates a variety of plants such as cedar and cypress, among others, in order to sell them later. She counts on experience in the business and on very good personal and work references in the area.

The present loan will be used to buy protective materials and work tools. With this, Maria Olga hopes to offer a larger variety of plants to her customers and better service. This will help her improve her income level and therefore, improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy protective materials and work tools.

loans.name: Kouka

texts.fr:
Mme KOUKA est mariée et est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 27 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. Les 06 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 10 personnes en charge.
Madame fait l’élevage depuis 01 an. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les villes voisines.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de vivres pour les poulets, et 20 poussins.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Kouka is married and has six children. The eldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 11 years old. All six children study. She has 10 dependents. Kouka has been raising [poultry] for one year. She stocks up in nearby towns.

With her loan she would like to buy 10 bags of chicken feed and 20 chicks. She will use her revenues in order to grow her business. Kouka plans to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of chicken feed and 20 chicks.

loans.name: Aty Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Aty Pyahu está integrado  por  16 mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Eulalia, quien se dedica a las costuras, tiene un pequeño taller con el cual mantiene a su familia, y con ello lucha por darles una calidad de vida digna. Eulalia es una persona muy sacrificada que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: The Aty Pyahu consists of 16 women who are in the program to eliminate poverty. Each one of them puts forth their best effort to be able to help their families and loved ones. One of the members is Eulalia, who makes a living as a seamstress. She has a small shop with which she supports her family, and she fights every day to give them a better quality of life. Eulalia is a person who has sacrificed a lot and who is giving all she has to grow and succeed. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, thread, rubber, buttons and other sewing supplies so she can fulfill her customers' orders, and in this way she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, rubber, buttons and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, comenta que ya es un profesional recibido y que quiere seguir incrementando sus conocimientos, es por ello que está estudiando hoy didáctica universitaria, para poder enseñar en las universidades.
Juan es muy luchador, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de titulación de su curso de didáctica, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y luchar por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Ybycuí. He is already an educated professional but wants to continue increasing his knowledge which is why he is studying to teach at a university level. 

Juan is a tenacious and is requesting this loan to pay the tuition expenses for his teaching courses so that he can cover this cost and strive to improve every day.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Xiomara Lissette

texts.es:
Desde la adolescencia Xiomara aprendió a  hacer cojines, en el taller de  su mamá. Sin embargo, cuando su madre falleció ella se hizo cargo del negocio y logró ampliarlo. En la actualidad es un taller próspero y rentable  que tiene una amplia demanda en varios sectores de su comunidad. 

Por ello, solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, zíperes, encajes. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá incrementar la producción de cojines y  así incrementará las ventas. Con las ganancias planea mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara learned to make cushions in her mother's workshop when she was an adolescent. When her mother passed away she took over the business and managed to expand. Today it is a thriving and profitable workshop that has a great demand in various areas of her community. 

This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and lace. The loan will be helpful because she will be able to increase the production of cushions and increase her sales. With the earnings she is planning to make improvements to her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and lace.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Enea is 51 years old, married and takes care of four kids (two of his own and two from his sister). He has been running two businesses: making leather items where he buys leather from a shop and makes a variety of items (table covers, wallets, belts and shoes). and providing a pool table for people to play the game of pool, a service he introduced to raise income. Ten years is the period that Enea has been in this business, working from 8am to 8pm daily and he is able to make a very good profit each month.

This is his fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credits (paid back successfully) to buy two pool tables and a stock of leather. He made a profit, which he used to cover school fees and food for his family. Enea is doing great and dreams of improving his business and family needs.

He will invest part of his credit to buy a new pool table to service another center. He will share this credit with his group, Bahari, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new pool table to service his other center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items (noodles, sugar, canned goods and soap) to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Nicolasa

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hija de 24 años, y su negocio es la elaboración de alimentos naturales salados.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, generosa, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ Ubicado al noroeste de la ciudad, donde el comercio es la principal actividad, llegando a tener un movimiento económico superior a los 500 mil dólares por día. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Francisca es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con su  hija que es independiente, Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de alimentos secos, salados, como; habas, maní, plátano frito, maíz tostado, y otros, “inicie mi negocio vendiendo habas y maíz, posteriormente decidí elaborar mis propios productos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ella se encarga de toda la producción, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina freidora para la elaboración de plátano frito y papas fritas. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina freidora. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta. Actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina freidora para elaborar plátano frito y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 50 year old woman who is married and has one 24 year old daughter. Her business is the production of natural salted foods. 

She is a good mother, patient, generous, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the area 'Max Paredes' located northeast of the city. Commerce is the main activity there, reaching an economic flow of more than 500,000 dollars per day. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day from 0-12 degrees Celsius.  

Francisca is of dark complexion, with brown eyes and long black hair that she braids. She is short in stature, and is of robust physique. Her manner of dressing is traditional (sombrero, poncho, and traditional Andean skirt.) Her mother tongue is the Aymará that she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general public and in the business that she carries out. She shares her life with her husband who works in commerce and with her daughter who is independent. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and wood floor that has electricity, potable water, and a sewage system. 

Her business is the production of dry, salted foods like fava beans, peanuts, fried plantain, roasted corn, and other items. "I started my business selling fava beans and corn; later I decided to produce my own products..." she comments. The advantage of her business is that she is responsible for all of the production. The disadvantage is that she is missing a deep fryer for the production of fried plantains and fried potatoes. Her dream is to improve her business; she wants to accomplish buying a deep fryer. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has carried out this work. 

It is for these reasons that Francisca is seeking a loan to buy a deep fryer to produce fried plantain and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer to produce fried plantain and improve her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 52 years old, single, and has a snack vending business in Larena, Siquijor. This is how she supports herself with a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. 

Recently, Maria availed a loan to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing and "amakan" (weaved bamboo strips) for the walling of her simple house. She wants to improve her living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her housing upgrades.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda has a collection of ornamental garden plants in her backyard. She finds pleasure in gardening and she is able to earn income for her family through gardening. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help amounting to PHP 14,900 to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Nilda wishes to become the supplier of flowers for the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy and his family live in a rural home in Siongiroi village in Kenya. He enjoys dairy farming for it provides his family with a livelihood and source of income. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his home. Most of the money that he generates from milk sales is used on basic household expenses.

Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years. He is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used by Sammy to buy an additional dairy cow, which will reproduce calves and produce more milk for him to sell.

Your loan will help Sammy grow his business and the income from the dairy farm will help him to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 49 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Ma. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, toothpaste, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Lourdes would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is a graduating student who is supported by his mother. He is a full-fledged member of PMPC under the SEAL Program (Student Education Assistance Loan) and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, he applied for a loan to fully pay his tuition fee. He is positive that through this program of PMPC, he can graduate from his course and live a comfortable life in the near future.

loans.use: to fully pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 46 years old, is a married weaver with five children, only three of whom are in her care, and she lives in the province of Takeo, Cambodia. She has been doing this work since 2010. Two of her children are married and live in their own houses, one is a factory worker and two others are in school. Vanna, her child and her husband can make USD 18.5 each day. She is now applying for a loan to buy farmland to cultivate rice. This is her second loan with Kiva. With the first loan, she bought a plot of farmland but she used the land to build a house for her child who has already gotten married. With this loan, she will have enough funds to buy the farmland and grow rice crops to support the family. Vanna’s plans are to expand her weaving, build a new house and support her children to earn high school diplomas, and if possible, bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old and has three children. Maribel is married, and two of her children are currently in school.

Maribel is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Maribel has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn, 27, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mailyn has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mailyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas lives in Maliana, and she has very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2005, with her own working capital of $100, and she makes her best on it. She is earning good money from her business. 

Now she is taking this loan. She wants to use it to improve her business, so she took a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store, including onions, garlic, nuts, and other things to sell. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, nuts, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона приобритела желаемую машинку, и она очень рада. Она успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Марчона уже 6 лет продвигает свою работу.  У нее постоянная работа, и имеет больше клиентов. Она помогает родителям обеспечить семью. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход. Марчона любить свою работу, потому что она имеет постоянный  доход. Она решила расширить свою деятельность. И собирается взять кредит, и приобрести швейные принадлежности. Марчона верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Marjona purchased the intended sewing machine and she is very happy. She successfully paid her previous loan.

Marjona has been advancing her business for six years already. She has permanent work and more customers. She helps her parents provide for the family. She likes the daily income of the sewing business. Marjona loves her work because it gives her a permanent income.

Marjona decided to expand her business and take a loan. She will purchase sewing accessories. Marjona trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to purchase sewing accessories

loans.name: Maleha

texts.en:
Maleha is a 40-year-old married woman from Yata, a village near Hebron city. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income due to the demand. Maleha started her own business two years ago, which is a barn for raising sheep. She sells their products in the local market.

Maleha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her barn. This will increase her productivity and also her income.

Maleha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a farmer and salesperson from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He does dairy and maize farming for a living, but also generates additional income by brokering cereal produce: He aggregates cereal produce from local farmers at a fair price and sells to his network of buyers at a higher price. 

Given that Isaac is connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock a large volume of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers which he will later sell at a higher price, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices. 

Income from this investment will help Isaac generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Mary Annabel

texts.en:
Mary Annabel is a farmer from Larena. She took another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount of 3,000 PHP as additional capital for land and seedbed preparation.  

Mary Annabel perseveres and always believes in reaching for her goal to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elma is 49 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Elma has a Cignal prepaid load business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more prepaid load for her Cignal business.

Elma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid load for her Cignal business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Maliana and she is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop selling second hand clothes and she also sells in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more second hand clothes such as short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, a jacket, a turtleneck shirt and other clothes to sell. Maria has been involved in business activities since 2010. She started with her own working capital of $100. She is earning a good income from selling her second hand clothes because many people like to buy them. So she is still happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run her business in a bigger store. She also has animals like pigs and goats.

loans.use: to buy short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, a jacket, a turtleneck shirt and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group
