texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is 43 years old, is married and has five daughters who are at school. She is a primary teacher, but also runs a business of honey that she buys from up country. She has a business helper who normally sells her stock door to door. Her business starts at 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will share this credit with her group, Pilika Pilika, which consists of five women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Elizabeth dreams to improve her business by having a premises where she can put her stock for selling. 

She will be so thankful with everyone who will support her business and family. 

She will invest part of her credit to buy more gallons of honey to resell as demand raises more.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of honey to resell.

loans.name: Floricel

texts.en:
Floricel comes from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is 36 years old and happily married to Ricardo, a driver. They are blessed with two children, one of whom is in High School and the other one is still in the Elementary Level. The couple works hard to provide well for their children's schooling and for their everyday needs.

Floricel, being a business-minded woman who wants to give the best to her children, has been operating two businesses for four years already. She has a small general store by her house that sells essentially food items such as coffee, instant chocolate drink, milk powder, cereals, eggs, powered juice and frozen processed food. She also has a tricycle unit that her husband drives. The tricycle is a common form of transportation in towns like General Trias. Few people have their own cars and a tricycle is usually used for short-distance trips from their house to churches, to the town market, plaza or to their friend's house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 900 a day.

To help her continue operations of her store, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages and frozen food. Although there are competitors around her area, she makes sure that she always has the essential food items all the time to better serve her customers. Part of the loan she will use to buy another tricycle unit. Being in a busy commercial area, she sees the need to add one more unit of tricycle to serve more passengers. She is thanking God and you in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

Floricel dreams of having a big grocery store. Her simple dream is to see all her children go to college and become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and frozen food to sell and partly to buy another tricycle unit.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and fish vending. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 35 years old and married with four children. With three of her children currently in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, tissue paper, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, tissue paper, candies, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, tissue paper, candies, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Liliam es madre de dos niños y junto a su esposo se encarga de llevar ingresos económicos a su hogar. Ella es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora, pues desde hace un par de año inició un negocio de venta de ropa en general, con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior.  

Ella es consiente que se deben aprovechar todas la oportunidades  para crecer como negocio. Por ello, aprovecha las ferias de pymes para ofrecer sus productos. Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar camisas, camisetas, pantalones, shorts, vestidos, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Liliam is a mother to two children. Alongside her husband, Liliam earns an income to support her household. Liliam is strong and enterprising. A couple of years ago she started a business selling clothes using the payoff from a previous job.

Liliam is aware that she must take advantage of every opportunity so that her business may grow. To do so, Liliam goes to the markets to sells her products. 

Liliam is applying for a loan in order to buy shirts, t-shirts, trousers, shorts, dresses and more. This loan will help Liliam to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, trousers, shorts and dresses.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una persona que esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser alguien en la vida  así abrirse camino en el mundo profesional, comenta que su anterior préstamo le fue de mucha ayuda y pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para cubrir nuevamente sus cuotas y de esa forma seguir luchando por cumplir con sus metas y anhelos. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana is a person who is putting in everything of herself to be able to be someone in life and in this way make her way in the professional world, she comments that her earlier loan was of great help to her and she was able to pay the fees for her studies. 

Today she is again asking for this loan to again cover her fees and in this way keep fighting to fulfill her goals and aspirations. She expresses her appreciation for this new opportunity that she receives to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay university fees

loans.name: Gabriela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gabriela siempre se ha caracterizado por ser persevante y audaz. Inició un negocio de tapicería cuando era joven y con tiempo comenzó un taller de producción de maletines y forros para libros, gracias a la ayuda de su esposo y el apoyo de MiCrédito que le ha facilitado un serie de créditos para comprar materiales de trabajo.  En la actualidad, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo. 

Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar cuero, hilos, zíperes, pega, papel, etc. Esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá entregar los pedidos a tiempo, en consiguiente aumentará sus ingresos. Gabriela, planea incrementar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabriela has always been persevering and brave. She started an upholstery business when she was young and, after some time, opened a workshop making briefcases and book covers thanks to the help of her husband and the support of MiCrédito, which has provided a number of loans for buying materials. Gabriela now has many customers because of the quality of her work.

Gabriela is applying for a new loan, however, in order to buy leather, threads, zips, glue and paper. This loan will be a great help for Gabriela as she will be able to fulfill customer orders on time and increase her income. 

Gabriela wants to increase sales and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy leather, threads, zips, glue and paper.

loans.name: Jephiter

texts.en:
Jephiter is a farmer and salesperson from the Nyamira area of Kenya. He practices dairy, poultry and tree farming for a living. On his four-acre farm, he has three dairy cows, 20 head of poultry, tea and 3,000 trees. On the side, he runs a grain mill and a butchery, which are value additions to his primary activities.

To maximize profit from cereals, he not only relies on his yields but also aggregates that of local farmers. Once he has enough cereal stock, he processes the grains into flour, breaks bulk, packages the final product and then sends the packages into the market.

Given that Jephiter is connected, and therefore, can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock large volume of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers, which he will later sell at a higher price, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices.

Income from this investment will help Jephiter generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs and grow his business further.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: La Chispa  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la  ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito La Chispa. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Sara, tiene 39 años  de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de años de 17 y 14  años de edad, el mayor esta por ingresar a la universidad y el menor en colegio. Su marido es agente vendedor.
Doña Sara es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos  se dedica  al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, tiene unas vitrinas en su casa en las cuales exhibe sus prendas al público, ella también una vez por semana sale a vender y a cobrar lo que deja a crédito ya que ella vende al contado y a crédito, lleva más de 2 años dedicada a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones y ropa de niños. Este es su primer crédito en el Grupo y le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita, the "La Chispa" loan group meets every fortnight. The members of La Chispa work in a variety of businesses, including general trade, services and more. On realising the benefits of working with Fundación ESPOIR, the group members decided some time ago to come together and create this loan group. The group has helped the members to improve their businesses a lot.

One member of the group, Sara, is 39 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 17 and 14 years old; the eldest is about to start university while the youngest goes to high school. Sara's husband is a salesman.

Sara is a housewife but, in order to earn her own income and help her husband with household costs and raising their children, works selling all types of clothes. Sara has display cases in her house where she shows off her products to the public. Once a week, Sara also goes out to sell her products and collect payments (Sara sells for both cash and on credit). Sara has been doing this work for two years.

This loan will be used to buy shirts, blouses, trousers and children's clothes. This is Sara's first loan as part of the group but she likes that the loans are provided quickly. Sara's dreams are for her children to finish their studies and learn a profession.

The small photo is of two group members who could not come to the meeting when the main photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, trousers and children's clothes.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 45-year-old married mother of four children. She started three years ago selling vegetables and fruits to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is an ambitious lady and hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with summer fruits and vegetables to satisfy her customers' needs in this holy month of Ramadan.

Hind hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with summer fruits and vegetables in this holy month of Ramadan.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de la carrera de Psicología; vive en casa de sus padres y está cursando la carrera para así llegar a obtener buenos ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Al terminar su carrera se ve trabajando en una empresa privada hasta adquirir mucha experiencia y  luego  montar una oficina.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura is studying psychology. She lives with her parents and is studying this in order to earn a good income and help her family.
When she finishes her degree she sees herself working in a private company until she gains a lot of experience and then she will open an office.
She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her fees and to be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sartawi Jalsuri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTAWI JALSURI” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Matilde es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche y queso, venta de chuño, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, venta de papa, venta de dulces, venta de mantas, venta de masitas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Matilde es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche y queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermano,  hace tres años. 

El crédito que sacara será para la compra de una vaca lechera que lo adquirirá de la feria de Pocota, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar su capital en la venta de leche y queso. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
C.F. SANTIAGO II
texts.en:
The communal bank "SARTAWI JALSURI" is starting its sixth Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Cascada Social Center.  The group consists of eight members and their management team is led by Matilde, the president.  The members are involved in different businesses which include sales of milk and cheese, freeze-dried potato, coca leaves, potatoes, sweets, blankets, pastries and a grocery store.

The loan will benefit small business owners, including Matilde who is in her fifth year of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation through a representative of the institution.  Her business now is selling milk and cheese which she learned from her brother three years ago.

She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow at the Pocota fair.  This will help her increase milk and cheese production since she earns a living this way to support her family economically.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the health training area offered by the institution C.F. SANTIAGO II.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Machak Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHAK SARTAWI” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yhenny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de limpieza, venta de regalos, venta de zapatos, venta de cereales, venta de guantes, venta de mantillas, venta de comida, venta de gorros, venta de mandiles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yhenny es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia desde hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de productos de limpieza por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "MACHAK SARTAWI" is starting its seventh Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Panamericana Social Center.  It consists of nine members and its management team is led by Yhenny, the president.  The group members are involved in different business activities including sales of cleaning products, gifts, shoes, cereals, gloves, shawls, food, hats and aprons.

The loan will benefit small business owners including Yhenny who says she joined Pro Mujer by invitation through a friend of hers who is a customer of the institution.  Her current business is selling cleaning products.  She learned the trade on her own several years ago.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital so she can buy cleaning products, wholesale.  She will buy them from wholesale dealers in the city of El Alto and then sell them at her stall.  Through her work she has been able to support her family economically.  She has a common-law husband and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products, wholesale.

loans.name: Aguilas De Chaguaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE CHAGUAYA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado, venta de abarrotes, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por necesidad hace tres años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “AGUILAS DE CHAGUAYA” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer. The group is part of the Achacachi regional office and is made up of 8 members. It is led by a board of directors where Alicia is the Secretary. The members of the communal bank have a variety of jobs: including: Selling vegetables, selling food, running a local store, selling fish, selling groceries and working in transport services. 

The loan will help owners of small businesses like Alicia. She describes how she was introduced to Pro Mujer through a friend who is one of the institution's clients. She now has her own business selling food which she started three years ago out of necessity.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital by allowing her to buy noodles and rice wholesale from wholesale merchants in city of El Alto and then later selling these products herself. This job allows her to earn enough to support her family financially, which is important especially considering that she is a single mother to two children.      

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training opportunities that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy noodles and rice wholesale.

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GARDENIAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Santusa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de material escolar, servicio de transporte, venta de buzos, venta de chamarras, venta de jugo de frutas, venta de pantalones, venta de queso.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Santusa es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando como ayudante en la confección de polleras y mantas hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones  que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aperecen nueve personas pero la persona que viste de chamarra negra es el asesor de la asociación comunal
texts.en:
The communal bank "GARDENIAS" is starting its first Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Alto Lima Social Center.  The group consists of eight members and its management team is led by Santusa, the president.  The group members are involved in different business activities including sales of skirts, school supplies, transport services, overalls, jackets, fruit juice, pants and cheese.

The loan will benefit small business owners including Santusa.  She says she joined Pro Mujer by invitation through a friend who is a customer of the institution.  Her current business is selling skirts and she learned the business while working as a sewing assistant making skirts and blankets several years ago.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital so she can buy fabric wholesale from dealers in the city of El Alto.  Later, she will make and sell her products at her stall.  This work has allowed her to support her family economically.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is is the health area and training offered by the institution.

The nine members of the group are present in the photo.  The man in the black jacket is the communal bank's advisor.

loans.use: To buy fabric, wholesale.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda continua con sus estudios en ingeniería agronoma, esta estudiando y se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo ya que ellos siempre le han sido un apoyo muy grande. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, lo cual le fue muy útil.
Pide hoy nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Brenda continues to study agronomic engineering. She is studying and making the effort to be able to give her family everything as they have always been a great support to her. She sais that she used her last loan to be able to pay for her fees which was very useful to her.
Now she is again asking for this loan to be able to pay her fees and to be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en: Iskandar is a careful father. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. He is living in a big busy city with his family. He is married and has one child. He works at a government agency on projects of reconstruction and completion of secondary schools. He wanted to educate his son at a university.  Recently, his son has been studying abroad in Riga and needs money for living and also for paying his tuition fee for his studies. Iskandar appealed to IMON asking for financial support to pay the higher education costs of his son. He wishes to be supported and awaits your compassion. He is proud of his son and hopes to see him as a good specialist helping his society in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education in Riga

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco siempre ha aprovechado las oportunidades de trabajo que se le presentan, por eso hace más de 13 años decidió emprender un negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta aprovechando la demanda de los pobladores de su comunidad. Pero con el tiempo la competencia aumento y decidió iniciar a sembrar arroz, con la ayuda de sus hermanos, lo cual le ha generado jugosas ganancias. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para la compra de  fertilizantes, semillas, gasolina, abono y demás insumos que le permitirán mejorar la calidad de su siembra, esto a la vez le ayudará a aumentar sus ganancias. Entre los planes de Francisco esta adquirir un terreno para continuar sembrando.
texts.en:
Francisco always has taken advantage of any work opportunities that have come his way.  So 13 years ago he decided to start his own business selling bicycle spare parts because of the demand in his community.  But over time competition increased and he decided to start growing rice, with the help of his brothers, which has generated a good profit.

Nevertheless, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, gasoline, manure and other supplies to make his crop better.  This will help increase profits.  Francisco's goals include purchasing land to continue his crop activity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, gasoline, manure, etc.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es de una familia humilde y trabajadora, está en el quinto año de la carrera de administración de empresas, y comenta que quiere recibirse para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Federico está esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Federico is from the city of Caaguazú. He is from a modest and hard working family. He is in the 5th year of a degree in business administration and he sais that he wants to graduate in order to be able to be someone in life. Federico is exerting himself in order to improve his living conditions and those of his family. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay his university fees and to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, es una persona que se esfuerza y esta luchando para poder salir adelante y ser un profesional exitoso, que pueda abrirse camino en la vida profesional. comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Fabiana is studying a law degree. She is a person who makes an effort and is fighting to be able to get ahead and be a successful professional and make her way in her professional life. She sais that because of her last loan she was able to pay her university fees.
Now she is asking for another loan t be able to pay for the fees of her course and with this be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Marvin Leonardo

texts.es:
Más de 7 años tiene Marvin de dedicarse a la siembra de arroz, negocio que aprendió cuando trabajaba en una empresa arrocera, inició la siembra con ahorros propios y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas ha ampliado el terreno de siembra. Él se siente muy agradecido con Dios porque ha tenido buenas cosechas. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito comprar semillas, galones de diésel, abono, pesticidas, y demás insumos que le permitirán sembrar satisfactoriamente. A la vez, podrá aumentar sus ganancias, con las que ampliará el terreno de siembra. Entre los planes de Marvin esta comprar ganado y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
For over seven years Marvin has been growing rice which he learned about while working for a rice company.  He started his activity with his own savings and thanks to the profits earned he has been able to expand his cropland.  He is very grateful and thanks God for the good harvests.

Nevertheless, he is requesting a loan to buy seeds, gallons of diesel fuel, manure, pesticides and other supplies to allow him to do a satisfactory planting job.  This will also increase his profits so he can expand his land.  Marvin's plans include buying livestock and renovating his home.

loans.use: To buy seeds, gallons of diesel fuel, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “8 DE DICIEMBRE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marlenny es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cerveza, venta de ganado ovino, venta de pan, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de repuesto para moto, venta de leche.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marlenny es integrante, ella indica ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de un asesor de crédito de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus papás hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "8 de Diciembre" ["8th of December"] will enter into the second financing round from Pro Mujer ["Pro-Woman"], as part of the Copacabana Focus Center, which is composed of nine members and is directed by a board where Mrs. Marlenny is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal association bring forward are varied between them: beer sales, sheep sales, bread sales, a neighborhood store, food sales, motorcycle parts sales, and milk sales.

The loan that they take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, of which Mrs. Marlenny is a member. She indicates her admission to Pro Mujer was by the invitation of a credit counselor of the institution. At present, she has a business selling bread. She makes known that she learned this business from her parents over several years.

The loan that she will take now is for raising capital to buy flour wholesale, which she will purchase from El Alto city wholesalers and, subsequent to preparation, she will sell it in her stall. This type of work enables her to build a means to support her family financially, as she lives with her domestic partner and has a son already.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale.

loans.name: Zaytuna

texts.ru:
Зайтуна 39 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Зайтуна 3.5 года своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее мама работала именно в этой сфере деятельности. И мама научила ее правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес.
   Муж Зайтуны дехканин. Он занимается земледелием. Старший сын тоже занимается торговлей деятельностью. Младший сын школьник. Зайтуна занимается продажей детских футболки, детские платье и разной другой одежды. Зайтуна решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Она надеется с увеличением товара, увеличится доход и может улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en:
Zaytuna is 39 years old, and is a mother of two. Zaytuna has spent 3.5 years of her life in trade. She decided to go into this because her mother worked in this area. Her mother taught her how to communicate well with clients and conduct business.
Zaytuna's husband is a farmer, and works in arable farming. Their oldest son also helps with the trade. Their youngest son is at school. Zaytuna sells children's T-shirts, dresses and other different items of clothing. She decided to expand her work, and increase her stock. She hopes that an increase in goods will lead to an increase in income, which could improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To transport women's clothes, in order to increase turnover.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Мавжуда. Ей 34 лет. Она жительница района Шахритус. Мавжуда замужем и имеет двоих детей. Детям 3 и 2 года. Мавжуда работает в сфере сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на своем не большом участке земли. Она посеяла урожай и теперь необходимо обработать почку минеральными удобрениями. На достаточное количество удобрений ей не хватает денег, и решила обратиться к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en: The woman in the photograph is called Mavjuda. She is 34, and a resident of the city of Shahrituz. Mavjuda is married, and has two children aged 3 and 2. Mavjuda works in the field of agriculture, and grows crops on her small plot of land. She sowed her harvest and now it is necessary to propagate the plants with mineral fertilizer. She does not have enough money for a sufficient amount of fertilizer. and has decided to turn to you for a loan.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee. Seven years ago, he opened his computer shop where he repairs and sells computers. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation in his area.

Mohammad is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with new collection of laptops, accessories, and spare parts to satisfy his customers' needs and provide them with better service.
Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new collection of laptops, accessories and spare parts

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en:
Hosiyat is a funny woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is married and has four children. She studied accountancy and recently works with a major government agency. She is a chief accountant and earns enough money to ensure her family with everyday expenditures as food and clothing. 

She wants to ensure her son with a good education at school. She is willing to pay her son’s gymnasium school. She hopes to educate and train her child. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son’s gymnasium school

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is 46 years old, married and had five children. She and her husband are farmers planting and harvesting rice to sell. They had been in the farming business for over 20 years now. She is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor fees in farming. This will help nourish her crops to attain good harvest someday. She will also pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor fees in farming

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 30 years old and married with one child.  

Marivic is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marivic has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marivic would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land to cultivate for a better business income

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is the age of 28, living with her single child and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a workshop, where he provides services to his clients in the form of creating sheltering materials. He has been running this shop for the last seven years.  He manages his household necessities from his own shop as well. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His  shop is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well.

For the last few days, he ran out of inventories. So, he wants to buy some wooden plank, nails, and bamboo to continue his services smoothly. Therefore, Tasleem has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost for buying the inventory. This will help him to continue his business.Tasleem is so much thankful to kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks, nails and bamboo for her husband's sheltering work.

loans.name: Pheladi

texts.en:
Pheladi is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute  and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
Yes, Sci (science of creative intelligence) and English and Business Ethics ii8and Business Fundamental.
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
Get a decent job in Marketing, while working I will save enough money to establish my own beauty company. I’d like to work in Johannesburg or Cape Town. I’d like to travel probably during the holidays
3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born and bred in Mpumalanga province in a town called Bushburgridge. I am the only child on my mother's side, but my father does have other children, and they were separated when I was 14 years old. My mother works as a domestic worker and as for my father, he is somewhere in Mpumalanga working as a Bricklayer; but we don’t have a good relationship. I am not married, but I do have a 9 year old child.
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I Watch Television, Read the bible, listen to music and do meditation.
5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: Will there be significant changes?
My life would change drastically as I am finding it really difficult to pay my school fees and I sometimes stay at home during school days due to not having transport money to get to school and it affects my studies because I get left behind with my lesson. Kiva loan will take some of the financial burden away and I can start paying for my fees.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 2 детей. У Сабиры - высшее образование, она на протяжении многих лет работает в школе учителем, заработная плата составляет 8,300 сом (KGS) в месяц. Сабира решила отремонтировать дом и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку окон, краски. Доходы Сабира планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Sabira is 51 years old, married, and together with her partner has raised 2 children. Sabira has a higher education, and has worked as a school teacher for many years. Her monthly pay is approximately 8,300 som (KGS). Sabira decided to repair her house and turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase windows and paint. With this income, Sabira plans to invest in the further improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy windows and paint for repairing her house.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, y comenta que a la par que estudia también trabaja con sus padres, y así se ayudan.
Su meta es poder culminar sus estudios y poder ejercer su profesión para poder salir adelante. Él es una persona muy emprendedora que lucha y se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de escuela, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios y cumplir su meta.
texts.en: Joaquin lives in the city of Ybycuí. He is studying accounting and administrative sciences, and at the same time, he also works with his parents. That way, they help each other out. His goal is to finish his studies and to purse his occupation in order to move forward. He is a very entrepreneurial person, who fights and makes a big effort to get ahead. He is asking for this loan in order to cover his school costs, and in this way continue his studies and fulfill his ambition.

loans.use: to cover school-related costs.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is a careful woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in remote district with her family. She is divorced. When she got divorced she started to do business in order to live. She is tailoring Tajik traditional women dresses at home. She likes her activity and has permanent clients each day. She is working almost 8 years. Here photo of her that shows how she gets orders and measures client’s size for sewing a dress. 

She needs to get treatment in hospital and be healthy. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay treatment fees at hospital. She hopes to be supported and be healthy to continue her activity.

loans.use: to pay treatment fees at hospital

loans.name: Anicia

texts.en:
Anicia is 46 years old and is from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Her being a single parent is not easy but through God's grace she is able to overcome the challenges that goes with being a single mom. She has dedicated herself in raising her only child who is still in the elementary level in school.  

Anicia is thankful that she has a general store business that really help her earn to provide for their daily sustenance. A general store in the Phils. is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Anicia did not let the unfortunate incident she experienced deter her from becoming self-sufficient and successful in life.

To help her expand operations of her store she is requesting a Php 19000 loan which she to buy several kilos of "tinapa"( steamed salted fish), a favorite Filipino breakfast, and vegetables such as cabbage, potatoes, carrots, radish, eggplant, ginger, bitter gourd and other native veggies and also coffee, biscuits, powdered milk and juice to sell at her store.  She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Although there are times that it's difficult to collect payment from those who buy on credit she is still encouraged that her sales is good and has increased this year. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily needs and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her.

Anicia aims to expand her store to serve more customers. Her only dream is to see her only child get a College Education and be a professional someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for food items like instant noodles, coffee, eggs, beverages, biscuits,  veggies and "tinapa" (steamed salted fish) to sell at her store.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Sabina who is aged late thirties, married and has a boy and girl who are in school. She has been running a hardware and animal feeding shop. She has been in this business for four years now, working from 09am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her third credit request which she will used to buy hardware stock and animal feeding to resell. She used the previous loans, paid back successful, to buy animal feeds and hardware inventories. She earned profit which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. Her dream is to expand her shop. 

She will share this loan with her group, NZASA, consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware stock and animal feeding to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Flordeliza

texts.en:
Ma. Flordeliza is 46 years old, from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Life in the Philippines is quite hard and most families struggle to make ends meet. Being a strong business minded woman she does her best to earn as much as she can to provide for her high school daughter. She did not let her being separated from her husband prevent her from being a hardworking and loving mother. 

Flordeliza is grateful that God has blessed her with a general store for five years already. It has been her source of income to support their daily needs. She buys from wholesaler essential food items such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, beverages, toiletries and sells them at retail price. She also sells snacks like fish balls and hamburgers to augment her income. Although there are days that sales is low she still maintains a positive attitude that she will earn more in other days.

To help her expand operations of her store she is requesting a Php 10000 loan to buy large quantities of grocery items to add to her store and beef patties, fish balls, oil, buns as well for her snacks business.  She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial aid that will be given her. Her earnings is a big help to cover her and her daughter's daily sustenance.

Ma. Flordeliza prays that God will bless her efforts with success. She also desires good health for her and her daughter. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Sabeniana

texts.en:
Sabeniana works hard to support her family. Sabeniana is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Sabeniana requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Sabeniana has been in this business for 5 years now.

Sabeniana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and married with five children.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Kanyshai

texts.ru: Канышай, 48 лет, замужем, у нее 4 сыновей. На протяжении 20 лет, Канышай занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 30 овец, 3 лошади. Канышай продает экологически чистое молоко на ежедневной основе. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 21,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от проекта она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Kanyshai is 48 years old, and married with 4 sons. Over the course of 20 years, Kanyshai has worked in animal husbandry. Today on her farm there are 6 cows, 30 sheep and 3 horses. Kanyshai sells organic milk on a daily basis. Her monthly profit is around 21,000 som (KGS). She turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale. With income from the loan she will invest in the further development of the business.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Naveed

texts.en:
28 year old Naveed is a passionate school owner. He started a low cost private school in 2009.  Today the school enrollment has reached 211 students 43% of which are girls. 

Naveed wants to purchase a UPS to power fans in classrooms that are unbearable in the severe heat. He also wishes to purchase school furniture to accommodate more students from the community. For this purpose he has requested for a loan worth PKR 110,000.

loans.use: to purchase a UPS to power fans in classrooms along with school furniture to accommodate more students

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase her clothing in bulk

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 38-year-old married father of two children. He has been employed for eighteen years ago in a company to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his family's living conditions. 

Due to his limited salary, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his daughter's school tuition fees. This loan will build a better future for his daughter. Rabih hopes to stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's school tuition fees

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena está estudiando la carrera de profesorado en educación básica, está en el tercer año de su carrera. A la vez que estudia también está trabajando y lucha por poder salir adelante.
Su meta es terminar sus estudios y trabajar para así poder ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Lorena is studying to become a primary school teacher. She is in her third year of university. While she studies, she is also working and making an effort to get ahead. Her goal is to finish her degree and work in order to support her parents financially.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay for tuition fees, and in that way continue with her studies, while fighting to improve her life every day.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, proviene de una familia de 8 miembros, es levantador de pedidos en una empresa distribuidora de productos dulces, y a la vez estudia la carrera de contabilidad.
Su mayor deseo es ser un profesional exitoso. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Daniela is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She comes from a family of 8. She is an order collector in a distributing company which sells sweet products. At the same time she studies an accountancy degree.
Her biggest wish is to be a successful professional. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have brought and is asking for a loan to be able to pay for the fees of her course and with this be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his early 40s, is married with five children who are still at school. He has been running a general store since 2006. He works from 6 a.m.to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Charles' seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the general store stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, rented a farm to grow crops and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more stock for the general store. He dreams of leading a better life. 

Charles will share this loan with his loan group "Mbayuwayu"which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the general store in order to lead a better ;life

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah has a 3 acre farm in Kilibwoni village in North-rift Kenya, where she lives with her family. She keeps 3 dairy cows, 40 heads of poultry, 200 trees and a 3 acre crop farm. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home. She started farming 3 years ago and through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint for Lonah is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 
With your lending, Lonah will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds, fertilizers and weed and pest control systems

loans.name: Kemunto

texts.en:
Kemunto is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Kenyenya area of Kenya, where she is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Kemunto gets help with the work from her husband and children. 

Kemunto is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. With your loan investment, her farm animals will housed to protect them from harsh weather conditions, such as extreme heat, and for easier management of the herd. This intervention will result in improved health and dairy management, both keys to having a highly productive dairy farm. 
Income resulting from this intervention will be used to clear loan repayments and meet her family’s basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed to protect her cattle from harsh weather conditions

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 43 yrs. old and is from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Alvin, a tricycle driver and has three children of which of which one is in College and the other two are still in the elementary level in school. The couple both work to provide for their daily needs and school needs of their children.

Cherry operates a small variety store for eight years already. She does not allow poverty in the Philippines to hinder them from improving their lives. Aside from her small store she also has a tricycle unit which her husband drives. A tricycle carries around four passengers. In the Philippines, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited in some areas. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes  to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 900 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 50000 loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. Part of the loan she will use to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient and safe service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her since it will greatly help sustain their needs especially her children's educational needs.

Cherry's simple dream is to see her three children go to College and become professional someday. She aims to work harder to give her family the best in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and partly for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
20 year old married Asia aspired to be a teacher since childhood. After her graduation she taught for a few years and then opened a small school in her city. Today the school provides education to 131 students 41% of which are girls. She wants a loan of PKR.100,000 to buy furniture (desks, chairs, white board) and computers to set up a mini computer lab. 

Her mission is to develop her school and provide students with better learning facilities. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy furniture (desks, chairs, white board) and computers to set up a mini computer lab in her school

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 30,000 which she bought 10 sacks of rice, 1 box of noodles, 1 box of canned goods and biscuits as additional items she now selling in her store. Ma. Victoria store is doing well and her rice products were patronized by her customers specially mothers doing the cooking for their children packed lunch. Her income increased and was able to pay her loan on time. The revenue of her income helps with their daily expenses and schooling of her child. 

Today Ma. Victoria continue to operates her business and wanted to expand her store. She started to sell electronics to her store (USB flask drive and memory card) and most of their customers are students near their area, since today, computers are used by students for school projects and memory card the are much needed for saving data and because its school days, Ma. Victoria electronic became popular with students.

Ma. Victoria is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 35,000 to buy 50 pieces memory card, 50 pieces usb flask drive, 50 pieces portable speaker to start her electronic store beside her sari-sari store (grocery store). 

Ma. Victoria is confident that with the loan she will be able to supply the demand of her customers and increase her income more to provide for her family.

Ma. Victoria also plans to hire a helper from her community to operate her electronic store and because of this Ma. Victoria is now on our Small Enterprise where in she is now able to provide employment to others.

loans.use: To buy 50 pieces memory card, 50 pieces usb flask drive, 50 pieces portable speaker to start her electronic store.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is a 32 years old married man, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives with his wife and 2 school-aged sons. Grigol and his wife were unable to start any stable job. Grigol's father helps the family to meet even basic needs and shirk with their poverty. The help isn't enough to address all the daily costs and increased-needs of a 4 members-family. 

According to above mentioned situation, Grigol lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, he joined The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo, which enabled Grigol to get a loan of 700 USD. With the received credit, Grigol will open a traditional Georgian bakery in his house and start baking bread. He will then supply local restaurants and will generate his own income. 

He is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his children with good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Grigol is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income and tackle with the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a bakery and supply restaurants with traditional Georgian bread

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en: Matrida is 23 years old and lives with her parents in the Iringa district. She wishes to run a small retail shop and is requesting a loan in order to launch her retail shop near her home. She plans to use the profit she earns to pay her sister’s school fees. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions with students at her local high school. She covers topics such as active citizenship and personal confidence. Matrida’s dream is to continue her own education.

loans.use: to launch her retail shop

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está esforzándose para poder ser una buena técnico en enfermería, ya que quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Cuando termine su tecnicatura quiere seguir estudiando para poder convertirse en licenciada más adelante y seguir estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Daisy is from the city of Paraguarí. She is making an effort to become a good qualified nurse, since she wants to be able to help other people. When she finishes her vocational training, she wants to continue studying in order to later receive a bachelors degree and to continue studying.
She is requesting this loan in order to cover her university expenses, and to continue her studies as she has done until now.

loans.use: to cover school-related costs.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 22 años, está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad está cursando primer año de la carrera, vive con sus padres, y a la vez que estudia también trabaja para costear sus estudio.
Desea terminar la carrera y desarrollarse como profesional para de esa forma poder ayudarle a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diana is from the city of Paraguarí and is 22 years old. She is studying accounting in her first year of university and lives with her parents. While studying, she is also working in order to pay for tuition. She wishes to complete her degree and grow as a professional in order to support her family.
She is asking for this loan in order to pay her university fees and to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.
